description:
We walked by this place the first night here and thought it looked nice and the smells of the food were great even from outside.  They have some outdoor dining on a busy sidewalk, but they also have tables right along the windows which were full we got there the second night.  The food was very good and came out hot and in a short amount of time.  The staff was friendly and attentive. Prices were reasonable for the area.

I would go back. Reservations are recommended.
author: Mike D.

description:
I have gone to this place a lot over the last 10 years and it was always excellent. I had some friends coming in from Pennsylvania, first time to California and thought I would take them to a good Italian restaurant in North Beach. What a disappointment! I was rather embarrassed because there are so many good places I could have taken them and this wasn't one of them. The food​ and service were​ less than stellar. 
First off when we came in there was only two other tables seated. We came in were greeted and sat quickly. While we looked through the menu our waiter came up to ask for drinks. I got wine and asked about their salads and the portion size. He told me they came on a big plate. Ok, so I asked are they big portions because I was looking for a small salad. He told me they were. So I didn't order a salad. He went and grabbed my wine and came back.  The pour looked very small but I figured it was a big wine glass and it was more an optical illusion. Come to find out it wasn't. As more people came in and got wine they got about 2 times as much as me. 
Then after we order I see a salad come by our table that was a small dinner salad. I asked the waiter what salad that was and he said that it was off the happy hour menu which we never got. So I asked him if we could have it and he said that happy hour ended at 5:30 well it was only 5:20, so I asked for the menu. He looked at me strangely and brought the menu. I asked him what salad that was because on the happy hour menu there were three salads. He told me it was part of the special. I explain to him that the salad on the special was the same salad on the main menu that looks like it could be small. He said I could only get it if I ordered the special.
Now I'm getting a little irritated. I went ahead and ordered the small salad. The table​ bread was stale and dry. Then we got our food. My friends chicken Parmesan came with vegetables, he wanted pasta which was never offered but was an option. We called the waiter back. He took the plate and brought back the pasta. I finally finished my salad and started into my gnocchi. It was undercooked and tasted like flour. After 15 mins of waiting for our waiter to check on us, which he never did and my friends went and found someone to talk to, The refired my Gnocchi, but it was still​​ awful. Won't be going back.
author: Michella F.

description:
Very nice Italian restaurant on Columbus Ave. 
At the entrance to Pinocchio there is a plaque issued by the Italian Government stating quality and authenticity to the restaurant. 
Although I rated a restaurant to 4 stars i really thought that 4.5 stars is more appropriate.

I ordered Chicken Saltimbocca and loved it. It was served with the side of veggies and and potatoes both of which were good. But chicken was delicious.
Pesto Linguine was ok but a little bland. Panini was just the right size and tasty.
Overall a nice experience!!!
author: Risto K.

description:
Outdoor cafe seating on a nice afternoon, watching the world go by on Columbus in North Beach. The setting is enough in itself; the staff made it even more so. 

There's a line of al fresco cafes along Columbus, arguably all doing the same thing at each location. This one is different, a wedge of a building a la NYC Flatiron with options to go sunny or shady on the street in the mid afternoon, depending on which side you choose to sit on. 

The first waitperson recommended the shady side because there would be more to see there - she was absolutely right. Without hitting the menu I asked for a Negroni and some olives. Before they arrived I had two other waitstaff check up on me. I was already rightfully impressed. 

Olives were delicious, lip smacking and finger licking good in fresh herbs and chunks of garlic. My Negroni is best described as fat: big glass, lots of ice, literally overflowing, bitter bitter bitter. If only it was hotter here so the effect could be maximised!

The staff kept checking on me even though I was not committing to a bigger slice of the menu. Other places would have treated me like a red-headed stepchild: not here. 

Big thumbs up from me. I'd seek this place out again just for the service.
author: Richard L.

description:
Came in thanks to rave reviews from one of their diners.

Made reservations with Yelp and came in during Happy Hour time. Pretty soon the place filled with other foodies.

We got the menu and based on previous reviews we've ordered the carpachio. The other first dish was the polenta with mushrooms. Both were delicious!!!

For antre' we've ordered the frutti di mare risotto which ended up being OK, in my opinion.
Second main dish was the Ravioli di Vitello. This one was perfect! Tastefully seasoned.

Location is awesome. The place is a little pricy.
author: Revital K.

description:
What a great place for some amazing home cooked pasta, good wine and just a great, homey place to have lunch while watching the world go by outside.  I was walking by the place and stopped to check out the menu in the window when a friendly lady came out to tell me that the owner is from Sicily and that I really should try their food. 

I thoroughly enjoyed the huge dish of pasta and finished the entire plate as it was irresistible ... it filled me up until the next morning!  The dear old waiter was so sweet and checked on me constantly.  I can't wait to visit San Francisco just so I can go back to this fabulous restaurant.
author: Rima M.

description:
The sign of a good Italian meal.. empty bottle of wine, empty wine glasses, and no leftovers.

My family and I come here a couple times a year. The owners, bartenders, and wait staff are always so happy and attentive. They are the only place we will buy Italian food because it's homemade and high quality. My mom makes such great Italian good I never go to Italian restaurants.

The service here is so excellent- from the owner, to the bartenders and waiters / waitresses. Marco helped us today, on Columbus Day, and he was so patient, attentive, and positive the whole time! Even amidst the chaos!

The owners walk around helping the staff and always with a smile on their faces! Leading by example at its finest!
author: Aliyah H.

description:
I guess they close when they want? I'm from Sacramento and was looking forward to eating here but I guess not! 

I would change the time online so that this doesn't disappoint anyone else.
author: Lexie M.

description: BEST pasta, menu selection, wine list, ambience, bar seating, location, outside seating and genuine Italian service in North Beach!  Simply the BEST!  One of the most beautiful spaces in SF.  Sit outside on a warm day or a cool evening with the heat lamps for a trip to Italia.  This place closes and I MOVE.
author: Lynne P.

description: My husband took me there after seeing the blue Angels fleet week thing by the beach. It's my first time there and definitely won't be the last, the food is truly delicious !  Authentic italian and the flavors are just amazing ! Plus the service was great too, everyone was helpful and nice.  Great experience
author: Jeanie N.

description:
This restaurant was a nice stop in Little Italy.
The ingredients were fresh and the food was tasty. Prices may seem a bit steep, but all in all the flavors were worth the dine-in. They do have Vegetarian and I believe Gluten-free options, so those with Dietary restrictions can enjoy a delicious meal with friends. The staff was also very friendly and constantly checked on us. The environment was very welcoming and overall I will be visiting again.
author: Rashaan C.

description:
One of my favorite Italian places in the Bay Area. After a trip to Italy, I brought my family here and we were impressed by how authentic the taste was. 

The fresh pasta... so yummy. This place is a must for any north beach visit.
author: Ryan P.

description: I'm a big fan of Italian food, so when in San Francisco, North Beach warrants a visit. Now you have so many places to choose from, but how do you pick the best? Trial and error, my friends, trial and error. We went to Pinocchio with my niece who lives in the city and recommended it. Bread was warm and delicious. I had spaghetti bolognese. It was good, but not the best I've ever eaten. Menu is typical Italian. With so many places around North Beach, we will probably try another one next time.
author: Karen L.

description:
Went there with a 5 star review mindset but came out settling for 3.5... 

The service was great, everything was served quickly. But most the actual food and drinks werent as good as i was hoping for. My gin martinis were a little bland, i was hoping my 2nd one would make up for the 1st one but they were both just ok. The calamari had a nice crunch perfectly cooked but not much flavor unless you dipped it in the sauces.

My friend and I shared the entire dinner because we wanted to have variety. The chicken parm and spaghetti were disappointing because i honestly thought their simple dishes should be the easiest to make good impressions with right? Not in this case.

The seafood dish was amazing tho. Fresh seafood, perfect pasta, etc. Just wish the rest of the meal was on the same level.

The tiramisu was my favorite part of dinner and perhaps one of the biggest reasons I would come back here!

I would recommend this place for the good service, nice ambiance, and fabulous seafood. Just get a glass of wine instead because you always know that will be good ;)
author: Margarita V.

description: Great little Italian Restaurant on North Beach. We came here for the first time while walking around North Beach with a group of 10. The food was delicious and the owners were so nice! As we we're leaving, they offered us all a shot of very tasty Limoncello on the house! Will definitely come back here next time we are in the neighborhood!
author: Alex R.

description: Yum yum yummy ! I love my Italian food. And Pinocchio definitely does the job right. Had a power lunch in between meetings and all I gots to say
author: Vika S.

description: This place has great pasta! We got the lunch special on a Thursday - pesto pasta, arabiatta, and another one I don't know how to spell but it's #4. SO good and really fresh. Also great great service and clean place.
author: Nicci M.

description: The best, the staff were excellent and the food incredible. Thank you for the great atmosphere and the Limoncello.
author: Patrick M.

description: Super fresh pasta, had the gnocchi pesto was so good and so soft, then to top it off complimented with the best Manhattan and because I love my sweet things a super chocolate Mousse
author: Claire C.

description: Pinocchio..one of our go to's. I gad eggplant parm, they all three had gnocchi sorentina, bruchetta and polenta con funghi. Italian sodas, and espresso to finish it off. Consistently good. We count on this place to remind us of how bad the food sucks back home. Just solid. Period.
author: Dan W.

description: I can't believe this doesn't have betters reviews, my Italian family loved the food, everything was delicious
author: Santino S.

description:
Loved the food. The gnocchi is light and perfect,  Trust me on this one.
Giovanni, the owner is a North Beach character if you know what I mean.  Full of personality, stories and a love of life that's infectious.
Ask him to sing some opera for you.
We love this place. Order the fresh salmon. They know how to cook fish perfectly.
author: Jim S.

description:
I wouldn't eat here even if you paid me. The owner he thinks his shit dont stink like everyone elses. 
The food sucks and is overpriced. I've tried the gnocchi once and it was basically chewing gum....appalling..
author: Angelo G.

description: If there was an award for the worst food in San Francisco, it would go to Trattoria Pinocchio. I ordered a seafood salad and they put seafood WITH broth on top of the greens, so it was basically soupy greens. Pizza dough resembled more of bread than pizza. No one even asked us how we liked our food because they knew it was inedible. Avoid at all costs.
author: EG P.

description:
I sat at the bar and the bartender, Zabit,  made me an excellent Lemon Drop Martini with house-made Italian limoncello! Just like they do in Italy! (I know only because  spent two months in Florence!) 

Also I'd like to add that I had the bolognese and, OMG, it was as delicious! (Even more so knowing that it wasn't made with veal but only beef!) I appreciate that cooked the pasta perfectly! 

I also I tasted a friend's calabrese (add mushrooms) and it was very tasty! The crust wasn't too thin or thick and the marinara and cheese were of a good quality too!  

Overall it is as a nice meal and worth the visit....and I had a half plate of bolognese leftovers!
author: Crystal P.

description: This is one of my friend's standbys in SF for a meal. They serve pretty classic Italian food. We made a reservation on yelp but they were not too busy while we were there on a weekend night. I liked that they offer a variety of homemade pastas. I got the gnocchi pesto. I don't usually get pesto because I prefer tomato based sauces. Nut they sold me on homemade pesto. The first few gnocchi melted in my mouth like fluffy pillows. It was delicious. The pesto was great. I sopped up a lot of it with the complementary bread. My main complaint is that it's not very texturally diverse so it became harder to eat as I got deeper into the dish. All the gnocchi are the same texture. Though as it got colder, it didn't melt in my mouth as easily. The pesto sauce, while tasty was just saucy. They tried to add texture with pine nuts sprinkled in there but it wasn't enough. That's why I tried to have the bread with the pesto sauce too. Maybe if you were to get this, I would split this and another entrée with someone else. So you could try it but not have to eat a whole plate of it. I tried a bite of the veal lasagna and the chicken parmigiana. Both were good. My bf thought the lasagna was just ok but huge portion so he was stuffed.  And our friend gets his standby spaghetti bolognese. I thought the prices were pricy but average for SF, I suppose.  Service was so-so. We were left alone for a while at the end of meal when we were trying to get drink refills and the check.
author: Alison W.

description: Great, from the home made pasta, to the sauce to the service. There's nothing I didn't like about the trattoria. It was like going on a quick trip to Italy and having to come back way too soon.
author: Natali M.

description:
gf and I got the vegetarian ravioli and the tiramisu. Make sure you get cheese on the ravioli. Both were phenomenal. 

The bread came out warm, but the butter was ice cold! I don't get why a restaurant would do that. I expect that from the dollar menu but not at a high end restaurant.
author: Pavan K.

description: The food was tasty. Our waiter didn't speak English as his first language so he confused our order a bit. We got what we had ordered in the end so all was fine. I had some of the fresh made pasta, it was delicious.
author: Kristin G.

description: Delicious sauces and perfectly cooked pasta.  Friendly helpful wait staff and dog friendly outside seating with heat lamps. Good pour of wine.
author: Casey E.

description: My family and I ate hear last summer and can't wait to visit again this summer. We all ordered different meals and all loved our choices. Service was top notch!
author: Luisa F.

description:
I have two complaint.. I wish the servers/ waiter tell the guests that the sodas are not refillable.. total of 4 refills came out $16... got duped. This happened to me at a different restaurant and didn't inform that the fancy water is not free... I assumed it was free.. 
beware.. the soda refill is $4 per refill. It is a hidden fee.. there are some people that are on a budget 

The bruschetta tomatoes are not fresh.. it lost its flavor and the bread crust was tad hard. 

If I decided to come back again and I hope the server tell the guests that drinks are not refillable and is $4 per refill.
author: Linda C.

description: The only thing this restaurant has going for it is location. Long delay between starters and mains. Food taste is really bad unfortunately. This restaurant it doesn't serve authentic Italian for sure.
author: T O M.

description:
A great little slice of Italy! I had a delicious fettuccini pescatore and my friends had very yummy lasagna and gnocchi. I would absolutely recommend the gnocchi as the best.  It just melts in your mouth. 

In contrast to other reviewers, I did not think the music was too loud. They were playing a mix of Italian music and Celine Dion. And it is quite expensive but the food is worth it. 

The one star off is for the slow service. However it isn't a problem if you have time
author: John P.

description: My wife and I go almost every year to SF for our anniversary. We stayed in the Theatre Dist and was looking for a very good casual Italian restaurant. I found this place on Yelp and it looked good. It wasn't good, it was great. We were promptly greeted and sat at a table for two on the sidewalk, just how we like. The waiter was quick with taking our orders yet friendly like we were weekly regulars. I don't like "over service" and that didn't happen. They were prompt in water our every need without interrupting us in conversation. When we paid our bill he heard us say something about a cab to each other and jogged to the curb and hailed us a cab. If the drinks didn't put a smile on my face the service did for sure. Go here, you won't be sorry.
author: Leonard D.

description:
I did check and reviews before going to this place, but was persuaded to go by a friend who's brother recommended us to go. 

I agree with all the bad reviews of this place... Overpriced... food not so good. But I will say the service was not as bad as others have experienced.
author: Jenniffer C.

description: I listen to a lot of Michale Savage, he mentioned this restaurant. What a fantastic food, it's not too expensive $15-$34 a person, good prices & quality of food is definitely worth it. Parking was crap, it was difficult to find parking in the area. The food was 10/10. I highly recommend it.
author: Alex M.

description: Ate outside tried the fried calamari seafood linguini and the pizza. I would recommend getting a few dishes and sharing, large portion delicious flavors a bit different than normal tastes of Italy, heavy spices and flavors. A bit pricey but well worth the find! Great ppl watching venue and really nice staff and busers turning tables everyday table was full all week-thank you!
author: Annette M.

description: I've traveled across the US, been from the most expensive restaurants to the cheapest ones. I've paid $350 for a steak cut and I've got excellent burgers for $4 dollars with free drink. This is the only place where they have charged me for a refill even for the water, I was so surprised. Even the food truck in the corner of my place gives me free drinks (can drinks). I ordered just a coke and asked for 3 or 4 refills as I got two different plates. When check came I had the first coke plus 4 more. So total of 5 and a water. So 6. Can you believe that? What owner charges for a refill and water bro?  I went just because I was recommended with the food which was ok. No signs anywhere about refills being charge. Not coming back never and if you read this don't go there, will feel same way for sure. Keep walking you'll find another restaurant.
author: Camilo C.

description: Had a terrible experience. I've been here prior to this last visit. Ugh so not worth  What happened to the quality and flavor I came back for. The spaghetti sauce tasted sour like it had gone bad. The seafood soup tasted of old fish, smelled super fishy. I'm a seafood lover but this tasted bad fishy. Not like fresh food at all. 2 starts because the service was good.
author: yorlan c.

description:
Food was decent, but it's way overpriced. Soda was $3.95 with no refills. The waiter didn't even tell me that until I received the bill charging me for 2 drinks ($7.90).

Service was minimal despite the fact that only 2 tables (including us) were seated for most of my meal. Definitely wouldn't go back or recommend.
author: Yehia F.

description: A good Italian restaurant in San Fran.  While it looks a bit juvenile with the Pinocchio decor, etc., the food was very good.  The service was better during the week versus on Friday.
author: Chris C.

description: Awesome...cool employees, great food, and good italien feel...what the hell else do you want?
author: John M.

description: My friend and I went ther for dinner one night and we had a great evening.  The food was excellent and the staff were very friendly. This restaurant felt cozy and welcoming. I can't wait to go back on my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Odin H.

description: This was one of many meals celebrating my birthday. I always heard positive things about Pinocchio on a nationwide talk show host's radio program so wanted to give it a try.  Phenomenal and tasty food!  The view of passerby's was great and the place was clean. We sat inside and received excellent service.
author: Brad B.

description:
Pinocchio's is our favorite spot in North Beach. Upon arrival, my husband and I are reminded of just why with the charm of the Italian decor and the aromas of authentic Italian foods coming from the kitchen. The owner, Chef Giovanni and the staff remember us and always welcome us like old friends.  

The food here is simply addicting. When short on time, we pop in for at least an appetizer of Bruschetta or the Polenta con Funghi. There is a nice selection of wines and signature cocktails. (My guilty pleasure is the Limoncello Lemon Drop.) 

The homemade pastas are absolutely delicious. My husband's favorite dish is the Ossobuco. As for me, I especially enjoy the Chicken Parmigiana.

If you are looking for an authentic Italian meal with a warm atmosphere and excellent service you will not be disappointed!
author: Shona M.

description: This place is amazing. Good food, good drinks, great ambiance. But the best part is Zabit. What a wonderful bartender and person. My husband and I came in for one drink and ended up staying for three hours, all because of this awesome man. Thank you, Zabit, for a wonderful experience!!! We will definitely be back.
author: Melissa S.

description: Great food. Nice waiter. Sat out on street enjoyed people watching. True north beach restaurant
author: Adam V.

description: Came for lunch and probably one of the most amazing meals I have had at a restaurant in a long time. Food is fresh and the owner works hard to keep it original. Fresh homemade pasta is excellent and you can taste it in every bite. Not sure why this place doesn't have 5 star review every time but it's not for lack of trying....
author: Biren S.

description: Came on the night of SantaCon.  I didn't eat but some friends, did. Seemed like a cool little spot.
author: Lisa F.

description: We were walking looking for a different restaurant but the aroma of this restaurant made us change our mind and I'm glad we did because the staff is super friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered pizza and the Chile pasta.
author: Mary A.

description: Sorry but not every Italian restaurant is created equal. The staff here lied to me about how one dish can serve two people. It's really not true. You get so less for so much. I wanted to try something new and boy I was not satisfied. The portions given are really disappointing. A lunch special with soup? The soup bowl is no bigger than the bowls in my house. If you want large portions go to Capos down the street. Don't come here if you have no clue what place serves the best Italian food. They will take advantage if you are a person who splurges rather than I however love the rustic charge this place comes with. Feels like I am in Naples. Most of the food is homemade but not in the sense that I want. I did not realize I was off to a bad start when eating in North Beach for the first time.
author: Michael W.

description:
I have eaten at this establishment prior to today and enjoyed good food.
However, today the food was horrible all the dishes we ordered were substandard as the service. Polenta was mush-I was raised eating polenta and order every time we see on any menu usually it is cut pieces.
Bolognese sauce is red not brown..
Must have changed cooks to someone not familiar with the Italian cuisine.
Would not recommend.....
author: Sandi G.

description: Consistently good. This kitchen does everything well. We order carry-out often and they are very accommodating. You can't go wrong here.
author: Lee P.

description: This seems like the perfect spot to dine al fresco and people watch. True to Italian form, service is crawling. I forgot that most of my meals in Europe took about 2 hours. They boast freshly made pasta, so we had linguine Alfredo and angel hair with pesto and chicken. Both of the pastas didn't have much flavor, and the pesto was ALL olive oil. I enjoyed the atmosphere, but the meal was overpriced and overrated.
author: Ha D.

description:
As I walked past this restaurant a lovely service-oriented host stopped me to tell me about her amazing pasta lunch specials for $17. I'm a local and wasn't going for a nice meal, but I genuinely liked her, it's a sunny Sunday and there was an available table outside. I was in!

Server: Sparkling or still?
Me: Sparkling?
Server: "What can I get for you?"
Me: "I'll have the pasta lunch special -- gnocchi."
Server: "Soup or salad?"
Me: "Salad"

The blasting music was not my favorite, but it was for the tourists so, ok. 

The meal came, an unspectacularly measly few pieces of lettuce for a salad, dry, hard bread, and pretty good gnocchi. Ok. I'm okay with it. It's a $20 meal + tax and tip, I'm guessing. The top of what I wanted to pay for a spontaneous meal on my own.

Um... the bill came, and it was over $40 with tip. $22 for the pasta, nearly $9 for sparkling water. BAIT & SWITCH. When I questioned him, it didn't quite make sense, but I think it had to do with me ordering a salad???? Even though I was clear I wanted the special.

I feel had, like an unsuspecting tourist that just got taken with the bait and switch. Never again.
author: Wendy N.

description:
Two words: Veal lasagna. Literally everyone in my table got this dish, and none of us regretted is. Lots of sauce, a good portion of lasagna, and a whole lot of wonderful flavor. My boyfriend is Italian and said it reminded him of his grandmother's veal which is a mighty compliment. 

Service was nice, we had to ask for refills here and there but not the end of the world.
author: Kristen T.

description: Stopped in for dinner tonight. The food is very good the service was slow at start, then improved. Our server was very nice. The menu does not have a lot of options, however our selected meals were very good. The wine selection by the glass was minimal. I was not happy. If you want to order a bottle, the selection is huge.  I gave the restaurant four stars due to limited wines availability for glasses.
author: JJ M.

description: Everything about this restaurant is fabulous!! From the wine to the pasta to the service. Excellent all the way around! Everyone makes you feel like family :)
author: Maria A.

description:
This is a great restaurant to sit outside and take in the streets of San Francisco! With the Transamerica Tower as a backdrop we enjoyed a great lunch here. The Gnocchi was awesome, the bruschetta was also terrific. Service was great. Really happy to have found it, and would return again when in the area.

"Toodle-oo, Stromboli"
Jiminy Cricket
author: Lou G.

description:
WINE-- half bottle Cambria $25 scampi $28.95
Limoncello $8 gelato $6
Not sure if the scampi was frozen--it had a slight fishy taste. But the lemon caper garlic sauce was really nice. It's too expensive for what you get, but no line on a Sunday night. Spaghetti on the side was good. Service was excellent, loved the limoncello & vanilla icecream. The price is just tooooooooooo high for what you actually get.
C'mon owners--- bring it down to reasonable.
This meal for 1 person cost $76.12 not including tip AND IT WAS A RIPOFF
author: Scott F.

description: Great food! Awesome service! I ordered the chicken Alfredo in the pink sauce and it was delicious, my friend ordered sausage ravioli and loved it as well. Very pleased with the experience.
author: Victoria M.

description: Great place to have dinner with friends!  Authentic Italian atmosphere, excellent food, perfect size wine list with a good selection!  Party of 7 everyone remarked on the great food and service by our waiter, Antonio!  Here on business and hoping to go back again before we leave
author: Mary Jo F.

description: We just got back from San Francisco, visiting our daughter and son-in-law which we do every Columbus Day. This year we had an unbelievable experience having dinner on the street during the Columbus Day Parade with our new friends at Trattoria Pinocchio's. The owners were incredibly generous, lovely people and we will never forget them. God willing, next year we're all healthy we will be there again, because no one can make you feel like family like the owners Maria and Giovani from Trattoria Pinochio. All our love to them from Chicago.
author: Paul S.

description:
Well pull my puppet strings! 

Don't ask if there's a Pinocchio doll here, because there isn't, I already asked.

As for the food, I've only had one thing here, the Linguine al Pesto Giovanni
(housemade basil, pine nuts, parmigiano & garlic sauce), and it was delicious.

Rich, creamy garlic minced with basil.

Came here in the spur of the moment because I was beginning to look like the Walking Dead going without lunch or breakfast when I spotted this place.

Saw the menu, checked Yelp to make sure, and went.

Solid pasta dish.

No lie.

See, my nose isn't growing.
author: Jack R.

description: I had basic pasta w/ bolognese that took an hour. Not very busy at 3pm but the kitchen was "backed up". Service was totally in the weeds. The food was decent but the service was horrible.
author: David C.

description: The restaurant itself is warm and cozy with cute decor, and the staff is all very friendly and welcoming. The service was good and prompt. But the food was amazing. My mother and sister both had different gnocchi dishes and say it was the best gnocchi they've ever had. My butternut squash pasta was fresh and delicious. I would definitely recommend this place!!
author: Elodie A.

description:
Veal.  Aways happy to see many veal choices on a menu for us Meat-a-terians!

 The owner is a great Italian aria singer! So livens-up any meal. 

Nice selection of Italian red wines. Fun after drink choices.  Tasty espresso!

Grazie Trattoria Pinocchio!!!!!
author: Nat D.

description: I had the Spagetti alla Bolognese and it was to die for! Sauce was perfect and pasta was amazing. After that we had coffee with cannolis and their signature tiramisu. They make their own cannoli filling and it showed!! That was one of the best cannolis I've ever had and cannolis are my favorite dessert. I'm still having dreams about the tiramisu, it's their signature dish for a reason!
author: Grace H.

description: Decent little REAL italian place....no complaints!!!!
author: Elena B.

description: I should have checked the reviews before I went here on a freezing July 4th holiday I was trawling through North Beach looking for some pesto pasta. After spending over a $100 bucks including tip I could have spent that same amount at a place with better food although the service was very nice the food was mediocre. The clams and mussels were in a very small portion and the value of the meal was not at that price point.
author: N A.

description:
I decided to stop in North Beach after working to grab dinner.  I'm not from the City but appreciate that I live less than an hour from a world renowned tourist attraction, having been world traveled myself.  While walking up the street I noticed many restaurants were crowded and this place had open tables, score!  Well if you'd noticed I gave one star I'm getting to that.  The service was prompt, food was great, I'm including a photo of my dinner, of which half went home because the portions were generous, so this begs why ONE STAR?  The waiter has a mouth on him.  While the table behind me was from Australia he was trying to make conversation with them which was making reference to portable/mobile credit card readers and how Europe is so advanced having created them he can't understand why we don't have them.  I guess he doesn't know San Jose (otherwise known as Silicon Valley) is less than 50 miles south of San Francisco, I digress, I know you're following along.  Now let's move onto the unprofessional portion of the evening which turned this 5 Star review into 1 Star.  Ignoring all the nonsense banter is what I intended as I didn't come for conversation I came for dinner.  We've eaten, food was yummy, I'm pleased ready to leave and even patronize again and then our waiter starts in with political conversation with the hostess.  People this is a SMALL establishment they are loud.  Their conversation starts out with already not so bright waiter saying "all the people in the middle of the country between the coasts are IGNORANT" you know because they're voting for Trump.  And thank God California is so progressive because we can't have "those" people running things.  I can get into further detail but I'll try not to keep you much longer.  Needless to say that ruined my experience.  Lumping together basically the 40 states as ignorant from this true idiot is NO different than being racist or a bigot except well that might be fashion all since it jives with media coverage.  I made a point to let both of them know their loud conversation was inappropriate and unappreciated.  While at work serving the public keep your political comments to yourself and your locker room talk to yourself. 

Now to the management and owners of this establishment, I would have an immediate sit down with all your employees on how they need  to behave and converse about anything that could be deemed inappropriate in a work place that serves the public.

For the record I am not voting for either candidate but I am offended that a whole group of MILLIONS of "ignorant" citizens are being demeaned.  As I am equally offended that we have open season on law enforcement officers, our choice of candidates are a rhino republican with womanizing tendencies and an otherwise belongs in prison Hillary for her "naïveté" for not knowing what classified means.

Please!  Enough - sometimes people just want to eat the steak and move on!
author: Marianne A.

description: This lunch time sandwich was forgettable, I was here 12-2015 lol but this meal was so boring I couldn't even finish the review. Dry sandwich. Server seemed new, didn't even take our drink orders. Food seemed ok, but my meal was lack luster.
author: Coco J.

description:
A spider with extremely long legs fell onto my head and then fell into my soup. Need I say more? No, but I will because I understand that there are things that the restaurant cannot completely control. Though, I think most people would give this place 1-2 stars just for that harrowing experience.

We were exploring Little Italy on Saturday and came across this place only because it was centrally located and all the good spots like Molinari Deli had long lines. Trattoria Pinocchio had a few tables outside that overlooked the hustle and bustle of Columbus Street. Since it was a pretty day, we decided to sit outside. They have heaters outside which is great because I get cold very easily.

Anyways, I ordered the Pinot Grigio ($8) which was pretty good, and my friend ordered the Sangiovese ($8) which tasted like it had been opened for too long. When my friend brought it to the waiter's attention, he said that it was a new bottle. The waiter did not offer to pour her another glass or to get him another wine that was more to her liking. 

I ordered the corn soup ($8) and loved it! The only downside was that a spider fell into it. When I told the waiter, he seemed very indifferent. He didn't offer to bring me a new soup. I had to ask him if he could bring me another soup that did not have a spider in it. 

There are so many other great places in Little Italy; I will bite the bullet next time and wait in the long lines to get a table. Otherwise, I might end up at a mediocore restaurant with a spider in my soup. Lesson learned!
author: Tien L.

description: Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Great margherita pizza and wine list.
author: Alec S.

description:
5 Stars for 5 solid reasons.

My brother and I were in North Beach after watching the Fleet Week Air Show. We were walking back to the Caltrain Station (yes, a LONG detour) and decided to stop somewhere for a glass of wine. After passing a few restaurants that just didn't look inviting, we stumbled on Trattoria Pinocchico. There were no cute tables available outside so we found 2 stools at the bar and ordered 2 glasses of Pino. Unfortunately the wine I wanted was not available so we were offered a very nice  Sangiovese. The pour was hearty and the entertainment behind the bar kept us there for dinner. 

I'm guessing the character behind the bar was the owner and honestly ... he made our experience one we won't forget and can't wait to come back to enjoy again. Sarcasm, silly, old school, honest, engaging and passionate. These are only a few reasons we fell in love with this Sicilian man who is way bigger than life. His energy and spirit were addicting and so much fun to watch him interact with other guests. So you get that I enjoyed his "Entertaining" personality, but the food was even better!!

We ordered: 

Gnocchi Enzo: light, fluffy potato dumplings covered in a delicious gorgonzola cream sauce. Sinful and decadent and I want more!

Tortellini Bolognese: homemade pasta made with love smothered in a rich, mouthwatering meat sauce that you know was someone's grandmother's recipe. 

Needless to say my brother and I licked our plates completely clean. This is a place I would be addicted to and proud to be called a regular at if I lived in the City. I'll be back again and again for sure. 

5 star justification:
1. Engaging owner
2. Beautiful setting
3. Fantastic Food
4. Reasonable pricing
5. Italian accents ... need I say more?
author: Christie B.

description:
Food poisoning from the linguine with clams.

Otherwise acceptable, veal piccata was good but small portion.
author: Manisha P.

description: I just showed up for my reservation...and the restaurant appears to have burned down.    Honestly, it did not meet my expectations.
author: Jennifer C.

description: My dad was visiting me here in San Francisco and we almost always get Italian food. We wanted to try a new restaurant different from the usually places we go to so we walked around Little Italy for somewhere to eat. I'm glad we came across this place because it was really good! My dad got a lunch special with soup and pasta with anchovies. I got fettuccine alfredo with chicken and veggies and it was amazing. Their complementary bread is served warm and with various things to pair it with such as olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and butter. I will be returning soon with some friends!
author: Korra B.

description: No flavor, very plain and salty pizza. Over priced. Tourist trap!!! The waiter is very annoying with his way of "saying" English with a fake Italian accent. That is just TOO MUCH!!! Stop it arrrgh!!!
author: Kate H.

description: Ate her with my 13 year old daughter and her two friends for dinner on a Friday night. Greeted warmly when we entered. Daughters gnocchi was excellent. So was the pesto and the pasta mare. I had the lemon chicken. Although the sauce was flavorful, the two pieces of checks were so thin that they lacked any real flavor. No marinade nor caramelization to add depth. My guess is this is so the chicken can be used in whatever is ordered and cuts down waste. Opted for the vegable side rather than pasta - one piece of broccoli, a few baby carrots (some cut, others not), and a few random pieces of potato and zucchini. Not sure why the veggies were so lacking. Also, the bread was bland. I feel like roils from Trader Joe's are infinitely better. I would come back for pasta dishes, not the chicken anything.
author: Natalie P.

description:
We love this place! 

We came a little late after a business conference, and they were more than accommodating and super friendly. Our server, Jimmy, was knowledgeable and great. The wine was excellent. The food was out of this world. super authentic and gave us a great Italian feel. If in San Fran, you should check it out, you wont regret it. :)
author: Sarah S.

description: Family dinner here, and it was pretty good.  We had the Polenta with Mushrooms as an appetizer and it was very good.  Veal Parmesan, and husband had Pesto Fettuccini and we asked to add some shrimp.  Both dishes were solid, and relatively good.  The ambiance in the restaurant is very Italian, and loud.  Drinks were good also.  Overall, a very nice experience and a place we will be back to again.
author: M. R.

description:
The best Penne Arrabiata I've had! The dish was ACTUALLY spicy as it is meant to be, and had a nice kick. Many Italian restaurants lack the spicy factor. The sauce was delicious and flavourful! 
Our group had the calamari as an appetiser, which was a solid choice. The service was attentive and polite. The restaurant has an authentic Italian feel, with music and some singing during dinner hours. Parking was hard to find, but where in the city isn't it? I'm very happy with this dining choice, and will be returning on my next visit to San Francisco!
author: Kristie N.

description: My favorite spot in North Beach!  Best Linguine Vongole in town.  Even though they technically don't have it with a marinara sauce on the menu, I'm always able to order it special with a marinara "fra diavolo" and it's to die for every time.  Great home-like atmosphere, and the owner is fantastic-really cares about his clientele.  Last time my wife were there, he actually started serenading (quite well actually) in lieu of music playing.  Highly recommend!
author: Sean R.

description: We have eaten here on several trips to San Francisco. The service is great and the food is excellent.
author: Missy J.

description: My favorite restaurant in the city. Don't let the location fool you: it's not a tourist trap, it's legit Italian food. The pasta dishes are amazing.
author: Jake R.

description:
Great dinner spot! Love their seasonal specials (butternut squash ravioli, house made pappardelle with saffron cream sauce to name a couple). And their lasagna, whoa, out of this world amazing. When tomatoes are in season, the bruschetta is a must. Every thing we have had here is so amazing. 

It is classic North Beach service, these aren't people that dote on you hand and foot, they are enjoyable and friendly staff passionate about getting you delicious food and drink. They also have house made limoncello - so good.
author: Elena R.

description:
It's ok. We were trying to go to Tony's when we found out they were closed on Tuesday's. We ended up here looking for pizza and a salad. I think for a basic non-meat Cesar they charge waaaay too much (even for San Fran). I feel their prices are high because they are trying to afford to stay open. Pizza was good but greasy. 

Service wasn't awesome. The guy taking care of us had 4 tables and was overwhelmed. 

I may or may not be back. It was ok.
author: Susan H.

description: Ossobuco & pizza was OK, go down the street to Tony's for the same price you get 2 awesome awesome pizza.  Tony's has cooking class for $5000 per class.
author: Homer D.

description: We've been here for lunch and my noodles weren't that hot anymore but nevertheless good and al dente. The Montepulciano was a bit light and didn't worth it's 10 bucks. It's ok for everyone who is not European and doesn't have a high standard when it comes to Italian kitchen, but if you wanna have authentic Italian food there are other places that are far better!
author: Annika H.

description:
Tonight was our last night in SF, and we were jones-ing for Little Italy after walking through yesterday after riding the trolley. The atmosphere was inviting and we had a perfect booth/table that felt private but great for taking in the action.

We started with a Caesar salad that was the best I've had in a while - heavy on parmesan and just the right amount of bite. For main course, we shared 3 entrées between the 4 of us:

1) Ravioli stuffed with sausage in cream sauce. DIVINE

2) Penne with pancetta in light red sauce - wonderful.

3) Pepperoni pizza. Rivaled Tony's. Seriously good

We then capped it with a piece of Tiramisu that was light and flavorful, and enjoyed a bottle of Sangiovese throughout.

The owner (?) was serenading a group next to us with his singing - felt very authentic! 

Highly recommend.
author: Ryan G.

description:
My hubby and I had decided that we wanted to have Italian food, so we decided to head to Little Italy. One of the nice things about SF is that many restaurants have their menus outside, which helps with selecting the restaurant. 

Outside of Trattoria Pinocchio was a menu at a glance I can see a few things that we can select from. The restaurant is really nice, they have a bar, sitting area inside as well as outside. 

We went with the fried calamari, which was really good, in fact one of the best ones we had ever had. I ordered the Cioppino, which both my boyfriend and I really liked.What we liked about Cioppino was that the seafood tasted really fresh! I am a huge seafood fan, so this was definitely a plus. He ordered the Cotoletta alla Milanese he thought it was good. His meat was very thin and the pasta that it came with was ordinary, nothing special. 

I would definitely go back to this place specifically for the Cioppino. Their seafood menu is not too extensive, so I am definitely looking forward to trying some of the other dishes. I will just make sure that this time around he selects something better. (I am not a fan of meats).

*As far as the service goes it was good, but this is considering the fact that the restaurant was not busy at all.*
author: Alondra J.

description: Everything was perfect. I was with my friends visiting from Italy after walking Columbus avenue and looking at all the menus  from all the restaurants .. My friends said this was the most authentic and not fake Italian restaurant so we went in. Seated right away . They loved the decor. Our waiter was very attentive. We ordered the formaggio platter as a appetizer. It was delicious. We also ordered pesto linguine, aglio & olio pasta, rigatoni bolognese and marguerite pizza. Everything was gorgeous and delicious.   Service was excellent. People watching was fun and our Italian friends said they felt at home there.  I will be back. Delicioso!!!!!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Stay away!

I ordered a the Filet and they couldn't do medium rare at all! Went with a Calzone and it came back cold in the middle. 

Also the prices on the menu are NOT the prices you'll be charged. Watch the receipt.
author: Brandon H.

description: Um, once again yelp has failed us. We read the positive reviews and thought that we would be enjoying and excellent lunch on a cold and rainy San Fran afternoon, but instead we had an overpriced and bland experience followed by a hefty bill that in no way was justified. Eggplant parm was extremely flavorless and the lasagna was mediocre at best. I would definitely expect more especially since the prices were high. Would not return.
author: M F.

description:
Finally visited this lovely corner trattoria out after a 2nd hand recommendation from Mike Savage. Glad we did!

It truly rocked. Food is made with love and absolutely traditional and delicious. Walnut cream sauce, house caesar dressing, veal - this is REAL food, y'all. Enjoy!
author: Jessica P.

description: I came to Trattoria Pinocchio tonight with gift cards that the establishment would not accept, due to the manager claiming the gift cards (signed and distributed by the restaurant) were expired. California law states that gift cards cannot expire. I explained this to my waiter, who said the orders were from the manager. I then spoke on the phone with Giuseppe, the manager, who was extremely rude to me and would not honor the gift cards, thus breaking the law. Guiseppe's argument was "Are you a lawyer?" Even though the law not only applies to lawyers, but all those within the state. I did not eat there after that, but I can't imagine having a pleasant experience there whatsoever with a person as rude and ignorant to the law as Guiseppe was. The gift card was also only for $25 and could not even cover the full cost of an entree at the overpriced restaurant. Instead I had a pleasant and economic meal at Pasta Pop-Up down the road. Please, if you are going to eat here, bring a coupon and see for yourself.
author: Niko C.

description:
We recently visited the great restaurant during a trip to San Francisco. It was a fantastic experience. Great food, great wine and great service. We split an order of Eggplant Parm and a large salad. The eggplant was superbly prepared and the spaghetti tasted homemade.

Delicious "drop in" restaurant experience in Little Italy!
author: Roland H.

description:
The caprese salad was very good, though not the best i've had. the tomatos were a bit firm. and not beefsteak or heirlooms. The mozzarella however, was above average quality (though it was no buratta), and the basil seemed as though it were picked that day.

 GF got the bolognese, which was out of control awesome. 

My Lobster ravioli with scallops were pretty good, though the pink champaign sauce is very light. The scallops were brilliant and nicely marinated in a rich lemon butter.

All in all I would say that north beach italian food leans on the lighter side. Which is good, but at the same time when i crave italian food i want something insanely rich, decadent, and satisfying. Pinocchio falls just an eyelash short of my expectations.
author: Peter T.

description: I took.my Mom.here for dinner for her 83rd Birthday...The staff was AMAZING, and the food choices we so great...thank you very much!!!!
author: Les G.

description: This place is absolutely amazing. We were wondering around the city looking for a good place to eat. The wife of the owner saw us looking at the menu and pulled us in. We had an appetizer. We had to come back for dinner. The pasta is made fresh daily. My dish and my husband's dish were to die for. Cooked al dente perfect! We have lived in Italy so we love their food. The service was impeccable. Kitchen is open. And lastly the owner is a jolly fellow that makes sure your dinner is going perfect. Just a superb experience.
author: Karmi J.

description: We love this place. The owner is super sweet and sings to you. The food is great and the atmosphere terrific.
author: Kristen N.

description:
The first night in San Francisco we walked around our hotel and explored the area.  After walking through little Italy and Chinatown we were ready to eat.  Trattoria Pinocchio had a healthy crowd of people eating, both inside and outside, but had open tables.  The service was snappy and the food was just what we were looking for.  They have a pretty large menu but we settled on linguini pescatore for my wife and sausage ravioli in mushroom sauce for me.  They didn't have any sort of kids menu so we shared our plates with our daughter and also started with an order of calamari.  The calamari was ok, could have used some more salt.  The entrees were very good and my wife couldn't stop talking about the prefect cook on all her seafood.  
I would have probably gone with 5 stars but... they automatically included a 15% gratuity on the check.  I left $4 on top to bump it up to 20% but I think this is a super underhanded move, I'm really leaning towards 3 stars for that.
author: Randy M.

description:
Loved it. The staff was DELIGHTFUL. Sat us at a four top even though we were only two and gave us a nice table with a view

We both ate off the seasonal menu. The fish was to die for and butternut squash ravioli was excellent. 

Only thing that was not awesome was bread. Not sure it was fresh - basic Italian. Also don't like butter in a wrapped packet - prefer fresh. 

Other than that it was AMAZING and so glad we stopped in.
author: Jill H.

description: Fun atmosphere and potential for romantics exist. Did wine espresso cheese and fruit plate and a wide sampling off of menu.
author: Ken L.

description: My co-worker claims that their veal lasagna is better than the one she makes at home and she is Italian. Unfortunately I couldn't try it because I don't eat veal but apparently the cheese that was used knocked her socks off.   I tried their minestrone soup as well as bruschetta and both were excellent.  The restaurant is very traditional if you sit inside but outside seating offers good people watching.
author: Monica G.

description: We visited San Francisco  and stumbled upon this quaint restaurant.   The people are wonderful and so easy to talk to.   We sat at the bar  and Zabit was wonderful.    He catered to us and made us feel at home.   Food was exquisite and Jimmy was entertaining to us Bostonians.  A must to try is the lemoncello  and  tirsmisu. .. we visited 3 times.   Well worth it
author: Donna L.

description:
Great service, nice atmosphere. Ate here on Saturday evening around 8:15.. 5/14/16.

Sat outside at 3 different tables- we had a party of 11. The outside seats were a bit uncomfortable, but it was fun anyway.

There was a section in the restaurant that was empty but had a reserved note on the table..but within our almost 2 hours there, no one showed up for that table section.. no biggie. We had loads of fun watching all the tourists and locals walk by.  (we are locals, but still had fun!)

The menu has your normal Italian faves.. antipasto, spaghetti (incl. gluten free), pizzas, sandwiches, salads, etc etc

I got the coppa sandwich. The coppa was old and tasted "off". I even had my sister try the coppa and she said it was "..baaaaaad....." I told the waiter and he tried to tell me "That's how it's supposed to taste.."  I kinda laughed and said, "nooooo, I KNOW what coppa should taste like and this is not it.."  Mind you, I'm 100% Italian and the one thing I do know is coppa... Anyway, he was nice enough to bring out a prosciutto sandwich which was 100Xs better and super fresh.  I also had an antipasto plate which was wonderful.. Next time, I'm just going to get that- prosciutto, roasted peppers, tomato and fresh mozzarella, breaded eggplant, artichoke hearts, olives, pepperonicini...

The sis had a 4 topping pizza, said it was great..
Others had: pea soup (delish), paparadelle pasta w/meat sauce (delish)..other pasta/ravioli dishes were enjoyed by all..

I was really happy with the service.. Our waiter was always at our tables asking if we needed anything. And, when we need refills or whatever, they were there and responding quickly!

Also, had a coffee after dinner at the counter. Barista was nice and made me the perfect latte.
author: Mary C.

description: Food was okay, but way overpriced. $18 for Fettuccini Alfredo, no veggies, no protein. Literally just noodles and Alfredo sauce for $18. A well vodka soda was $8.50. Service was very poor. Our waiter was rude. What was great, however, was the busboy Luis. So sweet, personable, accommodating and welcoming!!!! Won't come back to this restaurant, but want to thank Luis for all his hard work and attention.
author: Kel F.

description:
I've lived in SF a while now & I've explored many ambiances that make up the diverse pallet of fast to fine dining in North Beach.
The warm flirtatious vibe of Pinochios was a great place to start a diverse group of visitors. Substantial dishes with a basic authentic flavor pleased everyone. I left feeling like family and they left feeling spoiled. 
Our timing was off at the end, but overall, in good company, we communicated, laughed,  and had a true authentic experience .

Molto Buono
author: jennifer d.

description: Such a good restaurant! We wandered down to Little Italy to see what we could find and this looked like one of the best! The hostess greeted us out front and was super friendly and we got to sit outside which was so relaxing. They have a lot of vegetarian options, which is always a plus. We ordered one of the seasonal appetizers which was amazing and also a pizza which was super fresh and delicious. Our waiter was amazing and friendly and our entire experience was fantastic! We would definitely recommend and would come back here again!
author: Addy C.

description: We were a group of 20 people.  We did the pre-fixe menu.  Service was excellent.  The food moved quickly from kitchen to table.  The staff were continually busing the tables and refilling Bellini and water carafes.  They were friendly, efficient and the food was wonderful!   You can't beat the price!!!  A great value.  Our group had a wonderful time and enjoyed ourselves from start to finish!!!
author: Noah W.

description: We just happened to stumble across this little gem on a jog. We where seated outside and had some octopus and wine. The food was fresh and delicious. Our server a older gentleman was great. Prices for the portions are good also.
author: Shaneel R.

description: Don't why, but my wife and I love this place. Could be the good food, could be the friendly and courteous service. Probably both. We're always treated like old friends when we come in and have never had a bad meal. And there's always something good on the wine list. We especially enjoy sitting outside on a nice day having lunch and people-watching on the Columbus Ave side. This is *not* a snooty foodie restaurant - it's a cool, funky little North Beach trattoria that serves very good food with great service. And now I know why my wife and I love this place!
author: Steve K.

description: Best Trattoria in San Francisco. They offer gluten fee pasta that was fantastic with just plain marinara. Pomodoro is a go to. All the wait staff are wonderful and the owner is fabulous.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: We were hungry after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon, and this place was within walking distance.  We had the fried calamari, and it had good flavor.  My bf wanted the chicken parmigiana, and he thought it was ok (he's from Boston so I think it is hard to compare to the good East coast food he grew up with), but I thought it was ok too.  Service was ok too.  They interrupted our conversation kind of rudely a couple times, and they seemed to focus their customer service energy on a table of Italian girls near us.  Plus, they did not bring us water even after we asked a couple times.  In fact, we had to pour our own water from a pitcher next to us instead - yeah, customer service was just ok.  I'm not sure I'd come back based on our overall dining experience.
author: Maile N.

description: Lio was an amazing server and made lunch so entertaining along with the Brazilian host outside. Food is great. I had Italian friends visiting from Italy and took them to North Beach for food. They said this is the most authentic restaurant and menu was closest to Italy. Servers are so energetic and made eating hysterical. Totally recommend and they try to speak whatever language you speak. Brought a Norwegian friend with me today and Lio talked a lot with her about Scandinavian countries. The pizza is delicious and sauce is good. The linguine Palermo was delicious as well if you like seafood. Overall, the experience was wonderful and I will be back to have a delicious meal and to talk to servers.
author: Gabriella J.

description: Husband and I stumbled across this place as we were walking through North Beach last weekend. We went here for a late lunch. The host was very friendly as we browsed the menu from the sidewalk, so we decided to try the place. I ordered the smoked salmon panini and my husband had the spaghetti bolognese. The panini, which was served with a side salad was good and my husband enjoyed his pasta dish. Service here was ok overall.
author: Molly A.

description:
Heads up with this restaurant the food is nothing special but along with this the service is terrible. As soon as we arrived at 9:35pm the waiter gave us a smirk and threw his napkins and forks on the table. The cleaning guy brought a chair and toast it at our table in distain, I guess because they wanted to leave early. The waiter that served my group must be getting paid a lot or he's the owners son because he treated us like we din't belong and in such a hurry. Along with this as we were eating the waiters and the bartender were arguing and calling each other bad words (fuck you!) out loud. What were they fighting about you may ask, well the waiters were accusing the bartender of steeling, they went through the waiters bag 4 feet away from us, ( mind you we were the last customers in and the restaurant is huge in an L shape). This is our families 5th day on vacation in San Fransisco and we eat out 3 times a day! This place has been the worst restaurant we've ever been to!
 If your expecting a nice place to come eat great food and enjoy the atmosphere, you won't find it here.

Lastly to add insult to aggravation this place has the balls to add 18% gratuity!!! 

We didn't even get an apology for all the Bs fighting while we were eating. 

Believe me if I had the option of selecting a zero star on Yelp I would be choosing it.
author: Oscar C.

description:
This review is overdue. My wife and I have had special gatherings at Pinocchio's in the past. So when we had an event to go to in San Francisco at the beginning of July we jumped at the chance to visit one of our favorite Italian restaurants.
 
When we entered it was 8:50pm and there was a total of 4 tables occupied and one person sitting at the bar picking up a to-go order.  The hostess passed empty tables to end up offering us one directly across from the entrance into the kitchen. When asked if we can move to another table she told us they were for bigger parties, but reluctantly moved us to a table across from the bar.

Mariano greeted us, served water and took our order.  Basically we didn't see him again until the bill came. The antipasto salad, veal parmesan and gnocchi were good.  However the bruschetta starter was an icy mixture on top of tasteless toast. 

Shortly after we ordered,  a bridal shower party of 10 arrived. Their waiter is the one who brought us our entree while juggling his bridal party as well as his other 2 tables.  I wish I would have gotten his name but we were sitting there in shock and disbelief at the service.
Where was Mariano? He was hanging out at the front door with the unenthusiastic hostess and a mystery staff? manager (wearing a track suit)?

This mystery staff/manager/ was not only friends with our waiter Mariano, but he must be pretty high up in the Trattoria Pinocchio world.  He waltzed through the restaurant from the kitchen area, to behind the bar tasting various draft beers then back to the front door to hang out with Mariano all the while twirling his white earbuds. Walking past tables and waitstaff with about a foot of his earbud cord twirling and swinging it around.

I could go on and but typing this review and reliving the awful experience is exhausting.
Bottom line is that the next time in San Francisco I will find another Italian restaurant to spend my time and money at. Never again will we return or recommend this place.
author: Dave B.

description:
Our fifth stop on the North Beach food tour. We tasted a penne pasta dish that was the penne arrabbriata.  The taste of the sauce was not spicy, but very light and pleasant.  It also tasted simple and clean.  Not too spicy, but just enough tomato and flavoring to make the pasta shine.

I have eaten here before long ago and I was not disappointed by my meal if I recall. I good place to grab a meal by the window and people watch too.
author: Marck N.

description: Great food but went last night and got carbonara with prawns. The prawns had a really weird taste so I had three other people with me try them, who also said they tasted funny. I told the white haired older waiter that they tasted weird, and he replied rudely saying they have never had a complaint before and argued with me that they were fine. He then proceeded too only take the prawns off the bill and not the whole meal. I got home and threw up all night. Definitely had food poisoning.
author: Thalia S.

description:
We sat down in the outside patio, and the nice hostess turned on the heater for us.  I liked the romantic Italian music that complimented the atmosphere well to create a relaxing ambiance. The waiter came to greet us and take our drink orders. I ordered a capuccino. It came done properly as I would expect.

Then, I ordered the Marsala. The chicken was done well, and did not come dry, the vegetables were steamed the right amount, and the potatoes were delicious as well. 

The Marsala sauce was very good and not too sweet. 

Service was nice. But the waiter could have been more attentive.  The restaurant was not that busy. The busser compensated for that. Our waiters name was Stephano and the busser's name was Luis. 

The tiramisu was good. 

Overall, it was a good experience.
author: Hugo M.

description:
Save yourself a disappointment & potential fish bone in your ravioli! 

Several years ago I enjoyed this place, but they have since failed to keep up. 
For a 30$ plate of pasta the cook, who was chatting it off on his cell phone, threw some frozen tortellini in hot water. The salad that came with these lower-than-Costco-quality tortellini was wilted and included several gooey, rotten leaves! 
Bread served at the table has seen its fair share of that week, ie not fresh! 

The last complaint I have is that despite the restaurant being empty, the restrooms were a disaster! It looked like instead of mopping the floor, someone layered toilet paper on top of the dirty floors. (Mens urinal was ripped out of the wall, so no surprise it smelled like pee pee covered the entire restroom, floor to bottom). 

With that said, good luck to you if you have the stomach to proceed with this choice!
author: Matea F.

description: I came here because Dr. Savage recommended it.   We came earlier in the day.  The food was great.  Nice staff.  I need to come back in the evening and give it another shot.  I'd come back when visiting S.F.
author: Edward V.

description:
So overall we were pretty dissapointed with this place. 

We ordered the lasagna and tortellini ala bolognese. While we waited we got a basket with dry bread.. After more than half an hour (!!) - without any word from our waiter - we finally got our food. It was good, but honestly not worth the $45 we ended up paying. 

Our waiter was an idiot - he took our order, gave us water, and then he didn't check on us until we were all done and just needed the check. Instead they had another guy who basically took care of all the guests while the real waiters were talking to each other - our waiter even counted his tips in the middle of the restaurant, which is just something you don't do as a waiter!! He got 50 cents in tip from us, and honestly he didn't even deserve that...

So overall the service is crab and the food is okay but not worth the price.
author: Elsebeth P.

description:
Let me start by saying I love this restaurant. While living in the SF Bay Area my wife and I would go here every Sunday for lunch and many times for dinner as well. The food is absolutely delicious and the service is wonderful as well. My favorite waiter is Antonio who has worked there for a while. Certain pastas are made fresh daily such as the gnocchi, tagliatelle and ravioli. 

Gnocchi Enzo - One of my all time favorite dishes. Fresh homemade gnocchi in a gorgonzola cheese sauce. The sauces in this place have amazing flavor and the gnocchi literally melts in your mouth since it's made fresh. 

Penne Amatriciana - Their Amatriciana sauce is very different then other Amatriciana sauces I have had at Bay Area restaurants. The flavor is spectacular ! The pasta was cooked al dente which is the way it should be done. So may Italian restaurants in America and Americans in general seem to like their pasta overcooked. Try this dish and you will be addicted.

Butternut Squash Ravioli in cream sauce - The butternut ravioli is sometimes on the special menu and it is delicious. the ravioli is homemade and very fresh. The difference between boxed and homemade pasta is huge. There is no substitute for fresh pasta made daily. 

Pasta Festa - Also on the special menu from time to time. My wife hade this meal and the pasta was tagliatelle with a cream sauce and seafood. It was delicious and the portions were huge as well.

Prosciuotto and Melone - I have started my meals frequently with this appetizer. The melon is always fresh and the prosciutto always top quality. The perfect balance between salt and potassium. Great flavor. Salt raises the blood pressure and potassium from the melon keep the blood pressure in check. This is a nice, fresh, cold appetizer.

I miss San Francisco and this restaurant especially along with Trattoria La Siciliana. two of my favorite haunts. When I die I plan on haunting this place and stealing pasta from patrons' dishes lol. You can't go wrong with any of the food here. Prices are higher for some dishes but the pastas are made fresh and I would imagine the rents in North Beach are quite high.

Carpaccio - Another winning appetizer. beef sliced super thin with arugula, capers and bread and shaved cheese. The flavor is great when you put them all together.

Panini Sandwiches - If you choose any of the Panini sandwiches you can't go wrong. My wife and I have tried the veggie, chicken, prosciutto & Mozzarella and the Italian sausage and they were all delicious. They know food in this place.
author: Anthony L.

description: Best meal we had while visiting SAN Francisco.  The staff was over the top great!  Fresh pastas and great steak.  The desserts were a must have
author: Randy R.

description: This review is based solely on my dessert experience. I did not eat any dinner. That being said, this was a very disappointing experience.  My wife and I had the tiramisu and the Rum Baba cake. The tiramisu, which is always good even out of a box, was terrible. It tasted like an egg flan and lacked any coffee flavor. Between the two of us we were only able to eat 40% before giving up. The Rum cake was more of a bread, which may be on par for the culture, but it too was devoid of its many ingredient,  RUM. In addition, the ice cream had ice in it. Which meant it was stored improperly or was old. At the end of the day, there are plenty of dessert options in that area, choose another.
author: Eric M.

description: We ate an early supper at a window side table. Burrata for an appetizer and some of the best Rissoto I ever had. The Ciopino was also delightful. The tiramisu was to die for!
author: Mary D.

description:
My husband and had a great dining experience at this restaurant.  The service and food was just wonderful!

We started with an appetizer Piatto di Formaggi
(parmesean & gorgonzola cheese with pear & walnuts.) This nice and light.

I had Fettucine con Pollo (house made fresh fettuccine, sautéed chicken & vegetables in an Alfredo cream sauce.)  The sauce was creamy (thin) and flavorful... just superb!!!  

My husband had Linguine del Pescatore
(mussels, clams, calamari, prawns & fresh fish in garlic tomato sauce.)  

We would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Dianne S.

description: Great location, staff that speaks Italian.  Memorable food.  After ten years, same quality and atmosphere.  Try the linguine Palermo.
author: Gil M.

description:
NORTH BEACH EATING PART IV: SICILIAN CUISINE - 100TH YELP REVIEW

This is my 100th original review on Yelp. I had hoped I would write a review that would be worthy. Sometimes there are places you hope would exceed your expectations to write positive reviews but you end up disappointed with your experience. This is why we write reviews on Yelp because not all of our reviews will be so positive. The review for this restaurant is an example.

There are several of Italian restaurants on North Beach that focuses on regional cuisine. I've tried different types of Italian cuisine, but there is one I haven't tried: Sicilian. Trying to find one on North Beach was very difficult. I did my research to find a Sicilian restaurant. The closest I came at that time was this place. According to this restaurant's website the chef is from Sicily. So I was hoping to find Sicilian food here.

I ate here last Friday for lunch. Before I went here I searched through Wikipedia to find out what Sicilian cuisine is. What makes Sicilian cuisine unique from other Italian cuisine is the history of Sicily. Since this island had been inhabited by the Arabs, Spanish, Normans, and Greeks there are several types of ingredients are part of Sicilian cuisine: apricots, citrus, saffron, peppers, couscous, broad beans, cocoa, maize, etc. From my research Sicilian cuisine symbolizes the term melting pot. I was excited to try Sicilian cuisine.

When I read the menu I tried to find items from my research. For the pasta I could not find anything with sea urchin or anchovies. The most famous Sicilian pasta dish Pasta alla Norma, which consists of penne pasta with tomatoes, eggplants, and ricotta cheese, was not listed on the menu. With respects to the seafood I couldn't find any tuna, sea bass, cuttlefish, or swordfish. As I read the menu, out of desperation the closest item I could find that may resemble Sicilian cuisine is Salmone Siciliana. In the small print of this item you can substitute vegetables for pasta. For this dish I get two courses into one dish - pasta and fish. The dish was pretty good. The spaghetti was al dente and the salmon was moist pink, unlike most salmons in restaurants are overcooked. The tomato sauce was flavorful because of the oregano and capers. However overall I wasn't satisfied with this meal because of the lack of authentic Sicilian dishes this was the only dish I ordered; the other three Italian restaurants on North Beach I reviewed I ordered at least two dishes. 

Don't get me wrong the food here is good. If you want good quality Italian food you can find it here. However I never got a sense what type of cuisine this restaurant specializes. In a sense I felt empty. The only good thing besides the taste of the food is that I didn't overspend. Other than that I was not satisfied with my meal. I'll still continue my quest to find Sicilian food on North Beach.
author: Gerald R.

description: This is a late review. We dined here 4/29/17 and while the food was amazing, the service was the worst. We each ordered a glass of wine and an entree. I had the angel hair pasta with tomatoes, garlic and basil. My boyfriend had the Italian sausage ravioli in a cream sauce with porcini mushrooms. It was rich and delicious, but again the service was nonexistent. The waiter delivered our wine and entrees and never checked back the entire time we were eating. It took some time to get our check as he was visiting with other diners on either side of us and never spoke to us. The restaurant was not that busy either. Very disappointing and won't go back with so many other choices in the area.
author: Nicole J.

description: Amazing dinner and service! Meant to post a picture of my delicious lemon chicken, but devoured it too quickly!! Looking forward to the tartufo affogato, and definitely planning to return!
author: Dawn F.

description: Family of 5 (parents, two kids and a baby in arms). Only two high chairs in the restaurant and both of them are occupied. We were placed in the back of the restaurant next to the loud and hot kitchen. Then we noticed that anyone with kids were being sent to the back next to the kitchen. The waiter took off while taking our order to attend to someone else. The plates we used for appetizers and bread stayed on the table for the entire meal. In fact, all plates we used stayed on the table for the whole time. Our food was not that great and was not adequate on top of being pricey. When we asked for the pizza to be boxed, the waiter just stacked all the slices into a tiny box instead of giving us a pizza box which were right there next to the kitchen. We were sweating throughout the meal while the temperature outside was 62 degrees.
author: A I.

description: Great place! The food is fresh and delicious. The service was great and very attentive. Pasta was perfectly cooked al dente. The sauces were flavorful. The atmosphere was nice, very classy. If your in little Italy I recommend eating here.
author: Jess D.

description: By far my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Leo was a great server and the food was delicious. Prices were wicked reasonable and the ambiance was nice. Will definitely go back (if I'm ever in town again.)
author: Katie O.

description:
Absolutely delightful restaurant - delicious food - chicken stuffed with spinach, goat cheese and sun dried tomato is fabulous as is the pasta . Good service and traditional
Italian hospitality . Love this place !
author: Denise R.

description: Excellent hostess was very accommodating our seating request. Great waitstaff, serenading owner, wonderful location for people watching. Had wine and appetizer which were very very good.
author: Deb K.

description: Have been coming here for many years.  Great food, wonderful atmosphere, awesome cocktails, and you get to hear Giovanni sing a few old Italian favorites.  Reasonably priced!  If you're in North Beach and want an authentic Italian menu, this is the place!!  5-STARS!
author: Mister B.

description: Another amazing amazing dinner. Chose to visit this place on my last weekend in the city. Had the calamari again with the pizza and cream of broccoli soup. Topped it off with the vanilla creme brûlée and I'm in heaven! Everyone needs to try this place when in SF
author: Shelby L.

description: Two stars are only for the nice atmosphere.  Our waiter seemed miserable.  Ordered some dessert of coffee and spumoni ice cream with biscotti.  The coffee was horrible!  It tasted like hot water. It was a good thing I didn't enjoy it since they do not offer refills anyway.  The spumoni ice cream itself was good even though it was a rather small portion with the smallest biscotti I ever saw.  We also overheard the next table decline taking home their leftover portions since they were so disappointed in their entrees.  Will not be returning.
author: D S.

description:
