We found this place just walking around North Beach. We were on a double date and this was the PERFECT place. The wine bottle prices were decent, and the food was great. Yea it was pricey overall, but I didn't find any restaurant in the area that was any cheaper so I'm not complaining.

The food was amazing. Everyone there was Italian so I felt good about it. The service was slow, but after being to Italy myself, I've learned that's how Italians are. And besides, we weren't in a rush. 
It was a beautiful night with great food and everyone was SO nice. I can't wait to come back here again!
author: Kari L.

description: Service was slow, bread was cold, ravioli was ok...It was good that I was able to taste the crab stuffing but it came warm, I was hoping for HOT food.  Carpaccio was sliced too thick but tasted fine.  Bad Service from a forgetful waiter and cold food equals 2 stars.  I should knock another star off for their automatic addition of gratuity for a party of 3!?? And the kicker...gratuity is taxed...A bit ridiculous!
author: Twinnie T.

description: Great little Italian place in the financial district of San Francisco. We had appetizer of marinated olives -excellent in garlic. We had Osso Bucco very delicious. Linguini Pascatore which had so much seafood and fresh pasta. Excellent
author: Suha V.

description: We found this place. Service I would rate a 3, two guys only running the show but we had to wait a little long for our check . I ordered the butternut squash ravioli , delicious!! Wonderful taste. My daughter had a very delicious tortellini with walnut cream sauce. The polenta with truffle sauce was excellent. I ordered the house can which was not nearly as good as other house cabs I've tasted. Authentic Italians, nice ambience and very pleasant overall experience .
author: Lesley F.

description:
This place used to be one of the favourites Italian restaurant for me and my husband in San Francisco until yesterday!
We went to North beach from ocean beach just to eat in this place; but the quality of service was way less than the other times we've been there.
We just arrived and the waiter came to ask for the drinks, without to have a chance to look at the menu; anyway my husband ordered a drink and I asked for water; they never brought the basket of bread they always bring what we saw a different waiter bringing to others table, not a big deal but... When we ordered food we decided to ordered fried calamari as appetisers, what tasted only the breading, barely could find calamari; then for the main course I asked the waiter if Tuna salad was with tuna steak; and the guy said: yes it's really good piece of tuna we make here! My surprise was when it arrived and was tuna from the can! We asked the waiter and he said he never said was tuna steak, of course after all he never came back to the table to check if we need something else, I walked to the front, wait person and asked for the check and once again when we got the check one more surprise: the waiter sneaky added 15% gratuity to our bill! Seriously?!
author: Rita C.

description: My husband and I love this place. We love to eat outside and people watch. The food amazing.. great prices and good service. From appetizers to dessert, everything was delicious. You do have to get past the girl trying to lure people in.
author: Mandy V.

description:
One of the worst customer service experiences I've had!!!

Not happy with the server's attitude and Trattoria Pinocchio has left a bad taste and I'm not going back!

I love trying out new restaurants in North Beach and most have wonderful servers and a great atmosphere but unfortunately, we must have picked the wrong restaurant on the wrong day.
author: Heather J.

description: Wow these guys no how to treat a customer,had a great time will definately be back again.Drinks were great ,vibe was great people were fantastic.thank you
author: Mary M.

description:
Walked past many times but kept on going mainly because of the lady shill out in front beckoning the tourists.

Looking at the yelp photos I thought the food looked damn good, and the shill wasn't there.

Was not disappointed.  Server was great.  Italian accent but not fake like many North Beach places.  Spoke Italian to some Italian customers.  

Wife had porchini ravioli.  You could smell the porcini across the table.  I had the veal lasagna and it was perfect with a rich tomato sauce and quality cheese filling.  Noodles were house made.

I will now skip the drama of Franchino and his wife down the block and make this my go to Italian in n.b.
author: Bradley C.

description: Worst Italian food I have ever experienced. The Insalata Mista was drenched in dressing. The margarita pizza was a cheese pizza with a few diced tomatoes and a handful of basil thrown on.  It was over baked just shy of being burnt. We were the only patrons in the restaurant and they could not make one salad and one pizza correctly. Do not waste your money.
author: Scott C.

description: This is mine & my girlfriend's favorite spot for authentic Italian pasta. The staff are always so happy, kind and quick! Some of them even sing along to the music, it's nice to see that they enjoy their job that much. Their bartender is very funny and made our wait for a table on a busy weekend night pass by with ease & delicious wine & cocktails. The Spaghetti alla Bolognese is my absolute favorite & personally the best I've had, I crave it all the time. I think by now they recognize us (I'm not even embarrassed) as when we went for dinner there last week my gf brought her own bottle of Zin & we noticed on the receipt that they took $5 off the corkage fee-we really appreciated it, thanks guys!
author: Natasha M.

description: Everything was delicious from the drinks, appetizers, entrés, & desserts! Brought the whole family & all of us loved it all!  Super friendly staff, classy environment. We will be back for sure!
author: Kirsten M.

description: In love with this place great atmosphere reasonable prices right by the house and Italian I gotta give it a 5 star btw the staff  was very nice to me and my lady :)
author: Nick R.

description:
Went as a part of a large group. The waiter was very attentive and warm! Food is great here- Fresh ingredients. We ordered carpaccio for appetizers. They were great. I order d the veal piccata which was cooked to perfection, some of the others ordered pesto gnocchi, chicken saltimbocca and the chicken limone. All of us thought the food was excellent. For dessert we ordered tiramisu and Spumoni ice cream. The tiramisu was 'beh' but the spumoni ice cream was DELICIOUS! 

Overall a good restaurant at North Beach to eat at. The wait time for food could be improved- but I understand it's an Italian thing!
author: Shyam R.

description: We absolutely loved our meal.  All four of us ordered something different and each dish was all we were hoping for.  Our server was from Italy and made our experience special.  Just as we were leaving someone came walking through with two beautiful stuffed artichokes.  When he heard me say that, he came back with a plate and shared it with me!!!! Gotta love Italians.   By the way the artichoke tasted just like the ones my mom used to make.
author: Donna O.

description:
Cute little restaurant that was on the corner of the block . We were looking at the menu from outside and the owner (I think he was) was an adorable cheerful man who convinced us to go inside . 

My friend had tried the place before and he liked it so we went in. 

I ordered something with seafood and it was delicious . I hardly ever finish my pasta , but it was too good to waste any of it . 

The service was great they constantly came by to ask if we needed anything and coming to give us water refills before we even ask for any . Which is always great . 

Recommend this place to my friends .
author: Jessica C.

description:
Genuine, friendly, but overpriced.
Good, fresh food at this hilltop restaurant with a view on the neighborhood's life. Unfortunately the service, though very friendly, is slow and altogether it is quite expensive.
Good place, but you can probably find better and cheaper in LI.
author: Marc N.

description: Stopped in for an after dinner drink and dessert. My friend and I sat at the bar and enjoyed White Russian coffees, cannoli and creme brulee. Our bartender was very friendly and helpful. Gave us lots of suggestions for places to see while we're in San Francisco. Would like to come back and try dinner here.
author: Tina B.

description: Got the Cappellini al Pomodoro. It was extremely delicious but pretty overpriced for a smaller portion. The waiter was not too kind or friendly, but the dish was so delicious that I didn't really care. Would definitely go again.
author: Miranda H.

description: Have been coming here for 15 years with my husband.  Great food and wonderful service.  Highly recommend the salmon fettuccine and bruschetta.
author: Kellie B.

description: I'm italian so I know what I'm talking about: food is bad and overpriced, the waiter is nice though.
author: Lea G.

description: Came here for the first time after years and years of passing on it. Was sadly confirmed on my fears, this place is over priced for what it is. The food was okay the the gnocchi was what it should be and that's why it gets two stars. Two people in our party had to send back food that they ended up charging us for and then they overcharged us for the bottle of wine we ordered. Server was nice enough but clearly trying to take advantage of "tourists". Very disappointed that this place confirmed what I always say: don't go to north beach for Italian food.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Great corner spot location in Little Italy for a relaxing lunch, and ambience is quite nice.
Service was good, albeit I think it helped our cause that we speak Italian. 
Ravioli (Spinach and ricotta) was very good though the Lasagna was pretty average. Too much cheese and mushiness for my liking.
Would I go again ? Not too fussed
author: Frank M.

description: Tonight we had Seafood Risotto and the Lasagna. All I can say is "Wow!".  Both dishes were fantastic, and as usual, so was Antonio (we requested him). We love this place!
author: M B.

description:
My 15 year old claims the four cheese pizza is the "best pizza in the world!"
Brought our family of 18 here because we were starving. We brought our picky eaters, vegetarians, and impatient hangry attitudes, and this place surpassed our expectations. The tortellini, spaghetti, panini sandwich, chicken Alfredo, minestrone soup all were excellent! The server was fun and kept every glass full during lunch.
author: Brenda O.

description:
So let's begin; 

So when we went to go find a restaurant, we fell apon 
This restaurant. So I decided that I should rate this restaurant by food, drinks, service, etc. So let's begin: 

Service: 5/5 - the waiters were super nice and friendly. Not only that, but with there Italians and had the accent, we felt like we were almost in Italy! (well not really, duh!) 

Drinks: nothing I can say - I ordered a standard drink: Sprite. But my friend orderd a type of vodka that he told me he rated 4/5 on. Don't take my word for this! 

Food: 3.5/5 I ordered there standard pizza (alot of mozzerella, tomatos and green leafs on it). It felt soggy maybe due to the fact there was a lot of stuff on it but anyways the dough was soggy. The cheese will ALWAYS fall off the pizza like if it was liquified. Usally the pizza and cheese should melt into your mouth but it basically melted infront of me. So anyways it tasted O.K. 

Desert: nothing I can say - once again, my friend did take a tiramisu and rated it like 4/5. It did have alot of coffee in it. Don't take my word for this. 

So to conclude I have to rate it 4/5. I should recommend this restaurant but with some precautions.. I have not tasted there other foods like there pastas etc.) so if your reading this at there restaurant, go and continue ordering your food! Not to mention that it was hot inside but we got use to it in minutes. Enjoy!
author: Dave C.

description:
I have eaten here varying times over the last 10 years. The food has always been full of flavor no matter the plate. The Ossobuco is a hit with me and some of east coast friends that I have taken here. Big serving too. Sometimes the wait can be long but such is life in San Francisco. 
Dinner is great if you can wait in this city...
author: Chuck D.

description: From the moment we walked in the door we felt like we were home. With the wonderful aromas that filled the air to the warm greetings from the staff we were truly welcomed . The bartender Zabit is very friendly and engaging in conversation and our waiter Jimmy was superb . The house made lemoncello is fabulous. The food and desserts are out of this world. Best tiramisu ever! Can't wait to come back.
author: Valerie M.

description:
it's an 3-stars A-OK and not 5-stars, because my pals LOVED the pasta spaghetti dish, LIKED their veal Milanese , and I only LIKED my gnocchi. Dishes are pricey, so one expects 5 stars on all dishes. Sadly, that was not the case. 

also, we only drank iced-tea and that seemed to make a dent in their afternoon wine sales quota. it seemed that once they hauled you in their doors, they were on to roping their next person passing by the restaurant. we knew about the place, so we needed no coaxing.   

now, there were some folks clearly enjoying their time at the place, but next time, i will insist on one of the many other places in north beach.
author: Addadada A.

description: Food was delicious and served fast. Happy with service. Recommend ordering a salad to go with an entree. The entrees did come with a side of bread.
author: Cory C.

description: Authentic Italian dishes, relaxing atmosphere, and a vivacious staff make this a great little gem. While my portion was a little on the smaller side, my wife's meal was enormous. When we arrived 20 min late for our reservations, the hostess quickly set us without delay. The prices were reasonable and the food exceeded expectations.
author: Sam J.

description:
This is the only restaurant, in my entire life, where this happened:

  We came for dinner, it took a very long time before we got served, all of us politely picked at our meal.  After we left, and started asking what each other thought of the meal and every single one of us decided that it was such an awful experience we needed erase the entire experience.... so we walked down to Rose Pistola and had a decent meal.


This was actually several years ago, but it was so bad that it comes up regularly in conversation - as it did today.

What truly made it memorable was that we gave them a second chance about a year later.  This time, it was late and we decided, ok, the dinner was awful, but maybe the deserts are better.   I got a poached pear in chocolate sauce:  frozen in the middle, not ripe and chocolate sauce was a puddle of oil.  My wife got the creme brule - burned on one side, not touched on the other....  inside was kind of like clotted cream and also cold.  

That was now a year ago.  I feel awful for tourists that come here and spend an evening surrounded by good restaurants and end up there.

The only place that really has come close to this bad is Mona Lisa, also on Columbus, but a few doors down.  They gave me a "plate" of pasta that seemed to have a giant glass of tepid water dumped on top of the red sauce.

I'd recommend Osteria, Ideale or Franchino if you're in the area and have to have italian food. 

If you're just looking for a great restaurant in North Beach, I'd say Cafe Jacqueline is the top of the list - but they're exclusively a souffle restaurant.   Definitely worth the wait.
author: dan m.

description:
Worst service while in San Francisco. Our waiter must be racist. I asked for Sangria and was told this wasn't a Spanish Italian restaurant. Ordered a fried calamari and it wasn't cooked well.
I do not recommend it.
author: P G.

description: Nice Italian restaurant on busy Columbus Ave in North Beach. Parking in this area is a hit or miss. Actually, it's close to a nightmare really. So, I'd recommend you take an Uber or Lyft. I went there for a group dinner and the service was excellent. I would say the food is 3.5 - 4 stars, depending on what you got. (With such a foodie city the competition is fierce! So I reserve my 5's for places with more oomph. :) Anyway, I had their veal lasagna and it was excellent. If you go there for a large group meal, ask for the table way back, around the corner. You will have the space to yourself and you'll feel as though you're eating in grandma's dining room.
author: J A.

description:
My five star story starts with explaining the immense pressure I was under to impress my Sicilian man friend that is very particular about food and feels he is more Italian than any other italian. Was there going to be an Italian experience authentic enough for him in this city? I wasn't sure at all until I finally gathered up enough courage to suggest we visit North Beach, specifically Pinocchio's. 

Ohh, great success! He immediately connected with the owner, Giovanni, who was Sicilian himself and had given us a ton of his time--very wonderful man. They all joked around while we sat outside and spent the day drinking, eating, eating and drinking. I couldn't imagine feeling more european and he couldn't have felt more at home. 

Of course the food was beautiful. We were served up a fresh, steaming plate of crab,  shots of espresso and a bit of grappino to cap things off. 

Pinocchio's is an honest, simple yet high quality Italian experience that I would recommend to everyone! I know this for sure now because even the most proud Italian will tip his hat to this North Beach location.
author: Cristina R.

description: The gf heard a lot of good things about this place, so we agreed to try it out last night.  WOW, big let down.  Food was ok, but service (from Fausto) was the worst.  We had reservations and got seated promptly.  First issue, they had a dirty (used) fork setting out.  Gross right!!! Second, the waiter took our order for some drinks, plus water, but never brought my drink, not a big deal, so I reminded him.  Third, the waiter takes our order for appetizers and entrees, and of course 30 minutes goes by and nothing but the folks next to us that came in 10 minutes after us get there appetizers and still nothing, then the kitchen helper brings out our entrees and still no appetizer.  The whole time the waiter never comes by.  I let the kitchen helper know to cancel my order for the appetizer.  He then has hunt down the actual waiter to inform of the situation and have him cancel the order.  The waiter of course blames the kitchen, blah blah blah.  I smell hot air, the waiter barely waited on our table, so of course there goes his tip.  Fourth, the pizza I order was mediocre at best, had a lot of water on it, which I assumed was from the tomatoes, and seemed like they put 4 slices of mozzarella cheese on it since it clumped together and kept come off in big chunks, making hard to eat.  (note: never had a problem like this and have tried a lot of pizza). Overall, bad experience and NEVER EVER EVER coming back!
author: Mike M.

description:
Bottom Line: Still the best lasagna I've had.

The veal lasagna is the best lasagna.  You can tell the noodles were hand crafted, and the ragu prepared with care.  You can actually taste the rich goodness that is the ragu.  It is a saucy and meaty lasagna, but not a cheesy one.

We also had a veggie risotto, and it was very light and tasty.  Not what you expect when you get a risotto, but it was a pleasant contrast to the heavier lasagna.  

Again, their service was friendly and helpful.  I thought it was awesome how one waiter kept talking to us in Italian - and then he would translate (if he could) when we couldn't pick up on the phrases we couldn't understand.

Their Tiramisu was nothing to write about, but it was still better than Mara's down the street.
author: Anson G.

description: Amazing pasta! Stopped for an impromptu lunch during the week- i was very impressed. hostess very friendly, helped us to pick our meal as well as directions. highly recommend the gnocchi with, honestly anything! so good
author: Heidi B.

description: I just went there to have dinner and I have a question about the seafood dish, I wanted to know with which sides it comes with the hostess was nice and she asked one of the waiters and who was very rude he just said I'm busy. It was so rude of him. What a customer service lol. I would never recommend this place to anyone
author: Liza G.

description: Food was fantastic.  Pesto sauce was light and flavorful and the connoli was off the chart good. Simone was a great server and host. Would definitely recommend this to all.
author: Brian L.

description: Excellent food and service! So glad we didn't get sucked into the Stinking Rose tourist trap and decided to try Pinocchio.  Wonderful!!!
author: Heather P.

description:
I've been craving ossobuco for the longest time, ever since my boyfriend mentioned it one day. So he figured we should try this place, since they actually offered it on their menu. Definitely on a mission!

I guess we came at the right time cause the place was empty and we were immediately seated by the window. It was a pretty large restaurant stretching out from the corner and had a lot of nice decor that suited the place's "Pinocchio" theme. 

Started off the night sharing a standard Caesar salad, nothing special, but still pretty good. Once my food actually came out, I was really satisfied with how large the portion was. Not only that it was a bonus that it was set atop some saffron risotto. The meat was cooked to perfection: fall off the bone, tender, and moist! Just the way I like it. ;) I love that they kept the meat on the bone because you could taste the flavor of the bone marrow too! I had to end the night getting the tartufo afogato for dessert. I couldn't have been more satisfied, because the presentation of the plating was definitely picture-worthy and it was swimming in a delicious espresso shot base. Mission accomplished!

First time experience and I'm already impressed! Would definitely want to come back. Staff was super friendly too so that was a plus.
author: Alexis A.

description: Took my husband here for his birthday. It was delicious and the staff is so great. I highly recommend this place. The food was very fresh and the drinks were strong!
author: Brandy B.

description: I always enjoy eating here whenever we're in North Beach area! I love the atmosphere. The food is amazing! And the service is wonderful. The only tricky part is finding parking. But I don't even bother going to any other restaurants when I'm in the mood for Italian. Once you find a favorite spot to eat at, nothing compares to it. Great dining experience! Thank you to all the staff for making us feel so welcome and treated well! We love coming here!
author: Svetlana S.

description: Came for a late lunch with family during a weekday. Food was ok. I had read enough reviews from this place to know to avoid anything with chicken in it - nobody in our large party had chicken, so everyone thought the food was good. Some thought their food was above average. But what really brought it down for me several stars was the service. It wasn't busy at all, but you would have never known it by the service. Very inattentive. One of us had a nasty fork with dried food on it. We had to constantly re-ask for more bread and water. The waiter seemed annoyed. Our large table put us into automatic gratuity situation but I wouldn't say it was deserved based on the service actually received. The host and bartender were pleasant though.
author: Cameron B.

description:
My mom, sister and I had a wonderful dinner here tonight! I'm not sure why so many reviews mention poor service, because ours was excellent. I felt like our server was genuinely happy that we were there.

We ordered the carpaccio appetizer to share, it was seasoned perfectly. For dinner I ordered linguine with clams and mussels, mom ordered the carbonara, and my sister ordered linguine with pesto. All were delicious! The portions were big, all three of us had to get to-go boxes. I appreciated that our server recommended I try the linguine with mussels instead of the linguine with calamari that I originally ordered; it showed he cared about us having a nice meal. 

We had a great time and would definitely go back.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Ok, before I start, the food was amazing, but the way it sat in my stomach after was AWFUL (Seriously, I haven't experience a worst service experience ever). Our waiter ruined our order like you couldn't ruin it worst: I asked for omelet b with extra spinach and greens, he brought omelet a with extra spinach and no greens; my friend asked for omelet a without cheese and with greens, he brought her omelet b with cheese and greens but since she's diary intolerant, he had to ask the cook to remake it, but did not change mind. so here i am for 30 minutes with my omelet getting cold in front of my eyes as we wait for the 2nd omelet. it was great when it was warm. but not so much cold eh? and then, well, he kept harassing us!!! Seriously, he came to our table like 5 or 6 times to yell at us. He couldn't leave it. 

Well, on the good side -- seriously, I had the BEST COFFEE EVER!. That really made for the shitty experience. So, if you see an old man with a large nose, yem... maybe you want to pass, and if he's not there, then you should at least try the coffee.
author: Emilie D.

description:
Eeech. Although the setting is very cute (little round tables outside a la Europe) and the service is nice and prompt... my chicken was pretty gross. I had the chicken al limon. Despite the literally copious amounts of butter and oil on it, the flavor of the very old and gross chicken could not be disguised.

They need to a) use higher quality chicken and b) use way, way less butter and oil

Couldn't finish it / it didn't make me feel that great. Stick to pasta. Cute setting though.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Late night on 5-14-2014 on an unusually hot SF day. Stopped in for a drink but saw how tasty the menu looked. Had an incredible pizza! Very nice staff as well.
author: Jon U.

description: The best Italian food ever! Great service ambiance and homemade pasta. The owner and chef is from Italy. The cannoli is the best I have ever had and I have tasted probably 50 or more in other places. This place is a must try! It is my new favorite restaurant!
author: Melissa L.

description: The staff was so great and the food?? Delicious!! A little taste of home!! Buonisimo!!
author: Cat M.

description: Came hear on New Years Eve for lunch. Walked in and most of the guests at the tables were speaking Italian to one another. So I felt we had made a wise choice. The lunch specials are fairly priced!!! The minestrone soup is very good! My children ordered the Italian Sausage Paninis, they said they were delicious! My Capellini Pomodoro was excellent. It's an old North Beach street corner restaurant with old San Francisco charm. I would love to come back for dinner the next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Victoria Q.

description:
I have eaten at Pinocchio's many times over the last few months.
I love the meat Ravioli they have.
They generally have on street seating under the heat lamps to make a wonderful eating experience.
Food is great, Experience is great, Service is great.
author: R R.

description:
Great place. There are a bunch of italian restaurants in the neighborhood, so it was hard to choose but we were not disappointed.

Had some antipasti and then pasta. All was very good.

Service was great.
author: Dorian K.

description: At our table, we had lasagna, gnocchi, and eggplant Parmesan. All of us declared our food excellent! We had the bruschetta, omg so good. Service was excellent too!  Wish we lived close, we'd probably be here once a week
author: Jill S.

description:
I love this place! I love everything about it...... The setting, the food (of course), and heck, I may even be a teeny-tiny bit in love with the guy who was my waiter. He was just so friendly and attentive. Gotta love THAT in a guy!

Anyway..... I started with my all time favorite summer salad: a caprese. And, this one was just perfect. Wonderful heirloom tomatoes and buffalo mozzarella topped with both a basil reduction AND torn basil leaves, and then drizzled with the most flavorful olive oil. No balsamic (as it should be.... THAT my friends is just too overpowering for this delicate salad). It was a happy summer day in my mouth!

Then onto the main course: pasta arribiata. Perfect al dente (why do so many restaurants have difficulty with that?) pasta with fresh, flavorful spicy sauce with chunks of tomato, garlic, and herbs. Wow!!!! Simple and FANTASTIC! Perhaps the best I've ever had!

I was too full for dessert, but luckily not too full for an after dinner glass of house made lemoncello. Again, the best ever with a perfect sweet to tart balance. AMAZING!!!!
author: Jody G.

description: We should have moved on when the hostess meant to entice us in was rude, but we were hungry and tired, so we went in. We were told they had San Francisco sour dough, but after we ordered they brought cold sliced Italian bread. The chicken Parmesan was microwaved and tough, the Caesar salad WAY overdressed, the butternut squash ravioli was flavorless and part undercooked. The only decent meal was the tortellini with peas and mushrooms. The service was abysmal, and because we were a party of six, the gratuity was added at 20% but the waiter did not advise us of this fact. The other servers, though aware of our impatience, never told our waiter we were in need of him. I will never go back, and you should avoid this place. With so many other really good choices in North Beach, it shouldn't be hard to avoid this horrible restaurant.
author: Tracie D.

description:
Went with a Groupon. No big deal, really. Buy 2 gnocchi get 1 free. The waiter just said "no" & tried to return the groupon. I asked to speak with a manager. A crazy person with food in his mouth & napkin on his chin came roaring out of the back. He said "no! no! no!. I keep telling these people no! We won't take THAT!" Not only was he rude. He made a scene! I felt like a sneak thief!
I get that a lot of places hate groupon. That's fine. It's how I try new places. I yelped best pizza in North Beach. Found Tony's. The best pizza I ever had.
Dude @ Pinnocchio's: Chill out man! If you'd apologized for the confusion & offered me a free coke or some damn thing it could have been different. Now? I'll never be back & tell everyone what a jerk you are!
author: Don W.

description: Great food and great service. We went after a day of sight seeing and on the recommendation of a local. The Toscano soup was awesome and the portobello caprese was a delicious surprise. The person I was with loved his entree more than I loved mine. I didn't rate it a 5 because it wasn't above and beyond on food and service but I would tell friends to go here for good, real Italian.
author: Lindsey G.

description: Me and my friends from San Diego were visiting SF and they mentioned they wanted to try this place. The atmosphere feels very italian and the server was fun to talk to. We first ordered two Polentas for appetizer, and I ordered the Ravioli de Vitello (veal ravioli with sweet cream, mushroom in a porcini cream sauce) for my entree while my friends had other items. In summary, they enjoyed their food, as did I. At first glance, my plate of ravioli seemed small, but in reality it was very filling. It melted right in my mouth and was flavorful. I didn't have a chance to any wine since I was driving alone, but overall, it was a great dining experience with good food albeit a little pricier than I expected, hence the 4 star rating. Would come again especially if someone is paying.
author: Hin M.

description: Man. This has been my favorite restaurant in the city for 11+ years. I've been loyal despite the fact it is a clear tourist trap. I was in the neighborhood this weekend and thought, what a nice treat it will be to get takeout from Pinocchio's. I called, I asked, do you do takeout? A young woman said, sure, 20-40 minutes! We arrived an hour later and the ditzy hostess said "ooops, I forgot your order. It will be 20 more minutes." You guys have great food, and cater to tourists. But come on. That is ridiculous. I will never be back. As someone who lives in the mission and sees mainstays shut down every day because they've been priced out, I say good luck Pinocchio's. But I don't really mean it.
author: Jackie A.

description: Came here a little over an hour before closing a couple weeks ago and had a great time chilling outside, having a drink and talking to a friend.  Our server was super nice and attentive and we never felt like we had to flag him down even though we were outside.  I ordered an Espresso Martini and it was sooo good!  I love coffee so this was a great way to end the night!  Will definitely come back!
author: Elena N.

description: Me and my family went here on a Saturday night, everywhere was busy and we had my baby with us . this place was not that busy and they accommodate me with a baby so that was a plus. We had calamari which was good, order the raviolio and the tortellini and the pizza was yummy. We had the first serve of bread it was fresh but for our second it was cold. The waiter was very attentive and we had the nice view outside.
author: Hoa T.

description: I have been here about 5 times, and all I can say is that the service is only surpassed by the flavor and quality of food. The linguine Palermo, and pescatore are both out of this world good for seafood lovers. The red sauce is obviously homemade, with a burst of flavor in each bite. Tortellini is outstanding. The calamari appetizer is above average. Very good, you won't be disappointed. If you are a chicken Parmesan lover, this place has the best I've ever eaten in my life. It's insanely good. The breeding crust is perfection. Their Alfredo sauce is the best I've ever had as well. Very authentic experience. Love coming here.
author: Kyle L.

description:
A great way to end our visit!

We cancelled a reservation to re-visit this Italian gem. We were hoping it was as good as it was then, 8 years  ago. First of all, it was.  After a few nights of disappointments at "famous" restaurants in SF, we  had our best meal. Our expectations for Italian food are high, since it's how we were both raised. 

Everything was right, the olives,the tricolor salad, and the bread. We wanted to dine slowly so we ordered a bottle of wine and waited to order dinner.  We could watch the kitchen, which I enjoy as an ex- restauranteur, and could see and smell the wide variety of dishes prepared. We wanted pasta. The Gnocchi Enzo brought a tear to the eye. The light pillows in the Gorgonzola sauce was rich but delicate. The Veal ravioli was fresh made and though I enjoyed the simplicity of the sage and butter sauce, I know the mushroom cream would have been delicious too. 

The chops served at the table next to us made me turn my head. They looked perfectly cooked and smelled incredible. We lamented that we hadn't come earlier in the week because we could have enjoyed it more than once. We will next time. 

Traditional Spumoni was cool and delicious.

Our intention is to enjoy our meals together. As two women, we get sat in less than perfect tables but we can usually settle in and focus on our time and food.  Service was just enough; around when we needed it. All the floor staff seemed to check on us.  

A perfect ending for our visit in San Francisco,
author: Lori K.

description:
We had a party of 10 that turned into 20. Made reservations only a few hours before then within 30 minutes of our arrival time we had to up the number and they were so accommodating!! 
I had Chicken Parmigiana and Canapelli Pomodoro. My mouth is watering again just thinking of it. Yum! Really great. Will definitely go again when in San Fran.
author: Emily M.

description: Food here is amazing! My favourite at the moment is the sausage ravioli  they even have a beautiful Irish girl as a host who is super friendly! The barman "Zabid" is the funniest. I love a when a place has a personality & can have fun
author: Marc O.

description:
I went to Trattoria Pinocchio about a month ago with my boyfriend while visiting San Francisco.  Let me first give some background.  I am Italian/Sicilian-American (I can understand the language etc. and was raised with this background).  Every time I have EVER gone to ANY authentic Italian restaurant I have ALWAYS been treated wonderfully and like family.  I did not anticipate our evening at Trattoria Pinocchio to be any different.  Were we ever in for a surprise.

I don't want to say that we were treated differently because I am Italian (and look VERY (Southern) Italian) and my boyfriend isn't (he has blond hair, nordic features), but I swear, that was the vibe I got from our waiter.  We both noted that the other patrons around us were a.) seated first, b.) served first, and the most insulting, c.) spoken to warmly and generally paid attention to.  I thought at first perhaps our waiter was just having a bad day, it happens-but to treat one customer differently than the next for no apparent reason...

-We had to ask for water while we watched everyone around us get served water first with refills
-Our waiter rolled his eyes when my boyfriend mispronounced the name of an Italian dish
-Our waiter literally tossed us our bill and said, *here.* and then approached the patrons seated next to us with a kind smile, gave them their bill and asked, "would you gentlemen like anything else?"
-We got our food last though we were seated first.

The food was mediocre. I ordered the Spaghetti Puttanesca and my boyfriend had ravioli.  I suppose the pasta was cooked to a nice al dente, but we were in Little Italy, so one can only hope that whoever is in the kitchen can at least cook the pasta right.  Perhaps it would have been better had the waiter not left such a bitter taste in our mouths?  Hard to enjoy the food and atmosphere when being treated like second rate customers.

I usually am a great tipper (especially for good service...I know how difficult it can be to work with the public)...however, this was an instant where I left a "tip" of 17 cents-a number considered *unlucky* in Italy-and cut my losses...we will NEVER go there again.
author: Dominique C.

description: I had iced coffee and procuito with melon. Oh, and the complimentary bread. Yummy. Perfect afternoon snack for my day in SF. Sitting outside was great because you get to absorb the sights and sounds of little Italy. Staff were friendly and not pushy with time or ordering. Thanks for the experience.
author: Jme N.

description: Great food and wonderful decor. The price is unpleasant, but expected considering the location is in the heart of North Beach. The staff is attentive, and the menu is varied and well thought-out. I would definitely go again. The four stars is for meeting my expectations, but not exceeding them.
author: Ben R.

description: We wanted a great Italian Restaurant in Little Italy while on vacation in SF.  We walked until we found one that looked authentic with decor and menu.  We were not disappointed!!  The pasta is made from scratch and you can tell!  I had the tortellini stuffed with veal in a cream sauce with peas, mushrooms and pancetta.  Excellent!!  My husband enjoyed the lasagna made with veal.  Please leave room for the cannoli and tiramisu  -- You will not be disappointed.  Everything was fresh, flavorful and authentic.  Our teenagers  LOVED their food and my daughter wants to go back there tomorrow night for her birthday so she can have everything again!!  The service was spot on and friendly from the waiter, hostess and the chef was very gracious and humble when we "gave compliments to chef".  Make sure you check out the chef cooking in the back of the restaurant  -- you'll see how fresh everything really is!!
author: Sue C.

description: My fiance and I just had our wedding reception tasting with Giovanni. He and the staff instantly make you feel like family. Our favorite plates are insalata tricolore, gnocchi enzo, tiramisu & limoncello...the list goes on. We highly recommend.
author: Mark K.

description: Okay if you want amazing pizza, go here. If you are looking for great service, not so much. Our waiter was pretty rude. He didn't check on us a lot and acted sort of like we were idiots. The hostess was friendly though and got us a table quickly.
author: Erin W.

description: There are all kinds of great Italian restaurants in North Beach, but I keep coming back to Pinocchio because I love the service, which is always attentive and often makes one feel like they're dining out in Rome or Milan.  I especially enjoy the guy who sings along to the opera music that plays in the place.  Their dishes are a bit pricey, but if you're looking for a good special occasion type of place, Pinocchio is an excellent choice.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I found this little restaurant a year ago when my wife and I were here. Decided to go look for it again this trip with a coworker. 

Caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had. We had a nice bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon, I had spaghetti bolognaise and my friend had angel hair pasta with a tomato sauce. 

Very good food, professional waiter, friendly staff, decent price.
author: Shawn C.

description:
My family tried this quaint restaurant after wandering North Beach for Italian food.  Easily the best meal of our trip!  The decor is classy Italian with a nice bar area, small tables along the windows and tables along Columbus Street for people watching.  The service was incredible and accommodating.  As mentioned by others,  we had Michael as a waiter whose patience and friendliness was greatly appreciated.  He was able to design a couple special pasta (fresh homemade pasta) dishes for my picky kids which were incredible.  Both kids were pleased both with their meals and their individual attention given by Michael. 

I had the lasagna which was wonderful.  Fresh pasta, plus a unique sweeter flavor was a tasty surprise.  All in all a great meal and well worth the walk from Fishermans Wharf where marginal, overpriced Italian with poor service seems to be the norm.
author: Chris O.

description:
Very nice food. I had risotto and my italian born aunt was also very happy. Our waiter was from Rome and was very nice. The only complaint I have is that the affogato I had for dessert was served in a large plate. I prefer it in a stemmed glass so you can easily drink the espresso after...!

Seems like a nice place, I got an authentic vibe from it to be sure. No complaints here!'
author: Sabrina H.

description: DON'T GO it was the worst service by far in any restaurant in North Beach the food was sub par. I went by myself and have never been more humiliated and angry they sat me by the door threw the menus on the table then never came back I had to flag down the waiter( who was way to impressed with himself  ) once I finally ordered I went to the restroom big mistake not only were they dirty they were by the kitchen were I watched the cooks throw food into the microwave and open bottles of ranch dressing. Once my food got to my table which took forever it was sub par at best. PLEASE DO NOT  go there. There are much better places in North Beach.
author: Debbie S.

description:
What a pleasant lunch we had here! We happened upon Trattoria Pinocchio while at the North Beach Festival this past weekend, looking for a place to sit in the shade and sip some Prosecco. 

The waiter offered us a sidewalk table and the weather was divine for San Francisco. We enjoyed our refreshing beverage along with salads all around...well except for Dad, he got a calzone - which looked terrific! I tried the Mediterranean tuna salad, which had a smattering of feta, olives, and artichoke hearts mixed in. The ingredients tasted fresh and just the right amount of dressing. My mom and sister enjoyed their salads as well, a caesar with salmon for Caitlin and caprese salad for Mom, both plates were picked clean!

I'm so glad we ate at Trattoria Pinocchio, it was the perfect lunch for a festive Saturday afternoon in San Francisco!
author: Erica J.

description:
My friend and I were searching for yummy Italian food and we figured what better place than Little Italy. It was hard trying to figure out which restaurant we wanted to try, so I'm glad we picked this one. 

We sat outside and the waiter came around promptly and asked us for our drink orders. As tempting as the drink/wine list looked, I was hungover earlier in the morning and really couldn't take another drop of alcohol (a story for another time). 

We order the octopus appetizer. It was tasty but on the fishy and salty side. I guess that should have been what I expected from a seafood dish. He ordered the chicken al limone and I got the lamb chops. My chops came out still breathing... I asked the waiter to put it in for a little longer and it came out perfect the second time. His chicken was really good... Creamy, lemony, and velvety good sauce. My side of spinach and mushrooms was also very good. 

The waiter and the maitre d' were both Italian and very friendly. The maitre d' even danced a little for us! Nice place. Would definitely go back if I was in the area again.
author: Lynn H.

description:
I have always walked or drove past here, and I always wondered what it was like to eat here. I think it was mostly because I was attracted to the word "Pinnochio". Come on... this place brings up nostalgic feelings because of Disney...

Anyways. 

We were seated by a charming hostess and served by what seems to be the head waiter. Almost all the wait staff in here had some sort of European accent (French or Italian), so the ones without stuck out in a very interesting manner. Actually, I'm lying, because there were waiters who seemed to have a Southern twang... 

Ordered a pino griogio, the special (Sicilian pesto), and he ordered the veal ravioli and a Blue Moon. The wine came out, and I don't know if I got a small glass or something... not a huge deal for me, since I don't drink much anyways. The food came out pretty fast! Both were really delicious, although honestly, the ravioli and the pesto actually tastes better mixed together than separate. I don't know if I should be surprised or not, because our food choices tend to be very harmonious, or maybe most high quality restaurants have menus that will always taste good with each other. 

Boyfriend says that the pesto tastes "really healthy". I thought it was extremely delicious. I was too busy picking out the tomatoes to really answer the owner if it was good. 

The veal ravioli tasted a lot like Chef Boyardee ravioli, but better. I wish I didn't have to make that comparison... but it has that soft, tomatoey, meaty flavor that's so similar! Obviously, the ravioli shell was incomparable, but really. When you taste it, you'll get a very nostalgic feeling. Although if you are anything like me, it will probably remind you of early college, when you were too poor/lazy to get anything better and ate it straight out of the can.

Perfect portions. They look small, but when you finish you should be full. If you're not, then you probably eat more than us or are a lot bigger than us.
author: Hayne P.

description:
Friendly vibes, quick service, and yummy food!

I stopped here for a 2 pm Blue Moon and appetizer session with the dad and Uncle. We ordered the Guazzetto de Mare (steamed clams and mussels in white wine, garlic and tomatoes) and the Portobello alla Griglia (1 big portobello topped with sundried tomatoes over arugula). Both were delicious! The Portobello is somewhat like a salad, and the free bread they give you is great with the extra broth from the clams. 

Price point is average for Little Italy or a nice restaurant in general around the $10-$15 point but every dollar is worth it. 

It's always nice with the outdoor seating in Little Italy, the buildings around you block off a good amount of the Bay breeze. The whole street is filled with happy people either walking passed you, next to you, or sitting down at another bistro across the street. Outdoor seating--always recommended!
author: Stephanie T.

description: This is literally the best, authentic Italian food that I have ever had in my life! Definitely a must if you are in the area!!
author: Joshua J.

description: brunch special caught my eye so we stop in because my friends wanted pasta.  Great place for pasta.   Im not a pasta fan but I can do brunch.  But I wouldn't recommend eating brunch here if your expecting a big breakfast or brunch.  The portion here was just  right.  But other places serve more so be prepare on the special menu.
author: Linda B.

description: I had a lovely experience here! The staff was very attentive and provided excellent service. The food was delectable, and the overall environment was vibrant. If you are ever in San Francisco's North Beach area, this would be a place worth visiting!
author: Mahin A.

description: This place is great! Amazing Italian food in the heart of North Beach San Francisco with so many Italian places competing. You won't be disappointed. Definitely more high end than many in the area, but worth it. I love their pasta carbonara.
author: Peter K.

description: I'm from Emilia Romagna so I am superpicky about italian food since it is typically 50% sicilian 50% american but this place is authentic and very good. NOT cheap but for the food and the area is perfectly reasonable. I had Tortellini alla Bolognese, which is blasphemy in my area (tortellini are always only with panna!) but I didn't care and they were very good, the ragu' (aka bolognese sauce) tasted like my gramma used to make it. The service was pretty fast, although not the most friendly (the guy seemed pretty rushed). However he was not rude and I couldn't care less, I liked the food and that's what matters to me.
author: Robby G.

description:
I love linguini (with clams and mussels) and Pinocchio's was fabulous! It was amazing place our driver told us about while my wife and I were in SF.

I would go there every time I'm in SF!
author: M A.

description:
Compared to other italian restaurants in the area, this is one of the worst.
Pasta came uncooked
We were not served water until end of our dinner
Pizza tastes bad
Waiters are not friendly
Avoid and try others nearby...
author: Erdal K.

description:
Greeting- hawkers
Vibe- little Italy tourista
Prices- average
Parking- good luck
Service- very good
Food
Calamari Fritti $10 was good
Insalata Mista was feasible $6.50
Gnocchi Sorrentina $16 was better than most. But gnocchi tasted pre boiled rather than cooked to order
Baba Rum was not good-returned

WIGB? No
author: Hungry K.

description: This was my 3rd visit in a week to this restaurant. Tonight I was disappointed in the lobster and crab ravioli I could not find any lobster at all now the crab was good and plentiful but it was not seasoned it was tasteless so I added salt pepper and chili pepper and it was much better . Earlyer this week the carbinara and the Lassana were excellent also I tried the Pear and nuts and cheese desert for $13 it was only a cheese plate with 1/4 a unripened pear sliced with nuts and cheese and a 1/8 cup of honey very disappointed in this desert! also the male Bartender my last 2 visits never interduced himself even though I was friendly and talkative and tonight he was down right inattentive .
author: David W.

description:
We went for the happy hour early dinner here over 4 hours ago and I'm still full!
Great value at around $17 for a 2 course meal if you go late afternoon (before 6.30). Choice of salad or minestrone (on the day I went) plus a pasta dish. Bread is thrown into the mix and I'm very happy with my green salad and fettucini Alfredo. Plus a beer is $4 or a very decent sized glass of wine $5.
So for 2 of us, it came to $44 plus tip.

Great service too; friendly, fast and authentic.
author: Rickie J.

description:
This place was OK, the food and service was good, only complaint was they charged $3.75 per soda and did not mention it was not free refills.

I would not rush back.
author: Drew M.

description:
I really enjoyed this restaurant. My mom and I came here during my first visit to SF. We were referred to this restaurant by a tour guide we had on a Napa Valley tour. We were going to go to another restaurant near by but as I was walking by I heard a group of people speaking Italian eating at a table outside. It caught my eye because I would think if people who are Italian are eating here it must be good. 
Our server was really great he was very accommodating. We didn't wait very long for our food and it was very delicious. I got the Chicken Parmesan and it was very good! My mom got a seafood pasta and that was delicious as well! 
I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Christina R.

description:
Came here for a Mother's Day late lunch. We were a party of 4 and brought our own bottle of sparkling for a toast and couldn't be happier. 
We were seated right away and had a great waiter. He was very attentive, answered any questions we had, and was happy to make any substitutions we needed. The prices were fair for North Beach and the food was delicious. 
Our party ordered the lasagna, chicken alfredo, chicken parm, and the pasta primavera. All our dishes were prepared perfectly and we have no complaints. I would definitely come here again.
author: Angela C.

description:
TL;DR: Fantastic homemade pasta's. Very attentive wait staff. Good selection of wine.

Ended up here after getting rudely turned away at another place around the corner.  Quite pleased things unfolded the way they did.

It was getting on in hours, as we had just come back down from Tahoe and everyone was having a hankering for Italian.  We were seated quickly, and the establishment looked very polished, clean, and classy (although I'm sure we didn't).

The waiter we had was uber attentive, almost to a fault.  He probably could have given us a little more time with our menus and in between trips, but I believe we were probably one of his last two tables for the night.  Even with all the attention, didn't feel rushed, just that he wanted to make sure we got what we wanted when we wanted.

He suggested a nice white for us (pinot grigio, i believe), which was quite pleasant and light, perfect for the mood of the table given the long car trip.  I always appreciate when a wait staff can read their customers and have a good command over their wine list.

There were three of us at the table, I had the gnocchi, my girlfriend had Linguine con Vongole e Cozze, minus the mussles (this took a little bit of a struggle to get figured out, I think the guys first language was actually Italian, and we were' sure what the word for Mussels was), and our other companion had Chicken Parm (i tried to steer him to something more authentic but he was happy with his dish; who am I fault him, I love a good chicken parm).

Everyone was very pleased, though I can only personally speak to my own dish.  The Gnocchi. It was, hands down, one of the best gnocchi dishes I've ever had.  The sauce was good, mixed in with some fresh melted mozzarella (really good stuff), but that wasn't what stood out.  It was the pasta itself; in a word, sublime.  They were these little pillowy dumplings, soft with the right hint of chew to them, but they almost seemed to melt over your tongue.  I just ate, and just thinking about it is making my mouth water and I'm getting hungry all over again.

I could keep going on about this place, but the best way for you to understand is to just go there. Tonight, if possible. Thoroughly enjoyed myself, and will definitely be going back there.
author: Christopher G.

description: "Lasciate ogni speranza, voi ch'entrate" (abandon all hope, you who enter here) Dante Alighieri, Inferno. I should follow my gut feeling and escape at once, after seeing all those half full plates returning to the kitchen... but I didn't... The front of house lady was fast and efficient. Went for the Pizza Quattro Stagioni and a draft Moretti beer... and here we go... the unremarkable bland dough was uneven, deep pan on its "South East", burnt and solid as a Rivita biscuit on its "North". The California South-of-the-Border pizzaiolo burnt the salami slices too...but it was OK as he buried his crime under a cheap and salty ham. As Italian server Mariano, was very simpatico we pardoned him, but the owner should taste his own pizza before selling it to human beings (Note: pizza not apt for animal testing either)... also a 15% service charge magically appeared on my check...And I could not even check the papers as Pinocchio has not Wi-Fi either...Oh, well...as I said, should ran for my life but I did not...
author: Pablo D.

description: We had a terrific experience! The Figs & Burata and the Mussels and Clams appetizers were delicious. So was the homemade Fettuccine with Salmon and the Butternut Squash Ravioli entrees. Also had an enjoyable half bottle of BV Cab. Topped it all with dessert and a very tasty Baileys Mint and Cappuccino. The service was warm and friendly. We highly recommend Trattoria Pinocchio!!
author: Steve I.

description:
Don't come here if you're in a hurry. Service was slow, which would've been okay except that we had a show to catch. 

That being said, they make a mean lemon drop and the bruschetta is fab. I got the chicken piccata and thought it was really good, while hubby's spaghetti & meatballs were "just alright" (his words; I didn't try it). 

Our server and busser were really friendly, plus is was nice that we got a seat outside (under the heat lamp) so we could people-watch. It's just a shame that we had to wait so long for everything. 

Bottom line: I'd go back for a lemon drop & bruschetta happy hour, but only if I had plenty of time on my hands.
author: Ashley P.

description: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach. Full menu with all our favorites, and more. The have a great wine list and a good selection of scotch. Great food, wonderful desserts and a very friendly staff.  Parking can be challenging. Reservations are recommended.
author: Rick K.

description: Everything was fine, kind of spendy.  Great atmosphere though, and when we sat for a while after eating no one came by and tried to push us out the door.  I would really give them a 3.5 just because the price seemed a lot for what we got.  I guess you were paying for the atmosphere?
author: Mark O.

description:
Two words: below par.

I was there with my friends after roaming around Little Italy area, trying to figure out where to eat. We decided to give this place a try, and got seated. The ambience was pretty quaint, and the service was really good, but the food was not. We ordered Ravioli di Salsiccia and a pepperoni pizza, but they were just.... average. For the ravioli, the sauce was really good, but the ravioli itself wasn't cooked very well. It was slightly hard, and I didn't understand why the inside was so soggy and bland. For the pizza, I feel like I would've been better off at Domino's or Pizza Hut. It looked like a cafeteria pizza, if I'm honest.

Bottom line: this restaurant is more for tourists. If you are searching for a high-quality Italian food, I recommend Tommaso's. Similar price, but the taste/quality difference is massive.
author: Paul C.

description:
OK...I'm over it. My husband and I have been going here for years; it WAS our go-to place to bring and recommend to family and friends from out of town. No more! The food (when it's right) is delicious, but it's inconsistent and the servers are horrible (the bussers are wonderful, though). 

A few nights ago, my husband and I stopped by for a nice dinner. I ordered my usual...eggplant parm. I have this every time we go...I can't even count how many times I've enjoyed it. The other night, the eggplant was nearly raw...it's was still crunchy. When the server came by, I told him the problem. He didn't even take the dish away, but went and checked with the kitchen. He came back and told me they said it had been cooked the right way and the same as any other, fried then baked. I told him I had had it several times at their restaurant and he said he couldn't do anything about it. I asked for a menu to order something else. He had the hostess bring the menu and he NEVER CAME BACK. I shared my husband's meal and the server never even brought the check. We left some cash (for the one shared dish) and left. It was ridiculous.

Needless to say, we won't be going back to our favorite Italian restaurant; we'll try another on Columbus. But hey, who needs good service when your business just relies on one-time tourists anyway? That's a good reason to not care, right?
author: Chris S.

description:
We stopped in here after we couldn't get into the deli down the street - just wanted to sit down at a table outside and enjoy the weather. 

I had the prosciutto and mozzarella panini - my son had the italian sausage panini and we shared halves. Both were good, but the sausage was a little light on the sausage. My friends ordered a prosciutto appetizer which they liked, and a pizza.

The food was pretty good - can't really complain. Here is the problem - service. I think we got the new guy who took our order and pretty much forgot about us after that. We were not in a big hurry so we were not too upset it took a while to get our food, but they completely forgot about my friends pizza. After waiting a half hour after they finished their appetizer, we had to wave someone down about the pizza - they looked baffled and it was apparent they completely forgot. It took another 20 minutes to get the pizza.

There are italian restaurants galore in that area - I would try several new ones before I went back.
author: Tom C.

description:
Service - 5, Food - 5, Atmosphere - 5, Bathroom - n/a, Price - 5

Came here with bf and our friend, Jesse S. on our way home from a weekend in Tahoe. Did some browsing for Italian places while bf was driving and we all decided on a place that was actually around the corner (see review for Franchino) We were treated extremely poorly there before even being seated so we left and wandered in to this place, which is close by.

The service was exceptional. Our waiter was very attentive and warm. When we asked for a wine recommendation, he offered wines that varied in price, instead of the cheapest on the menu. This is important to me because even though the place looked very nice, we did not. After a weekend in Tahoe, we definitely were not in our Sunday best, but the waiter did not make assumptions. We settled on a mid-priced bottle of Pinot Grigio (I don't recall the brand) that was very tasty. My only complaints would be that the waiter was almost too attentive at times, but it was a slow Sunday night, and Italian appeared to be his first language, so at times it was a touch difficult to communicate. Both very small details that did not effect the night.

Food was very good. I had the Linguine with clams and mussels, although I asked for it without mussels. Not a fan. This took a minute to convey to the waiter, as I did not know the Italian word for mussels. Simple dish but made very well. Pasta and clams were cooked perfectly. It was tossed in a white wine sauce with to,tomatoes. Bf had the gnocchi which were super light and fluffy. Probably the best I have had. Jesse S. had Chicken Parmesan which looked tasty but I did not try.

Atmosphere was classy but inviting. Everything was very clean and kept. Well decorated. Candles on the table.

Price was very affordable for the quality and portion sizes. I took home enough leftovers for a full second meal.

Will definitely be coming back here again when we are in the neighborhood.
author: Sara M.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. Their pasta is simply remarkable.  On this trip I had the Ravioli Pomodoro and it was wonderful. The pasta always has the perfect taste and perfect al dente firmness. My wife had Spaghetti Bolognese which was just as good. The only reason it gave a 4 star rating was that the waiter was pretty standoffish. He was efficient enough...just not very friendly at all. Perhaps that wouldn't bother some folks but my Midwest upbringing likes service with a smile. But the food is always 5 star.
author: Bill W.

description:
"excuse me bartender, this beer is flat."
"very sorry Sir, I'll get you another"
"I think this might be from the same tap as its also flat"
"we only have one tap, do you want another"
"....no, goodbye"

I can't speak for the pasta but based on my experience at the bar, won't be coming back.
author: jenn s.

description: Pricey, yes, but it's normal for San Francisco.  Food delicious and ample portions.  Impeccable, friendly service.  We went with time to spare before our date with beach blanket Babylon (a terrific show by the way). Early dinner because some if these reviews indicated service was a bit slow but not true at all on this night.  We were in and out in an hour.  It was difficult to choose which restaurant to go to since there are so many here in little Italy.  We feel that we made a good choice.
author: Renee A.

description:
Cute little Italian restaurant in Italy.. i mean North Beach!=)
I had the linguini del pescatore~ and a glass of pinot noir...and calamari..Food was really good. Service was not bad and i , like i always do , spoke my little Italian words and they were happy about it. =)

Stinking Rose in the area is not what it is all hyped up to be.. Mona Lisa and Calzones are good but then there is this place and it was really good!
If you are in the area, why not? .. i'd recommend it. 
They are open on Christmas! haha=)
author: C A.

description: Amazing food - thoroughly enjoyed the Carbonara (pasta is made on prem daily and it SHOWS).  Even the bread was fantastic (reminded me if my dear departed Italian grandmothers with the perfect thick crust).  Finally the Tiramisu - heaven!  Top it off with the house Chianti & I've died and gone to heaven.   Great meal on the last day of a great trip :-)
author: Denise N.

description: Excellent service and food!! Great ambiance!  Ended up in this restaurant after having a terrible experience in "Chinatown Restaurant".. The service and food here changed our day.. We stopped for Pizza for the kids and we felt so welcomed that we ordered wine, brushetas , beer and a home made tiramisu which was delicious ... We were even offered a lemmochelo for after dinner drink ... Thank you for making our day a memorable one !!! Highly recommend it!!
author: Yuni N.

description: Service was pleasant and attentive.  Al fresco seating was nice to people watch and a heater to take away the chill.  Bruschetta was very tasty, but our cappellini and caprese salad were good, but overall an average experience.
author: Brian G.

description:
Excellent pasta! Had the veal ravioli (not sure what the formal name was) and the sauce was magnificent! Very different yummy flavors and the vibe made me feel like I was in Italy! I loved sitting outdoors and experiencing the festive streets.

As a side note, the strawberry Italian soda was too sweet for me---the cherry was perfect though in my opinion.
author: Sandi A.

description: Loved the food here. We had cocktails and two appetizers before going to a show. Carpaccio and a fig, goat cheese specialty antipasto. Delicious!  They use quality ingredients.....wonderful garlicky capers and olives, mild but tasty prosciutto. Apparently they make their own pasta and we are planning to come back for a full dinner at our next visit.
author: Dominique S.

description: Walked by this restaurant, had already had dinner in Chinatown but were looking for a place to have a cup of coffee since it was getting cold.  Staff were very friendly and accomodating, we had a seat outdoors.  Coffee/hot chocolate was very good.  Ordered the poached pears on a whim.  Very sweet and chocolatey.  The poached pears were delicious on their own.   Will definitely be having a sit-down dinner at this place the next time I am in town!
author: Alma B.

description:
My mom and I went on the North Beach/Little Italy tour the first week of October while we were visiting SF and generally enjoyed it. Our tour included the most delicious pasta from Trattoria Pinnochio!! it was a homemade cut penne with a tomato basil sauce. It was so good, we decided to back there another night while in SF. 

When we went back to Trattoria Pinnochio for dinner another night during our visit, our waiter was awful. He was extremely unattentive and bought us the wrong order. He claimed they didnt have that type homemade pasta, when we had it the day before. 

We learned the option they give you on the tour is not on the general menu and was much better than our dinner.
author: Marlena F.

description: While visiting the city and looking for a local place to eat, we stopped here to look at the menu. The hostess(owner?) immediately came out and was so friendly and eager to have us try the restaurant. We said we would come back after a little more sightseeing and she gave my wife her card.  When we came back, our family was sat immediately. The server was funny and friendly and really made the experience great. The wine, food and service was top notch and affordable for a night on while on vacation.  You will not be disappointed here
author: Ray R.

description: Came here just after New Year's Day for a mid afternoon snack and drink; liked it so much that we wound up coming back that same day for dinner!  Good food that is fairly priced, well presented, in a cozy location - AND in a touristy neighborhood - is nothing to scoff at. My Son had the veal and loved it; my Wife said her lasagna was among the best she's had outside of Rome.  My pizza was very tasty, with a nice homemade dough.  Nicely priced wines made our vacation night on the town affordable.  My advice? If in town for a holiday, skip the overpriced places at Fisherman's Wharf,  head to North Beach, and try Trattoria Pinocchio!
author: Chuck T.

description:
I absolutely love this place!  The food here is delicious and the decor is nice!  It's a great Italian spot and I bring all of my out-of-town friends to eat here.  It all started when I came here with a group of co-workers for lunch one day and we all fell in love with this place.  The food is delicious and the staff is wonderful!  We even recommended to our office manager that this should be where we should hold our annual company luncheon at.  Our manager agreed and we did!   We had the pleasure of working directly with the owner who was very friendly, helpful and accommodating, she definitely knows her stuff and helped us out a lot!  Our colleagues were happy and complimented how much they enjoyed the food.

I'm repeat eater here and I definitely recommend this place.  Try the lasagna here, it's my favorite!
author: Rachel R.

description: This place is amazing !!! We found it because we're just walking by and a wonderful young lady spoke to us about the restaurant ,have us a card and went back to dine there, great service great food and super attentive staff will def.come back when I come to San Francisco!!! Everybody needs to come here it's so awesome! Very authentic and real Italian food cuisine!!!
author: Bibi D.

description: Looking for an Italian restaurant after visiting Coit Tower. Yelp reviews positive so we tried it. Great service & food. Appetizer grilled octopus in black polenta- amazing! Octopus very tender. Main course Linguini Polermo with perfect al dente pasta and excellent assortment seafood. Other main dish ravioli with crab & lobster in rose cream sauce, wonderful. Desert spiced pears in dark chocolate sauce. Prices reasonable. We will be back when we are in San Fran again.
author: Barbara S.

description:
Had lunch in here with 5 friends! The food was great! the wine was wonderful and the service was friendly and professional! This will be one of my "must stops" every time I come into the city. We stayed for hours just chatting and enjoying the beautiful restaurant!!

Thanks for a great afternoon! Can't wait to come back!
author: Seana H.

description: When I lived in San Francisco I lived right up the street from this treasure. Best Italian food I have ever had... ever. And my Italian uncle would kill me for saying this. Located on the cutest corner with a few outside tables on the sidewalk, it makes for an amazing setting. Every time I went I had the fettuccine in white sauce and a side of spinach. I also would accompany it with the house Pinot Griego. Everyone do yourselves a favor... try this place!
author: Ashley L.

description: Terrible service in this largely touristy restaurant. After disorganized and rude service, they made a mistake with our order - had to reorder the correct main dish which took another 30mins to come. No apology. And they still included that item on the bill. Food passable. Not recommended mainly due to very poor service.
author: Stephen F.

description: Great service, okay food. Out-of-town visitors wanted some Italian food on a Saturday afternoon so we stopped in. Antipasti was good and presented as a shareable portion. Only caveat is that it might be hard to share with 3+ people because the portions of each element are limited - 2 pieces of tomato, basil, mozzarella and one piece of bruschetta, for example. Also ordered a pizza, which was forgettable. Rather greasy and not especially flavorful. The service itself was great and the atmosphere was fresh. If you want excellent pizza though, head to Golden Boy.
author: Rob E.

description: Not cool place! Bad service and tips included in the bill! Pasta Arabiata is not eatable!!
author: Stanislav K.

description: What a shame.  Ask me a few weeks ago about this place and I would have rated a four or five.  After today's experience they get a solid 1.  Went here for a late lunch on my birthday.  Sat outside, and ordered fairly quickly.  (2 apps, 2 entrees, plus drinks) so at this point were spending about 100 dollars.  Our appetizers and food came out at exactly the same time.  When the server saw what happened he sent the entrees back to the kitchen and was like sorry guys they shouldn't have made everything together like that.  Annoyed, but not thinking it's the end of the world we continue eating.  Now the food runners are hovering around our table waiting for us to eat our apps to try and drop our food ASAP before it died in the window.  Additionally, twice, in a less than 5 minute period we were asked "are u ready for your food now?" Now I'm getting annoyed.  We're spending 100 bucks on my bday to sit and enjoy a nice meal outside on a beautiful day and now we are being rushed and racing against the clock for our food to not dry up in the kitchen heat Windows.  After the second attempt to drop our food, I decided to say something.  At this point it had been about 10 minutes.  I told the server that we were taking our time eating the apps and I would like it if the meals were made fresh.  (We both ordered pasta dishes.) he guaranteed they would be.  After then a third attempt to drop our food, I decided to say something to the manager. I went to the host and asked if their was a manager available, and she said no.  No manager was there and that any issues could be handled by the server.  Odd, so there's no manger on a Saturday night? Strange but ok.  She asked what was happening and I briefly told her.  Her response was well let me see what I can do.  I see her go to the kitchen, the server and food runners are now very obviously discussing what happened while pointing and gawking in our direction.  She's comes back out and is like their going to remake them.  Ok fine, we keep munching on the apps again trying to enjoy the afternoon outside.  When we finally finished our apps, our food came out immediately.  Apps plates taken food dropped right away, seemed a bit suspicious to me.  I don't think anything was remade.  The food was a HUGE disappointment.  Considering we are semi regulars we know what the normal quality of the food is and this was terrible.  Very, very obviously the food was not remade but rather "freshened up" with some new sauce, and maybe a quick sauté in a pan.  I've worked in restaurants for many years of my life and know all the tricks of the trade.  The meals must have been sitting in the heat window for an absolute minimum of 15 mins.  No one came and asked how our meals were until we were about half way done.  At this point I didn't want to continue to complain so we just lied and said it was fine.  Our bill was 93 dollars and what a shitty experience it was.  Not a 100 dollar meal or service worthy.  Not a good birthday experience.   The staff seemed like they couldn't care any less.  Plenty and I mean plenty of other places is north beach to visit.  This one you can skip.
author: Jared P.

description:
Cute Italian restaurant in North Beach that  I absolutely had a fantastic time at! The host was so hilarious and charming in his thick Italian accent; it seriously made our meal exponentially more enjoyable! The ambiance was great--could either be romantic or fun for a groups of friends! I came with 3 other girls and we were seated immediately when we walked in (around 7:30 on a Friday night). 

ORDERED:

[Veal Lasagna]: I normally stray away from ordering lasagna when I go out just because I think it's so ordinary and I want to try other things. But thanks to a quick tip on Yelp, I decided to just go with it. It was delicious! No regrets. The meat sauce was so flavorful and the layers of cheese between the flat noodles really brought everything together. It didn't look like a lot at first, but that dish really filled me up! Yum!

[Gnocchi sorrentino]: Someone else ordered this, and a word about gnocchi...do not be fooled by what looks like a small amount of these fluffy potato dumplings. They're pretty dense and delicious!

[Linguine with clams]: I forget what the official name of this is...and it actually looked more like spaghetti than linguine, but I had a bite of my friend's pasta. Now, I don't like clams much, but I think if you're a big clam lover (like my friend who ordered this is) you'll love this one. There were so many clams in her dish, she said she had a harder time finding pasta than clams! And the noodles themselves were very well-flavored--like they were infused with ocean. Personally, it's not my go to dish, but I know there are many clam lovers out there =)

[Minestrone soup]: Not going to lie, I literally only had the carrots of this soup (because my girl friend didn't like carrots) and just from eating those, the soup tasted delicious. If carrots could taste that good, the soup must have been amazing. 

We had a great time here, and the Italian host really made our night more memorable and enjoyable. After taking a picture for us, he tried selling my camera to the next table for $4. hahah...what a charmer. I'd come back for more =) 

The only minus I think would be the bread...I love me some good bread, (yes, pre-carbohydrate overload) and their bread was just okay.
