Price-wise, it's what you'd expect for dinner at any ordinary Italian place, and maybe a little more since it's SF and there's those health taxes and whatever...but the experience and food made up for it for sure! They really take their time to make classic Italian dishes beyond what you'd expect.
author: Jasmine C.

description: Loved it! We came here first 10 years ago and loved the service and the food! They even custom made something for my 3 year old to help make him happy! Now we are still coming every time we visit the City! Favorite is the tortellini Noci. So good. The ravioli was also great! We've tried many North Beach restaurants but settled here for our favorite!!!! Still amazing after 10 years!
author: Doug W.

description: Visited this quaint restaurant yesterday and had a decent meal with adequate service. I chose the homemade fettuccine Alfredo and it was pretty good, it came with minestrone soup.. The soup was fine, but not the best I've had. I was dining with 3 children and found their children's selections to be lacking, as they only had one option. Luckily they had pizza which we were able to split between them. The prices are a bit high, but being right on Columbus does demand somewhat of a premium so I won't hold it against them. They also charge a 1% fee to every order to offset their healthcare costs, which seemed a little petty. I mean, I paid $70+ for 3 kids and an adult I would think they could get by without adding another buck onto the bill, but whatevs. All in all, we were satisfied with our experience, but it didn't knock our socks off.
author: M C.

description: Gnocchi was delicious, ravioli was undercooked. Brechetta was diced tomatoes and onions  (more like salsa), it should have been fresh sliced tomatoes with mozzarella. No fresh parmegean, even olive garden has that.
author: Anthony R.

description: I love this place! Went in there on a whim last night and had the best linguine vongole ever!!!!! The atmosphere is so cute and the service is wonderful. It is a fantastic place to people watch and enjoy the night life of Little Italy. Not to mention both the poached pears and the tarimasu are to die for!
author: Kylie T.

description: Excellent food and service! Walked in the door and wad immediately treated like I was a regular and a VIP! This is my first Yelp review and I am writing it because of this restaurant. They made my last night in San Francisco end with an incredible dinner experience!
author: Gabriel N.

description: The food was delicious. The service was "meh" but they still18% gratuity for a party of 5. I would have only given 15% as they did not even bring our appetizer and brought us water only when our meal came. Kudos to the chefs though, the gnocchi was cooked very well and the ravioli was very tasty.
author: Lisa H.

description: I was recommended here by my sister and was very disappointed.  I will go off of what my bf said when we came here on the 22nd.  The service from Fausto was awful. We were ignored a lot of the time.  As we sat down I noticed a dirty fork.  My bf didn't get his coke until he reminded our waiter.  We were never asked how our food was, which wasn't anything to write home about.  My potatoes were slightly undercooked and the salmon was ok.  He forgot about our appetizer and then blamed the chef for losing our ticket.  If our waiter had been more attentive he would have noticed our missing appetizer.  Never were we asked for refills either.  The extra staff who brought our food out, and the bus boys were more helpful than Fausto.  Overall it was a big let down and don't think we'll be returning.
author: Renee P.

description:
We had an awesome meal here
  Ravioli was fresh and delicious.  Gnocchi was out of this wirld.  Light and fluffy pieces of heaven
author: Nancy B.

description:
The owner of Pinocchio's is a very rude man!  I will never be back.  We had a party of 14 and a few of us were running late.  He came over to our table and in a very aggressive way said, your friends are not coming so I'm going to take this table.  Of course everyone showed.  It was a very busy weekend in SF so traffic coming in was crazy.  

He said he doesn't know who took the reservation because he never would have taken it.  Now, I've been to this restaurant several times over the years and brought in new customers.  I will just say, that shows how much they care about the actual customer.  THEY DON'T CARE about your experience clearly.  We won't be back and there are much better restaurants in the area.  GO to "Steps of Rome!"
author: yvette j.

description:
One of the best places to eat in San Fran. Great food, Great atmosphere and GREAT SERVICE.

I keep reading bad service, and I wonder why? Maybe it's you. Not to be rude, but ask yourself the question. How am I when I go out with friends, relatives or my significant other?

Either that, or my wife is NASTY SMOKING HOT!! and that's why we get such great service....

No, for real. some places just blow, but so far, this place has been spot on.
author: Neon C.

description: I tested positive for HIV shortly after eating breakfast here with my cousins from out of town
author: Benjamin D.

description: Food was not worth the price.  I wish we had gone elsewhere.  The gnocchi was so so and the staff snooty.
author: Amy B.

description:
This has been our favorite Italian restaurant in all of SF for about 8 years now.  We always try a different place based and get disappointing. This place hands down is the best in town. 

My recommendation: Set 2-3 hours aside for lunch or dinner.  Get a table outside where you can hear the Italian music.  Order appetizer muscles and clams with a glass of chilled white wine. Next, order their appetizer platter that comes with cheeses, and Italian meats, with a bottle of amorne cesari.  After that if you love sea food order their linguine pescatore.  Next an order of teremiso and conole with cappuccino.
author: Sean B.

description: ....this Italian restaurant came upon us as we were looking for another.....we were welcomed inside by the hostess and we thought why not.  The ambiance was great in that the place was not crowded and we had a nice seat by the big window.  We ordered the calamari, seafood linguine, penne arriabata, and plain cheese pizza.....everything was good especially the calamari.
author: Ji Won K.

description: My family just ate at Pinocchio restaurant and it was a very memorable experience. The five of us ordered five different dishes and each claimed theirs was the best. The wait staff was quick to help and provide us everything we needed. Each bite I took I enjoyed. I would certainly go back there the next time I visit San Francisco again.
author: Laurie S.

description:
We were hoping that Pinocchio's had maintained the level of service and food we remembered from a few years ago.  Sadly that was not the case.  We decided to have lunch here on a Thursday.  There were no customers inside which was fine because it was a beautiful day.  There were a FEW tables of customers outside, but since it was later in the day, those tables were almost done.  It also appeared that some of the tables were occupied by employees.
We sat inside by the windows.
We waited.
We waited even more.
Finally the woman who had directed us in gave us menus.  
I believe we had waited approximately 10 minutes.
We waited.
The waiter finally came to take our orders.
2 glasses pinot noir ($17), Calamari Fritti ($13.95), Gnocci Sorrentina ($20.95) and Spaghetti Bolognese ($18.95).  As you can see we were not just ordering a cup of coffee.
We waited.
Finally the 1 waiter brought 1 glass of wine.  We had to remind him we had ordered 2 glasses.
Long story short:
Service was VERY slow and inconsistent
Wine was just OK
Food was mediocre to just OK
For $91.00 Food+tax+tip we expected a lot more.
We will not re-visit any time soon.
author: Carol H.

description: Swift service and really good Italian authentic food.  The pasta is homemade and very delicious.
author: Mo S.

description:
Definitely not bad - met all my expectations, but didn't exceed any of them.

The food was genuinely good; we tried the eggplant parmigiana and the spaghetti bolognese, and both were quite good.  Neither really blew me away, but I also can't say anything bad about them.  The seating was also decent:  lots of places on Columbus really pack you in like sardines, but we had plenty of room between us and the other customers.  Service was also prompt and professional enough, if not particularly friendly--clearly the guy had a job to do and needed to get on with it, but he certainly wasn't at all rude, and was certainly attentive.

The down-sides were that it seemed a bit too pricey for being just "not bad."  Not horribly overpriced, but a little, to be honest.  The noise level was also a bit higher than you'd want--the kitchen is open to the rest of the restaurant, so a lot of clamoring and clanging emanated from there.
author: Brian F.

description:
OK so I have been a fan of this place for about 6 years now and I've always recommended it to friends and family visiting but after my experience the other night I will not be going back. Ever. 

First off, the dark haired hostess that stands outside like a street walker on the corner needs to wipe the bitc*h off her face and get some personality. She walks around like her ish don't stink. She doesn't smile, talk or anything. She didn't greet us at all. Just took a look at me and my friend, looked us up and down and grabbed two menus and pointed at a table to walk to. Really? She didn't even smile or say Your waiter will be right with you or anything. And after she sat us, she walked right back outside to the street corner. Seriously, is the owner her daddy or something where she can actually get away with that kind of behavior???

And now for the waiter.....oh where to start. He was some older guy, never seen him before, very broken English...but he criticized every single thing we ordered. First it was our drinks. He didn't like the fact that I only ordered an iced tea and he really didn't like the fact that my friend was a guy and ordering a Long Island Iced Tea. He insinuated it wasn't a manly drink and shook his head in disbelief. WTF? Then when I ordered the steak he said Can I prepare that for you medium rare? And I said No, I would like it well done. And he gasps in horror, says Oh no you can't eat it that way, and then says to my friend Tell her she can't eat it that way! She won't get the flavor! I said I want my steak cooked well done, no less. I've been eating steak for 30 years; I think I know how I like it cooked. But he couldn't stop there. He just kept pestering me over and over about how wrong I was for getting it well done. Whatever dude. Keep your comments to yourself. So anyways, on top of that the service wasn't that great. Kept having to ask for drink refills, bread refills, etc. 

Our salad starters were not very good at all. We got house salads with the house dressing....my advice? Pass on that. Overpriced for that cruddy salad and there is plenty of free bread to snack on before your meal. The steak was OK. I liked the sauce they cooked it in but it was very fatty and only came with a tiny few veggies, like two carrots and two of something else. Not really worth the $30 spent. Dessert was so so. I had the chocolate mouse and it was probably the highlight of my meal. Needless to say, this place has gone downhill. I'm so disappointed because it used to be so great but it seems none of the same waiters are there anymore and the new hostess has a real bug up her butt.
author: Dusty N.

description: By far the best itailian food in all of San Francisco. I make it a point to stop here everytime I am in the city even if I'm just driving threw to get a fresh canioli. The tortellini with the meat sause is the best I have ever had. I come from and Italian heritage and it is hard to find a restaurant that is better than the food my mother made us at home. Great service on top of the Great food is a double treat!!
author: Chuck S.

description:
A late night meal here was the best way to wrap up Valentine's Day, especially given the fact that we didn't have a reservation. My date and I wanted to eat as far away from Pillow Fight as possible, and because the North Beach garage is always open, we decided to park there and walk around in search of food. We didn't find anything, but I did find Adam E., who pointed us in the direction of this great little place! Thanks dude!

My date and I waited 15 minutes for our table but it wasn't a big deal because there was plenty of room at the bar. The bartender was a cool guy, and also very honest (he steered me away from some trendy pomegranate drink to a classic - and delicious - gin fizz). He also didn't *really* make fun of me for downing 3 glasses of water the second I sat down. 

We were seated outdoors, and while it did take a while for everything to arrive, it was all on point:

Insalata Caprese - can't go wrong with a classic, mozzarella, basil and tomato salad, and this particular version was drizzled with pesto, which I thought was a nice way to tie all the flavors together. I would have liked more grilled bread on the side, but it was great nonetheless. 

Capasante al Prosciutto - I make it a point to order any incarnation of scallops wrapped in salty meat whenever it's available, and this version did not disappoint. I had about 6 or 7 prosciutto-wrapped scallops on my plate, sauteed in wine and butter, and even though that doesn't sound like much, it filled me up. I ordered sauteed veggies to offset the rich saltiness of the seafood and meat. 

Filetto al Pepe Verde - this is what my date ordered, filet mignon served with sauteed veggies and garlic-rosemary roasted potatoes. This was just about the most perfect steak we both had in a very long time.

I would come back again! The food is fantastic, and if you get a table outside (weather permitting), it's the perfect location for people watching.
author: Aivy C.

description: I have eaten here numerous times, and the food is excellent!  I have not had their pizza, as I really come here for the top end Italian dishes... and you have to try the gnocchi. It is the best you will have anywhere.  Price.... a bit high, but its been worth it. Service has been very good; never a bad experience, though they do have some new staff that are not as outgoing as some of the past employees.
author: Ken A.

description: I have been wanting to go to Trattoria Pinocchio for a while now.  My husband took me and a friend there for Mother's Day.  We were greeted by the manager who was very friendly.  We didn't have reservations and did not have to wait for a table.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated with a lot of room inside or you can choose to sit outside.  The menu selection is wonderful with a lot to choose from to satisfy your palate.  We ordered the Insalata di Spinaci, Risotto Seafood, Linguine con Vongole e Cozze and the biggest  4 Stagioni Calzone.  Each entree was so delicious. The Italian herbs and flavors were of this world and popped with every bite. Not to mention that yummy Italian bread. Our waiter was very nice and accommodating.  Everyone that worked at the restaurant was friendly including the fabulous Chefs. We were very happy with Trattoria Pinocchio.  We'll definitely be back.
author: T R.

description: I stumbled in late on a week night.  I had a fantastic antipasto which was so large I could barely finish it.  The people are very nice and the service was impeccable.
author: Moon S.

description:
Not quite sure how this restaurant has a 4 star rating!  The recent reviews to my right support this. This Owner, Giovanni, is loud & coarse, like a guy with a grapple dragging you into the place!. Atmosphere is good. Service was good. The minute we received our horrible entrees, and complained, the "owner" Giovanni was no where to be found. He had convinced my sister that the spinach salad with fresh orange slices, homemade lemon vinegarette dressing was the freshest and fabulous. The spinach was cut, had black edges on some of the leaves!, canned oranges, Italian dressing! 2 of us ordered angel hair pasta, tossed in Olive oil, fresh diced tomatoes, fresh basil, twice!, couldn't get it!, got some stuff with a red sauce and tiny tomato pieces, definitely not fresh. My Caesar salad was supposed to have shaved parmesan cheese, homemade dressing, etc., not the case, knew I might be in trouble when it arrived with cherry tomatoes around the edges. I ordered Veal Masala, never in my entire life have I ever had a worse presentation or food quality. It was a pre-packaged, breaded veal cutlet, drowned in something resembling Frenches canned gravy with canned mushrooms and a touch of Masala stirred in!  It was just awful! Denny's could do a better job!. The Veal Parm. was awful too, tough. Even if it was pre-packaged by the Sysco food purveyors, it would have been better!
My sister left the table, sat outside in a chair by the front door and told everyone who walked up to the restaurant, they were making a huge mistake. That same dark haired girl with the attitude tried to get her to leave, didn't work...ha ha! We were originally going to Tony's, it was already 8PM, Tony's had a 2-1/2 hour wait, so we decided to try some other place, huge mistake, a complete waste of money. Shouldn't have paid the bill, tipped the server well, not his fault.
author: Roberta E.

description: We were forced to find a restaurant with outside seating since we had our dog with us and stumbled into this delicous italian haven.  It wasn't busy during lunch time on a weekday so wait staff were extra attentive.  They even brought my dog water!  So sweet!  I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana and the BF ordered the Chicken Saltimboca.  Both dishes were full of flavor and exceeded my expectations.  I love accidentally stumbling into delicious restaurants.  Definitely a place I'd come and eat again!
author: TRACY R.

description: A March evening, sitting outside under the heaters, listening to Italian tenors sing....ambience was perfect! The meal started with a Caprices salad with the BEST Balsamic vinegar I've ever tasted followed by Butternut Squash Ravioli in a cream sauce; all of it superb! Finished the meal with espresso and a creamy Tiramisu. This will be our weekend ending dinner on the times we return to SF.
author: D F.

description: Food is okay. We ordered two pastas, rissoto was good but penne was hard and felt uncooked. Waiters were always busy talking amongst themselves and paid no attention to us. Overall a poor experience.
author: Manveer C.

description: Nice Italian restaurant. Good wine list. Portions are very large. Service is excellent.
author: Jon A.

description:
My husband and I visit North Beach/Little Italy for Authentic Italian food as I am Italian and haven't had authentic Italian food since my grandmother passed. 

We went into Pinocchio's on New Year's Eve for dinner, we entered the door to a hostess who just stared at us, I said "Hi, table for two please?" and the little snot nosed brat said "Do you have a reservation?" I said, "Oh I didn't know it was reservation only." She says "well as you can see ma'am, we're pretty full." As I stared at her with disgust of her attitude, She then says "I'll see if there's a table for you" (from what my husband and I could see were several tables upon counting ourselves.) I believe "I'll see if I can find a table for you" was the FIRST thing she should have said and saved me the rude comment that meant absolutely nothing if you were going to seat us anyways!!

 Then Some ODD french girl comes and takes us to our table across from the kitchen, that would have been fine if the cooks didn't stare all night."

I ordered the a Mint Mojito from their menu and the personality-less waiter tells me they don't have it, and suggests some Brazilian drink for $10, Not to mention, it was terrible! (The Bus Boys were MUCH friendlier)

We then placed our order, My husband ordered Linguini de pollo, $19.00 and a Coke, I ordered Frutti De Mare $25.00 our food arrived and it was the size of our fist... for $19?????  My husband asked for a refill on his soda, they said "We don't do refills!" After our waiter took our order, we never heard from him again, never checked in on us, and what makes things worse, the table behind us had a large group as to where the MANAGER was catering to them... and ONLY THEM because they were spending more money than everyone else, SINGING TO THEM, it was very rude and very lousy customer service to the rest of us. 

We had skipped Appetizers to get their dessert, but after the treatment and service we got, we ate and never ordered anything more.

The clam shells I had were all broken and mixed in the pasta and I nearly broke my teeth a few times, the mussels and clams were EMPTY, there was nothing in them and they had gritty sand still. I like Fresh food, but I like it cleaned also!

If you like expensive restaurants and small portions topped with BAD customer Service, then Go to Pinocchio's, if you want a nice meal, FRIENDLY STAFF and reasonable prices try Pulcinella in North Beach, we only ordered a pizza there for lunch, but they treated us like royalty! 
THAT'S HOW IT'S DONE!!!!!

Dear Pinocchio's: If you're going to offer AVERAGE FOOD for a Sh*t load of Money, then you sure as Sh*t better make up for it with a phenomenal staff!!! 

Pinocchio... FAILED ON EVERYTHING!!
author: Francesca Z.

description: Over Priced - Mediocre food - Tourist Trap , Went there for my Birthday, friends treat, could have eaten at any restaurant in the city,  I picked a Doozy, crossing this place off my list for good
author: Iliel M.

description: Everything we had was fantastic! The best cioppino, linguine with clams and mussels, tortellini with mushroom cream sauce. Great drinks and vino and wonderful service. Will be back for sure!
author: goodytwo s.

description:
Very disappointing experience last night. We go to this restaurant five to six time a year because I like their carbonara even if everything is over priced. Driving 50 miles for that.

Food was average for the first time and I was sick after eating their carbonara.

Waiter did not introduce himself and was not in good mood.

Waiter did not want to serve pizza because he told us that we have to wait for 30 minutes. I never told him that it was a problem but pushed us to change our mind.

We ordered a tomato mozzarella for my daughter instead of a pizza. We asked without basil and pesto. 15 minutes later he came with the tomato mozzarella with pesto and basil on it. We asked him to change it, he told us it was not his fault.

We started eating and 10 minutes later the tomato mozzarella came.

Chocolate mousse was horrible with 70 % of wipe cream. I was wondering were was the chocolate. 7 dollars for that unbelievable.

Decaf served cold. Ice tea refiled and served to my son. Waiter did not remember that it was my glass.

Waiter added 15 % for the service for no reason. I asked him to remove it because I was very disappointed and commented my experience as requested on the bill.

Horrible experience of one of my favorite restaurant before.

Over priced, bad service, I won't go again.
author: Jeff L.

description: A good Italian place to have a bite to eat. The service was a bit slow on our trip to the place, but over all it was a good experience. I had the pesto pasta and it was nice, but our food came out the kitchen in random spurts.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Great pesto! So far, we haven't worked our way past this menu item. The noodles are silky and delicious, the pesto so good we're trying to replicate it at home. 

The lunch portions are perfect: "I doubt I can finish this" midway through, but somehow I managed. Accompanied by a light salad or minestrone. Pinocchio's also serves a great cup of Illy coffee.

The server was attentive and great fun to interact with. We'll be back!
author: Barbara B.

description: Have been eating here for years. Michael left recently and the staff is not attentive as Michael was, food was not good, waiter forgot 2 meals Took a group of friends and not one of us was impressed with anything about food,staff or cooks. Will not return anytime soon. Too many other nice places in North Beach.
author: Inger N.

description: We had to wait 20 minutes to order until I caught the waiter's attention. The food was mediocre at best. My pizza was dripping with grease. Soft drinks were $3.75. When we asked for refills we were told that we would be charged $3.75 more for each drink. Asked for water and didn't receive them until we were almost done with our meal.
author: Dennis B.

description: The check that I received for my daughter and I already included a 18% gratuity. It was a huge turn off, even though we were ready to tip generously for having a pleasant meal of about $100 before tax. Showing gratitude one's own way and being solicited are totally different. We weren't foreigners, and we were just a party of 2. The bill was yet shamelessly suggesting more tips after it had already charged us an automatic 18% gratuity. The food, and the service before seeing the bill, would have been 4 stars. Very disappointed.
author: Yuki T.

description: Not bad, I realize this isn't a trendy or an "in" place to go but it served the purpose.  The pasta and wine were good and a nice place to sit and take a break from sightseeing.
author: Cookie M.

description: Had to "yelp"!  Just had lunch at Pinocchio's!  Typically we have dinner here!  By far REAL dishes from Romo!  We had the Bolognese and puttanesca pasta dishes.  Simple delicious.  Service was impeccable.  Had the lunch special, so it came with either salad or "zuppa"!   We went for greens and although a simple mixed green salad, the dressing was perfect -- balsamic but just the perfect amount!  Bread was served warm!  I highly recommend if you are looking for true Italian food in North Beach!  Mangia bene!
author: Maria T.

description: Had a long, late patio lunch here on Saturday, and fell in love. My mom said it was the best Minestrone she has ever tasted. I had the veal ravioli with the porcini mushroom sauce recommended by our server and I couldn't stop eating. It was so darn good!  I have a new favorite to eat at whenever in San Francisco.
author: Stacey W.

description:
I love the North Beach! My wife and I wanted to get a cappuccino and share a dessert, so we parked the car on Columbus and walked up to Vallejo. We saw the Trattoria Pinocchio's outdoor cafe-style tables, and asked if we could sit outside and order some dessert.

The waiter was clearly Italian and very friendly.

The service was perfect...very European. They didn't keep coming back, interrupting our conversation, and trying to find ways to get a bigger tip. When we needed help, we asked...and received it.

The tiramisu was great, as was the cappuccino. We'll be back!
author: Randal C.

description: My wife and I had dinner here last night and loved it! We started with the portobello mushroom appetizer (amazing), I had italian sausage ravioli (incredible) and my wife had pesto (excellent). We would definitely go back and I would recommend it highly. (A bit loud, so not great for a quiet, romantic dinner if that's what you're looking for.)
author: Marty G.

description:
$ food for $$$ price

What really sucks is that the waiters obviously don't get along with the bus boys and other employees. They made it seem very clear. Our waiter was horrible and took and order and gave us a check. I've seen better service at McDonalds. The bus boy was nice who brought us our food and offered us water, but the food wasn't great and the service our waiter gave was pathetic.

I don't know what's so special about the ravioli here. It tasted generic and there were 4 pieces for like 23$ what a ripoff.

Never returning again.

 
Colosseo across the street has better food and a way better friendly staff
author: Daniel Y.

description:
Stopped by for dinner last night and enjoyed myself. Located in the thick of things in North Beach, Trattoria Pinocchio delivered nicely. The fettucini alfredo with chicken was tasty and not too heavy. Also was a moderate-sized portion so there was no guilt over the cream sauce. Great coffee. Creme Brulee was fab. My Dad's lasagna looked gargantuan and yummy.

Crowd was a friendly mixture of locals and tourists and the place was still hopping at 9:30pm when we first got seated.

I suppose my only gripe would be that the prices seemed just a shade high for the food and experience. No alcoholic drinks and you're still looking at like $40/person if you get an appetizer, but it's SF, so I guess that's to be expected.

If you're in the North Beach neighborhood, you could do alot worse than to have dinner at Trattoria Pinocchio.

And you can trust me on this one; I'm an Elite. ;)
author: Sebastian L.

description:
This is one of the those places where it's what you make of it. 

North Beach is a touristy area, so you're gonna get good food and bad service. Maybe you'll strike gold and get good food and good service, but I wouldn't count on it. I've been eating at the Italian restaurants in this neighborhood since I was a little girl and the service has always been mediocre--the food however, has usually been really good.

Enter Pinocchio's.

Get the fettuccine, lasagna, ravioli or gnocchi, these are made fresh, in house every day. The vegetarian lasagna is really good. It is $16, which isn't bad compared to some of the pasta dishes at $20 and onwards. It is crisp, tender and cheesy all at the same time, with the right balance of cheese to vegetables and a delicious marinara sauce that has just the right amount of sweetness. 

Welcome to Italia!
author: Shira O.

description: Their gnocchi and pesto are amazing! I have gone here several times because it is so fresh and authentic. The family who owns this restaurant interacts with their customers and are very friendly and nice. The food speaks for itself. The gnocchi is homemade and as good as gnocchi I have had when I lived in Italy. The pesto is also very good. Even their appetizer bread is tasty!
author: Amanda T.

description: Yummy Italian food. A little on the small side, but I guess most restaurants in sf are on the tight side.
author: Veronica R.

description:
Delicious! We all ordered off of the happy hour menu, and all four of us loved our dishes. Fettuccine was light, flavorful, So good! The waiter was wandering around singing and it was so nice. He didn't hover over you and make you feel awkward in the middle of your dinner,it just added that nice little touch.
We all loved it!
author: Kerri J.

description:
I guess I should've known never to eat at a restaurant named after a Disney character.  The night started off well.  Our waiter cracked some pretty funny jokes at the beginning and took our order for appetizers and drinks.  He delivered the first round quickly and appetizers soon followed.  But then he forgot about us.  He never took our dinner order and never came back to ask if we wanted a refill on our drinks.  So we sat there...and sat there...and sat there with just our water being refilled.  We finally asked for our check and about 20 minutes later we got it.  Ten minutes later, the bus boy ran our bill.  Then the waiter came back and tried to humor us, but it was too late, we never ordered a main course.  He wasn't funny anymore and I wondered how a restaurant on prime real-estate could have such crappy service.

The food itself was mixed.  The calamari was served luke warm and more gummy than it should've been.  The balsamic portabello was excellent.  And the mussels and clam appetizer was meh.

Bottom line?  Go somewhere else for dinner...
author: Jeff G.

description:
Absolutely horrifying service.

I came here with two of my friends just about a week ago and have encountered the waiter from the twilight zone. I thought his antics could only be seen in the movies. Where to begin...
We waited for 20 minutes for His Majesty to finally arrive at our table. He wrote down our orders and disappeared never to be heard from again. I suspect the dessert I have ordered did not meet his standards of how much one should eat while being served by His Majesty. 49 minutes later, the bus boy had decided to have mercy on us so he brought us our food. Something cold and old, but by then it didn't really matter. We asked for our check right away just to be "clever". Later that afternoon we finally received our check. The bus boy happen to come across it. It looked overpriced but we just wanted to leave and we paid without leaving the tip. I never left without giving a tip before.

My dessert never arrived.
author: Alin O.

description: I loved this place. I had a mixed seafood pasta. The plate was huge and so delicious. The mussels and oysters were cooked just right and succulent. This was  no doubt the best seafood pasta I've had. Also had the buffalo cheese and salami pizza, that was also perfect. There was this almost buttery flavour to the cheese.
author: Blerina B.

description:
Seriously I knew I fell in love with this place when I walked by. It is the absolute perfect combination of intimate italian places and fancy restaurants. 

We were a group of 4 that didn't have a reservation on a saturday night and we were quickly sat down (got there right before the rush!) The server was very informed about the menu and knew exactly what to suggest. I ordered a lemon based chicken with a house salad and it wasn't too big or too small. The dressing they used on the salad was superb. 

Definitely want to come back and try more items on their menu! Loved it!
author: Ezequiel R.

description: Delish!!! I had the crab special and my husband had the Sorentina gnocchi. We both really enjoyed our meals. Even better was the service. Fusto was amazing!  What amazing Italian hospitality!!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
As an Italian I tend to avoid Italian restaurants, but I go here several times a year and highly recommend this restaurant for appetizers and their wine selection. The Bruschetta is a must and the Antipasto Italiano is perfect to share between you and three friends. 

The service is excellent and the appetizers are more than filling. If you aren't starving, avoid trying to tackle an entree solo. 

However, IF you are feeling brave, I've never been disappointed with the gnocchi or any pasta smothered in a pink sauce. 

Using the words of the Most Interesting Man in the World...."I don't always choose [Italian], but when I do, I choose [Pinocchio]."
author: Mike V.

description: The food was TERRIBLE! The mozzarella tomato panini came out looking like it hadn't even been toasted. One bite confirmed this. Luke warm bread and icy cold cheese and tomatoes. The side salad was drenched in dressing. My friend's omelet tasted like day old rubber. A shame the food was awful because the staff was very friendly.
author: Diana C.

description: This is a wonderful place to eat. I loved the service and the food. The staff were friendly. I ordered the carpaccio and the procuitto and melon as an appetizer and I was not disappointed. For dinner I order the butternut squash ravioli (Ravioli di Zucca) and I absolutely loved it. I will definitely be returning to try other dishes because I had a hard time deciding what I wanted when I decided to order the ravioli.
author: Kristina D.

description: We had the Sicilian sausage and eggs.. It was excellent!!  It was served with a fresh green salad... Interesting combo! And the coffee was wonderful. Great service! We sat on patio, so we could enjoy the city. The inside was very nice also.
author: Mandy C.

description: Giovanni and his staff are amazing.  The minestrone and pasta is perfect every time.  If you like authentic italian cuisine this is it.  I have also had the chicken Caesar and polenta and can't wait to try the veal piccata.
author: George M.

description: Enjoyed a lovely evening of antipasti and mixed drinks on the sidewalk seating. Best part was the chef serenading us and those passing by with his beautiful voice. Go and enjoy yourself.
author: ryan e.

description: My husband and I came here by recommendation. We ordered the calamari and the chicken parmigiana. The sauces on both were phenomenal. We loved the food but the service was just okay.
author: Erin M.

description:
Finally I found a place in North Beach I love.  I have been to quite a few over the years and found them all to be, well, kind of - fine.  But I loved Trattoria Pinocchio!

It was a slow day in North Beach with gorgeous, un-San Francisco-like weather in the upper 70s.  I had some out of town guests here and I was showing them the San Francisco staples.  I had been at places across the street both ways and thought they were fine, but wasn't dying to do back, figured we'd give this place a whirl.

SO glad we did!  We had been all over the Bay for a few days ordering way too much food so we decided to order a sandwich and Gnocci and split them both 3 ways.  Plus some bellinis.  The bellinis were a hit...just what we needed at noon on a Thursday!

The waiter was a kind italian gentleman who was just attentive enough and seemed happy to be at work for the day.

Then came the gnocchi....My true test of great italian is Gnocci and red sauce.  Oh my goodness...the gnocchi melts in your mouth.  They are big and fluffily and freaking-amazing.  We had them with gorgonzola.  We didn't have the red sauce so I can't tell you about that.  We also had the proscuitto and mozzarella a sandwich which was also delish!

I am so glad I don't have to keep looking for a great italian place in North Beach...this will be my staple for a while (but I do need to go back to Mona Lisa, which I tried a long time ago - which lead to my torrid love-affair with pumpkin ravioli - yum).
author: Stacey C.

description:
Everything about Trattoria Pinocchio is mediocre which would be fine since they usually have a table available even on a Saturday or Sunday night but the prices are way to high.

I had a calzone and it was like a calzone you can get anywhere for $6 or $7, just a pocket of dough stuffed full of cheese with a little tomato sauce except it was $16. My wife liked her Pasta Bolognese but it was also over priced.

Like others have said way overpriced for the quality of food, but if you are starving and every other italian place around has an hour wait then give it a shot.
author: Jeff S.

description: The food is ok...no WOW..factor..services is ok but the reception lady is very exceptional....she very attentive and friendly....
author: Angkana P.

description: My first choice off any Italian menu is the veal lasagna and they nailed it. They also offer a vegetarian lasagna. CS was excellent and environment reminded me of Italy. Large groups around us having a blast. Probably making a second trip to experience something else off their menu. My wife really enjoyed the carbonara.
author: Warren S.

description: this place is lovely but im not a fan of italian food. supposed to be like authentic from italy. very busy place. the waiter was super nice and cute called us a taxi and gave free lemoncello which was gross. the thing that bothered me was it took the guy like 20 minutes to bring us water. i got the lobster bisque which was good but didnt taste like lobster. got the pizza napolonata or whatever its called. picked up a slice and everything fell off so it was just the bread. lol ok. this is a lovely place but i dont think ill be back. i uust went cuz i didnt have to pay. seems everything closes early except bars haha
author: Maryse JR G.

description: I Highly Recommend Trattoria Pinocchio Restaurant !!! The Food is Fabulous !!! Cibo buonissimo !!!! That's Italian !!! San Francisco !!!
author: Daniel L.

description:
I've been here twice- tonight was the second time. The first time, we were not impressed with the service, but the food was good so we wanted to give it a second chance. 

The head waiter, or whoever he is, is horrific. After we were seated both times, we had our order taken only to have him disappear. 

The portions are small for the high price. Like I said, the food IS good, but not good enough to put up with the cruddy service. 

We waited and when our appetizers came, there was only soup for one of us. We told the busboy or whoever it was and the waiter came over and kind of said sorry, kind of didn't. The soup arrived long after I'd finished mine. 

Bottom line, the service here is truly horrific. No feeling of attention or value for your money. Stay away.
author: Ashley P.

description:
We were strolling through North Beach and came across Trattoria Pinocchio.  A charming gentleman coaxed us in by serenading us.  We were tired of walking and ready to eat so that is all it took..haha.  

Charming little area on the corner.  

The tables are very close so you can hear everything that is going on.  

I had the Cioppino.  It was delicious.  Full all the luscious clams, mussels, calamari, prawns and fresh fish.  The definately did not skimp on the seafood.  

I also had the Caipirinha -Cachaca, fresh lime, brown sugar.  Yummy and refreshing!!
author: Amy B.

description: This restaurant get 3 stars for the food, the food is really good, the server (Mariano) gave us the worst server ever, is no get in any attention to the tables, with a bad manners  and a arrogant attitude. The runners have better attitude that the servers.
author: Yuliam R.

description:
Having been to enough places that claim to be Italian, it's very refreshing to find one that really is.  I met the owner and he is definitely the real thing.  It shows in the food, not only was it authentic, but it was clear that the owner's passion definitely comes out in the food, authentic and delicious. The pasta was flavored just the way I like it, delicious and fresh, but not so much sauce that it smothers the pasta.

I really liked having waiters who not only Italian, but also experienced.  Too many of the restaurants that I go have waiters who either just started last week or don't have the experience to deliver good service.  

The combination of delicious, fresh food and experienced waiters definitely won me over. I'm planning to return with friends very soon.
author: Tom M.

description:
This is an Italian restaurant in the heart of North Beach, I'm in love by this statement alone! Add the bar, I'm in Heaven. Add the singing Mafioso waiter and it equals a wonderful time. 

The service could be better but I wouldn't say they're rude. I would not tolerate that.

The food is very good here along with the drinks. I had a dessert that consisted of pears sauteed in come sort of alcohol with chocolate drizzled over the top. It was so yummy. I really wanted to try the gnocchi but they don't make it in appetizer size so I passed. I'll have to come back to try it - this will be the true test of how good it is. 

I've came here for date night and with the kids. It's fit for both. 

Sitting on the heated patio is my favorite. I feel like I've stepped out of reality and into a vacation in Europe. The only thing missing is someone playing Italian music on the accordion to go with the singing waiter - Cheers.
author: Chanelle N.

description: I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately greeted by the owner and had the best ravioli salsicci. Delicious.
author: Jason R.

description:
UNO  D I S A S T R O......I T A L I A N O......  FOOD QUALITY......... A W F U L

I live in North Beach and made  HUGE MISTAKE and went to NEW YEAR'S EVE
DINNER here on a recomendation.  It was festive with loads of ITALIANO colored 
balloons and nicely dressed diners.

For a flash the "Headwaiter: was all charm and then someone else got all the
Bouna Seraas.  The lovely Parisian hostess was delightful and our waiter was really very good.

WHAT WASN'T GOOD.

THE BELLINI was NOT MADE with PEACH PUREE
PAID TWO EXTRA DOLLARS for SHOT OF WELL GIN, DIDN'T GET EVEN A TASTE OF GIN  _ I DRANK BELLINI'S IN VENEZI and some here too that were great

CRAB RAVIOLI ~ TOUGH & UNDERCOOKED, 3 SCALLOPS, The Scallops couldn't have cost more than TWO DOLLARS, DITTO for THE CRAB ~ $29.00 ~ WOW OOOOOOW, 
The veggies were delicious
 
POACHED PEAR ~ UNDER RIPE, TOO MUCH WINE and WHIPPED TOPPING FROM A CAN with1950s  DESSICATED MARASCHINO CHERRIES, 

REALLY AWFUL SWEET BAGUETTE.  The Bread in North Beach used to be great S.F. Sour Dough and the used to serve it with REAL BUTTER before mediocre olive oil and cheap balsamic became de riguer.


WHAT WAS GOOD

OUR HONDURAN WAITER

THE TRI COLORE SALAD, very OVER PRICED

I did tell the waiter about the ravioli and he did nothing. !

I hadn't seen my friend since April so I didn't want to ruin the evening by complaining.  She must have been starving as she almost licked the plate clean.

I know I should have been more assertive but I wanted to enjoy my friend's
presence rather than complaining.

REALLY, the friend who highly touted this farce should be quartered and hung to age.

I wish thatwe had gone to Firenze by night but it didn't look festuve.......
MY FAULT
author: ELINOR H.

description:
This is a darling little restaurant!  My boyfriend and I went here for dinner a couple months ago, and the food was authentic and very delicious! I found the portion sizes to be perfect. The atmosphere was very intimate, and inviting. The staff was all very personal and nice, and they were actually Italian! We even got seranaded by the chef, who was happily singing along to the opera music as he cooked! 

Coming in from his break, the chef stopped and gave us a lesson on twirling pasta! Very authentic, and cute restaurant all the way around! It may seem like the prices are a little steep, but don't let that turn you away! The food is worth the price. I will definitely go back here.
author: Monet W.

description:
It is nice to see a favorite restaurant continue to perform year after year. I first visited Trattoria Pinocchio in 2008 and for the next couple of years, ate here 4 or 5 times a year. It was my go-to-place when visiting San Francisco on business for classic Italian food. It never disappointed with traditional pastas and veals. 

While there was plenty of tables, one reason I liked it is that I was often traveling alone and the bar was a convenient place to have a great meal while watching TV.

I returned last week and it everything was still excellent. The bruschetta was amazing. My gnocchi in a gogonzola sause  (Enzo's Gnocchi) was first-rate. The proscioutto in melon was just OK (melon was under-ripe). 

But the service was impeccable and considering the part of town, the price is reasonable. I'm certain I'll return on my next visit to SF.
author: Gus V.

description: Giving this place 5 super stars because the Waiter has a funny sense of humor :). Really enjoyed Pinocchio. Their pasta is always fresh! I get my usual pasta calamari and salad. This place is always busy. Good service. Good Food.
author: Elle T.

description: Had an amazing dinner here while with my fiance on a quick trip to SFO.  Spent a good amount of time speaking with the owner and taking in their suggestions.  Great food, great service, great setting and good wine!!  Had a great time!!
author: Nick M.

description:
My boyfriend and his family and I came here to celebrate a big birthday dinner for his Grandfather. This is my second time eating at Pinocchio's and I have to say, it is absolutely incredible! If you like lamb you HAVE to try the rack of lamb. By far the best I have ever had! The place is so cute with pictures of famous Italian posters and decorations. But  even better are the wonderful staff there! Everyone is wonderful and the workers are ACTUALLY Italian and they speak it as well! (Which can be hard to find Italian-speaking people in North Beach believe it or not!) We had a blast eating and enjoying delicious wine and wonderful company at that restaurant!! One of my favorites now!
Try it out they are wonderful!
God bless, thanks for reading!
Sam
author: samantha L.

description:
My friend picked this restaurant to salvage her craving for pasta. I found the restaurant in a Where SF guidebook. I was a bit skeptic about the authenticity of their food. 

After trying the daily housemade Fettucine Salmone and Lobster and crab ravioli, my friend and I think that it is awesome. To add a notch to the pasta dishes, ask the handsome waiter for a few drops of black truffle oil on the pasta. It makes all the differences. Buon Appetito!
author: Ann K.

description:
Ok, to be fair I ate here about 3 months ago and don't recall which entree I had.  All I remember was that it was the best Italian food I've ever eaten, period!  We had been wandering around Chinatown, but didn't want Chinese food, so we started looking at menus and this spot looked the best.

We started with the bruschetta, which was nothing short of amazing!  It's so simple, but yet so complex.  The rest of the meal was equally amazing.  The bread was great.  All three entrees were amazing.

In looking at other reviews, people don't seem to like the servers; are they serious? They are joking around.  Don't you get it?  Do you like stuffy, boring people?  These folks aren't egotistical, they are just fun.  

The only Italian place that comes close to this in quality/value is Bizzarro Italian Cafe in Seattle.

Parking was remote, but that's SF.  

We're going back in few weeks and I can't wait!
author: Dave S.

description:
BEST tiramisu I've had since I came back from Italy. It's homemade and simply heavenly.

My friend and I shared the magherita pizza, which was pretty decent- the crust was more like American pizzas, but aside from that, it fared pretty well with the original magherita pizza. 

Also had the minestrone soup, which was pretty delicious.

The restaurant itself is adorable- had a very authentic and cozy feel to it! The waiters were extremely friendly and the owner runs around the restaurant singing (in Italian, and he's pretty good!) to both the guests and his employees.

Definitely one of the better restaurants in North Beach!
author: Angel T.

description: So yummy. Everything we have had here is great! Also, great service and great martinis! Highly recommended.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: We arrived in Little Italy with no specific plan for dinner and were lured into the restaurant by a very convincing hostess who told us we were going to love it.  She was right!  We started with the heirloom tomato and buratta salad which was excellent, tomatoes were so sweet and juicy.  Then we each had the homemade pasta dishes, mine was the spinach and ricotta ravioli, my husband had the ciopppino and a sid order of pasta bolonese, both delicious and my daughter had the gnocchi Enzo, which was light and fluffy, but he sauce was a little too rich, she was wishing she had chosen a lighter tomato based sauce.  We also had a wonderful bottle of wine which ended too soon so our singing waiter went into the bar and poured us all another glass on the house!  It was great!  We finished it all with a lovely chocolate mousse desert and a round of limoncello, again poured by the generous singing waiter!  We felt like we were in Italy!  Highly recommend for food, ambiance and great service.  Be sure to sit outside if the weather is warm enough.
author: Carol F.

description:
My sister and I went to this restaurant by a fluke. We had initially planned to go to a pizza restaurant a few blocks away in North beach but everywhere had a wait. We passed by this restaurant and even though it was emptier than the other restaurants we decided to give it a shot. We were greeted by a very nice waitress; who took our orders quickly . My sister had the lasagna and i had the gnocchi. I never ordered Gnocchi because i find it so hard to master it but let me tell you it was by far the best ones i have ever had! No joke; I licked my plate!
We even met the other waiters who sometimes came outside to talk to us (we were seated  outside) and he was hilarious- cracking jokes non stop)
Definitely give this place a shot! amazing experience, delicious food, great staff and service and of course a good location :)

I cant wait to go back on my next visit to San Fran :)
author: Vicki G.

description: My family on vacation to San Francisco had all six if us seated almost immediately. We all ordered something different and it was all amazing. The service was very good and the atmosphere made us all want to visit Italy.
author: Phillip F.

description:
The food was pretty average or bellow average considering the price. What killed it was the waiter chasing us across the street to get more tip. Now, I was not taking care of the bill so I do not know how much was left for him, what I do know is that his service was just like the food, nothing to write home about, and the bill was close to 2 bills for four people. He ran out and stopped us in the middle of the intersection, as we were crossing the street, with **** load of attitude, telling us how he was insulted with how much money was left for him. The people I was with were not local and he went off with his BS about how it is the law in California to tip 15%... GTFO! We threw another $10 to this Italian-wannabe monkey and then steamed about it for the rest of the day.

I guess that is what you get for eating out in neighborhood that caters to tourists.
author: ilya m.

description:
Food = amazing!

My mom and I were roaming through Little Italy and could not decide what place to eat.  I was going to skip this place and go for another but somehow we ended up eating here.

I loved the garlic in all the food we ordered - very tasty to say the least. Yummy bruschetta too. My mom usually doesn't like Italian and she even liked this place.

It was a bit pricey, but really enjoyed the food (we went for lunch so it was a very relaxed meal) and everyone was friendly.
author: Natasha D.

description:
I gave Trattoria Pinocchio only one star because I don't think I could give them less than that!!Well, I went there with a couple of friends because it was a nice night and we didn't feel like cooking at home.

We went to Trattoria Pinocchio and we were seated quite fast. Our waiter did everything correct at first, by taking my order first and so on....

We had ordered the Calamari Fritti (light deep fried calamari with a side of spicy marinara sauce) it was ok, just like fried calamari, nothing special about it.Linguine al Pesto Giovanni(Chef's housemade basil, pine nuts, parmigiano & garlic sauce)I liked it because I just got braces and the noodles were soft enough for me to eat.Linguine del Pescatore(mussels, clams, calamari, prawns & fresh fish in garlic tomato sauce)I was told that the center of the mussels were cold and the clams were gritty and still had sand in them.Vanilla Creme Brule(Our classic vanilla custard w/caramelized sugar crust)I can't comment on that because I didn't order that.

For me,I ate less than half of my meal because the noodles kept getting stuck in my braces. So I decided to take the remaining of my food to go. When the waiter came, I had told him that I wanted my food to go and he said ok and started to clean the table. When the waiter attempted to gather all of the dishes, he dropped a fork and it almost landed on my friend!! When I noticed that he had put two used  plates on my food,I reminded him that I wanted my food to go. The waiter  looked at me and said "oh shit" and continued to clean. When he came back, he said "you don't want that food still? Right?" I said no because you put dirty dishes in my food. Then he said that he could give me a dessert and I declined because I wanted the rest of my dinner. At that point I was shocked that he had the nerve to ask me if I wanted dessert instead asking me if he could remake my dinner. I could honestly say, he never asked me if I would like them to remake my dinner. Now I know it didn't cost that much to make my dinner, not because the ingredients are cheap but because they have cheap labors. 

When we received the bill, we noticed that he  didn't comp my meal or anything on the bill. As soon as we slipped a credit card with the bill, the waiter came right away to charge us. After he charged the credit card, he said that he overcharged us and had to void the first transaction. We didn't and couldn't understand why he kept talking to the manager and avoided eye contact with us for the remanding time we spent there, I would say it was awkward. Maybe they were  thinking, avoid the Asian people and they won't make a big deal about it!!!

Now that I wrote my review, its up to you if you still want to check this place out. If you do decide to try this place out, I hope your food and service is better than ours and double or triple check your bill. What I mean by that is make sure the amount on the bill is the same amount when you sign your receipt .As for me, it was my first time there and my very last time there!!
author: CB S.

description:
Sat outside for dinner, which was nice and the heated lamps made it very pleasant. We had to wait a bit for the bread to arrive, and the food came out pretty quickly after ordering. 

I can see why.  I ordered the Steak and Portabella, which was cooked perfectly and tasted great, but about half of it was wasted because it was so fatty I could not eat it.  The potatoes were home-style and the only thing italian about them was the overkill on the italian seasoning dumped on.  The vegetables were so overcooked, the brocolli was grey (not kidding).  The bok choy was grainy, which means it wasnt washed enough.  

When the waiter came to take my plate, I mentioned this to him, in which his response was "if you had told me earlier, I could have sent it back". Uh, helllloo, if you had not been so busy flirting with the girls at the table next to mine and checked in on our table,  I may have had a chance!  

Fortunatley, the birthday boy had a fabulous dinner, he had the risotto w/lobster.  Though the lobster was a little dry, the choice was a good one.
author: Rhonda W.

description:
I happened upon Trattoria Pinocchio not long after I moved to the bay area- some "friends" were in town and we were looking for a place to eat.  I still have no idea how we ended up here, but it's always been one of my favorites.

Although who my company has been has changed each time I've come here, there is one item I always get- the polenta with bolognese sauce.  If you don't know what polenta is, it's basically grits.  If you don't know what grits are, well, I don't know what to tell you.  Growing up in Nevada, I shouldn't really know what grits are, but somehow I do.  I found out about polenta from my italian stepfather (or mom's husband #2), and Pinocchio makes it better than most other places, I've found.

The rest of the menu is pretty extensive for italian food (being Irish, I'm not really the expert), and I always find a wine I like.  The entrees are always delicious, and the portions are good.  The creme brulee and tiramisu were divine.  The staff, all Italian, can sometimes be hard to understand, but it adds to the ambiance.

Although the economy is rough, this is a place I will consistently support because I have always had a wonderful time here.

Definitely recommend.
author: Pam S.

description:
This place is great. You have to try the Chicken al Limone - it's absolutely delicious. Not a huge fan of the raviolis, but the fresh bread totally makes up for it. Be sure to meet Michele; he's such a charming Italian man. He can guarantee you a great time and will provide you with top-notch service.

When you do come here, don't forget to make a visit to the bar. The bartender, Nick, is as talented as he is charming as he is smokin' hot. Try his lemon drop martini -- you'll love it!
author: Stacy G.

description:
My group of 5 scarfed down the calamari and bruschetta

Gnocchi was delicious!

Relatively empty on a Sunday afternoon. 

Overall, great!
author: Dana S.

description: I absolutely love their baby octopus dishes and always come back when I am in town. Love the service too!!!
author: Veronika L.

description: Great food.  TERRIBLE SERVICE. After literally 20 mins of waiting to order, I ordered the rib eye. It was great but the last time I saw the server is when he brought the steak. I had to ask someone else for my check.
author: Jesse N.

description: Love to eat here... Giovani, El Cantador is the best and Love to go when Antonino is there... try to make it out there at least 2 times a month
author: A D.

description:
I set out for ciopino and this place had it. 

Why does that warrant four stars? It doesn't. It was the wine, reasonable prices and great service that earned them. The ciopino was pretty good but the fish was a little salty and stood out a bit too much in the mix. 

Work on that and you get another star, Pinocchio. It is just one little flaw away from epic.
author: Robert P.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The place is cutely decorated with Pinocchios hanging from the lights over the bar area. The outdoor seating option was good, but we opted to sit inside since it was raining that day. 

Pasta dishes are pricey - $15 and over per plate, so i got a sandwich instead. I wanted to get the shrimp sandwich with lemon vinaigarette, but they were out that day. Boo. 

I got the grilled chicken sandwich with pesto mayo instead. It was good, but not great. It came with chicken, tomatoes, lettuce, and pesto mayo. The chicken was a thin piece and the pesto mayo was spread on sloppily - i didn't even get to taste the pesto mayo in every bite. :( I wish they made this sandwich a panini - it would have been better if the sandwich was warm. Also if they added cheese to it, it would have been less dry. 

The free bread is hella good here. Fresh out of the oven!!  Eat it with butter or EVOO and BV (balsamic vinegar).  I should change my nickname from "butter queen" to "bread monster." I think i'll do just that.  Oooh butter queen bread monster! Haha, that's too much...
author: Jennifer C.

description: We stopped in for an early dinner while walking around North Beach and we were not impressed, the food was below average and not worth the price. The chicken in the fettuccine alfredo was tough and dry and tasted like it had been frozen. The alfredo sauce was lacking, and the chicken parmesan portion was quite small. The restaurant had a nice environment but I would check out another restaurant in the area if you're looking to eat Italian food.
author: Joe G.

description: Very delicious and all their pasta is made in house. Ordered the veal ravioli in butter an sage sauce and it was fantastic. Menu was decent and wine was actually approachable in price. Prices of food were a bit high but it is very location oriented and I guess that happens when you are on the main strip of little Italy.
author: Johnny U.

description:
We happened upon this place just as we were coming out of Chinatown.  My family ran into the chef outside (who is also the owner) having an espresso.  After talking with him for a while we decided to head inside for some lunch.  (They had no problem accommodating a party of 8 without a reservation).

Each dish that was prepared for us was fantastic.  My favorite was the sausage ravioli. Freshly made pasta with an amazing cream sauce - YUM.  
I would absolutely go back to this place.  

The prices are high, but the food will not disappoint!
author: J T.

description:
The Penne Vodka is good and the pizza is as well - but the awful customer service and attitude from the manager has made us realize we will never return.  Who tells someone calling to pick up food - that their order won't go in until they arrive.

Sitting in the middle of North Beach give some restaurants the sense that they can act like jerks and still have enough business.
author: Ashish M.

description:
PLACE IS LOUD.......NOT a relaxing dinner.
Ravioli was Raw..........far from al dente.

i gave it Two Stars for the excellent Service service and wine List expensive
author: August S.

description: Food was great but the server " fausto" it's the worst .. We order a pizza and we got a pizza we didn't want and he decided to argue with us in the restaurant Infront of everyone .. It was unbelievable , ugh, what a dinner .. Anyhow the manager was kind inough to listen to our complain .. Food is good but service could be better..
author: Leidy G.

description:
We stopped in here for dinner with a large party and we were sat as soon as we walked in on a Friday night. The place was dimly lit and very intimate, though I was there with about 12 people it was the perfect setting.   I had the Chicken Parmigiana and some red wine.  The staff was great in dealing with our party and we did not have to wait long for service.

I do not usually like italian food, but this placet changed my mind, absolutely fantastic!

If you are in the bay area, this is a must for dinner!
author: Robert A.

description: Truly one of the best Italian meals I have ever eaten.  The service was outstanding and food was fresh and perfectly prepared.
author: Colin A.

description:
Visited Pinocchio's today on our walk through North Beach. 

My husband ordered the Giovanni brunch special. It was decent, but I think he was jealous because I ordered the Fettucine Pollo. According to the menu, the fettucine, gnocchi and lasagne are made fresh onsite daily, so of course I wanted to eat freshly made pasta. 

I thought I had died and gone to heaven. I even went so far as to wipe each drop of sauce from the bowl with my fingers (I'd previously eaten all of the awesome fresh bread they brought us). 

Our server, Michele, was a funny guy. Hands down the best waiter we've ever had. He was humourous and charming. We won't be forgetting him anytime soon. 

We plan to go back. There are so many dishes we'd like to try. I don't think you can go wrong with one of their freshly made pasta dishes. I mean, I stupidly paid $28 for non-fresh and boring pasta dish at a restaurant in Snoqualmie earlier this year. Pinocchio's doesn't charge nearly that much and it would be worth it, in my opinion. 

I look forward to our next visit, which hopefully will be Tuesday this week. :)
author: Jean L.

description:
Our server was great!  He was very funny, but I forgot his name. Oh well.  On to rating the food.

Dinner for two cost us about $80.  We each had a drink (non alcoholic), and for appetizer we started w/ Guazzetto di Mare (steam mussels & clams in garlic sauce).  I had their Tortellini alla Boscaiola (meat tortellini w/ peas, mushroom, & prosciutto in a cream sauce).  The hubby had their freshly made Fettuccine Con Pollo in an alfredo sauce.  We ended the meal w/ their Vanilla Creme Brûlée.

Pro:  All the dishes we ordered were very good.

Con:  The cream sauce & the alfredo sauce was kinda on the heavy side.  But since we were indulging, it really is not a con.  If you're watching your waistline, skip the cream sauce & go for a tomato or even an extra virgin olive oil sauce.
author: F. C.

description:
Went here with the family and hubby a while back and it was great! 2nd time went with the sibs for the Italian heritage parade and it was ok.  The gnocchi with bolognese sauce was delicious!  soft and fluffly - not doughy.  However, it didn't seem worth the price (but I guess that is understandable since every place was sold out and it had curbside seating right next to the parade).

The only drawback was that there was a set menu due to the parade and we didn't get to order from the full menu.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: The outside tables are fun for people-watching, the service was good, and my wife's dish (some pasta special with pink sauce) was tasty, but my $20 spaghetti carbonara was inexcusably awful. I ate a third of it and left the rest. We won't be going back -- really there's no excuse for making bad expensive pasta in North Beach. Too many other places to try instead.
author: Lawrence K.

description: We stopped in here around midday.  So it's possible we missed the rush. That said, I enjoyed this restaurant.   Initially, I feared that it was a "tourist trap" establishment because it was on the main drag, Columbus Ave, where the tourist are seen with maps in hand, searching to and fro.  However, I was pleased with the service and the food.
author: Paul J.

description:
Perfect place to sit outside in bustling North Beach and enjoy some pasta & wine. Our waiter was a cool, older Italian man that had that awesome Italian accent. So heavy, I could only understand about every 3rd word. He was great and made the meal more enjoyable. Aside from our perfect seating situation & service, the food was also delectable. 

Appetizer of Bruschetta. Hard to screw up yes, but this tasted so much fresher than most Bruschettas. 

Entree #1 ~ Butternut Squash Ravioli. One of my favorite pasta dishes and this didn't disappoint. The pasta was a little al dente which I'm a big fan of. 

Entree #2 ~ Orange & Black Ravioli stuffed with Lobster & Crab. My husband LOVED it. And it didn't hurt to have a dish that honored our world champion Giants!!

We had so many Italian food options in North Beach but we feel like we chose wisely. It was a nice end to our Giant's Victory Parade adventure in S.F.
author: Lori B.

description: I've been here twice. Great food both times. When we've been here, there have been lots of Italian guests and no tourists (except us!). Good family feel.
author: Jeff R.

description: This was a wonderful dining experience in North Beach.  Great decor, delicious food, superb service, and Italian music!  Our waiter, Michele, made the dining experience fun (the bartender was also great).When we go back to North Beach, this is the place we will go.  We used to go to Calzones - no longer!
author: Kathy M.

description: I was surprised to see some of the bad reviews as I had a very good experience here and it was after the North Beach Festival as well.  There were 5 of us and we did go later in the evening, but had very good service, were recommended a very good wine at a good price, had a very generous antipasti platter that was delicious and all had excellent pasta dishes.  I got a special - homemade parpadelle with a short rib ragu that was stellar! Everyone else enjoyed their pastas as well and we had a really nice dinner and experience. I would go back again - I think it's much better than other places I've been in North Beach.
author: Michelle M.

description: My girlfriends and I were roaming around Little Italy and we were randomly looking for a place to eat... that's when we stumbled across Trattoria. The restaurant was large and filled with people. I had the alfredo which was pretty tasty! Prices are reasonable
author: Connie M.

description: Came here on labor day Monday, not crowded. our waiter was friendly, food was serviced quick. I would think the portion was good, but I will still hungry after this.
author: Crystal R.

description:
We had a very sweet, very gay, Northern Italian waiter.  The best kind of waiter, in my view (... ok, except for Noel at Slanted Door)!

Today we came here for a working lunch; we ordered:

For appetizers, the boss ordered Calamari Fritti, Bruschetta, and Insalata Caprese.  Our lunch entrees were Penne Arrabbiata, Lasagna Francesco, Linguine Calamari, Linguine al Pesto (now that looked very good - I'll be trying that next time!), Scampi Saut (which I had - Yu-UMMY!!!!!), and Chicken Parmigiana.

The prices range from $12 for pasta dishes all the way up to $22 for a filet mignon.

I don't have a big problem with these prices, but I almost took one star off for the tactless little blip at the bottom of the menu "Minimum 1 order per person".  Does this mean I can't bring my sweetie in here and share an appetizer?  We both have to order one in order to be allowed to eat here?

Now, that, my fellow yelpers, is simply poor form.

I love our working lunches; we always wind up talking about the weirdest things (strip clubs, ex's, weird 3rd world countries ... random stuff)!
author: Michael O.

description:
Came here on a week night. Service was slow and sporadic. The bread was good, the water glasses were full (the bus boy was great) and my meal was better than mediocre but not over-the-top.

Portions were good sized and the prices were right. I had the chicken al limone with pasta instead of potato. The chicken itself was wonderful, in a velvety, lemony sauce. I was afraid it was going to be a thin sauce (something I could make at home with EVOO and lemons and garlic) but it much better. Not too creamy, but not very oil-based either. The pasta was good, too. Spaghetti with red sauce. But, my only qualm was that it was served on the same plate! My red sauce was getting all mixed in with my lemon sauce and it was just weird. I would have preferred to have it in a small bowl on the side. Thought that my chicken was going to come with some veggies, too, but I guess that's not an option when you swap out the potato. 

Everyone else in my party liked their raviolis and other pastas, but no one was raving. Much better than some of the other touristy places and pretty cute, but nothing to write home about.

Would go back, though. Lasagna looks delicious...
author: christine c.

description:
Catch of the day.

When the server came to take my order, I told him how happy I was about the grilled fish I had six months ago, so just give me another surprise.  

I was a little bit disappointed when he brought me the rock cod, - even though it looked good -  I had never liked rock cod. It is bland, tasteless. 

But hey, -  it was one of the most delicious white fish meat I ever had. The chef did it amazingly tasty. 
Not only I  enjoyed the texture of the fish, the mix sauteed in olives, capers, chopped tomatoes with other ingredients was a perfect match over it - not even to mention the combination of the colors and garnishes on the side. 
It was $23.00 for a big complete meal. 

My son had veal, my daughter-in-law had raviolis, and my husband had his favorite sea food pasta. They left their plates squeaky clean. 
The total bill was about $150.00, my son said it was very reasonable.
No wonder they dine here almost once a week.    

This is still our family's favorite place in SF.
author: Marial L.

description: This place is fantastic on a warm SF day.  I ordered the linguine vongole, and it was delicious.  You can tell they make their pasta fresh daily, and I also sampled my boyfriend's gnocchi, which was delicious!  A nice spot in North Beach.
author: Mel G.

description:
best meal on our vacation!
The risotto with salmon was life-changing and my man's filet was to die for!  Excellent atmosphere, flawless service - "Tony Bennett" was the perfect server and very attentive.  This was the best meal!  Highly recommend!
author: Melinda B.

description:
By far-- best pasta in North Beach. 

I'll admit, it was the name "Pinocchio" that caught my attention while looking for new place to try... but it's the excellent flavors & vegetarian options that keep me coming back. Customer service is also very welcoming.

My personal recommendation: 
(veg) Ravioli pomodoro & try a glass of the Champagne "Belini" Delicious!
author: Julie L.

description: I ordered the crab/lobster raviolis and good thing my date paid for it since it's expensive. My date at the time wanted to sit outside that Friday night so he can get his favorite waiter who's a real Italiano. I was full and didn't need dessert.
author: Anni Y.

description: The food, service, and wine were great. I went with two other friends on a Sunday. The food came out fast!
author: Jesse S.

description:
While visiting San Francisco we were looking for a place exactly like this and the menu on the website looked good. The webiste said that the kitchen closed at 10:15 PM, but just to make sure we called that day and the voice mail message confirmed that. When we arrived at 9:30 PM, we were told rather rudely that they were closed since there were no customers there. When we pointed out that we called THAT SAME DAY to verify when the kitchen closed, the employee (or owner?) continued his rudeness and poor attitude with not even a hint of an apology.

So we are unable to comment on the food or the ambiance, only the rudeness. No wonder there were no customers there. Bad treatment equals no customers. Hope this place gets the message.
author: R A.

description:
Our family of 5 trekked up and down every street in North Beach last week, consulting yelp on the iphone and trying to decide upon the right Italian restaurant. After passing Pinocchio several times I remembered it as the place my cousin and I ate at 5 years ago. I recalled that the food was delicious, but we did share a bottle of wine...

My fears were unfounded. We were all very happy with our food. Excellent service, the butternut squash soup with parmesan croutons was drool-worthy, the appetizer special of soft mozzarella with proscuitto and tomatoes was scrumptious, kids loved the pizza, man loved the veal, pescatarian was crazy about the scampi saute. Oh, Italian beers on tap too.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I like this place because it had outdoor seating. The service here was okay, but one of the waiter was pretty funny. I ended up ordering the Linguine del Pescatore, it came with mussels, clams, calamari, prawns & fresh fish in garlic tomato sauce. The dish was very light and had a great flavor to it. The noodles was made aI dente, which I like. I thought the dish was a little bit bland, but if you add some parmesan cheese and pepper flakes it makes it a little better (dish was $23).

The Bruschetta was really good here, great flavor.
author: Nhung T.

description: My friends and I walked from our hotel in Union Square to carbo-load before the Nike Marathon last weekend to Trattoria Pinocchio- highly recommended by friends so I was anxious to try it. We headed to the bar for a quick drink because we were early for our reservation. The bar was adorned with fun Pinocchio statuettes. The bartender was attentive and made delicious cocktails. For our meal we chose to sit outside which was refreshing and stimulating with everyone out and about on a Saturday night in North Beach. The waiter Francisco was friendly and answered all our questions. The entrees were all delicious and we shared family style so I got to try all four- gnocchi, vegetarian lasagna, and two types of ravioli. Needless to say we were very satisfied and ready to tackle the hills the next day.
author: Ara A.

description:
One star pretty much says it all. 

Service:

Waiter was rude, arrogant and not funny at all. 
We had to ask for refills on our ice tea & sprite. When we asked they told us "we don't do refills" & walked away.  Approx. 5 minutes later they changed their mind & brought us our refills.  

Food:
Bread cold and no flavor, and the salad was bland.
And for the main meal we definitely had better.  The ravioli was at best OK, but had a frozen dinner taste too it.  

Way to pricey for bland frozen food and lousy service.

No wonder is called Pinocchio they lie of how good it is!


We are NOT going back!!!!!!!
author: Sam R.

description:
I had a half day at work and decided to pop over to the North Beach for lunch.  As we were strolling along Columbus the hostess showed us the menu and told us that they were known for their homemade pastas and that if it was too filling that they served a  lighter lunch option as well. 

-Carpaccio: prime beef tenderloin, arugula, shaved parmigiano, capers, truffle oil & grilled bread $13
-(*)Butternut Squash Ravioli roughly $18-$20
