-Prosciutto & Mozzarella Panini $9.95
-2 Mimosas

(*)=Favorite
author: Stacey L.

description: walking around the neighborhood looking for a italian restaurant that had eggplant parmesian (surprisingly not many places have that)  we stopped at a few and i didn't get a good vibe..but when we finally decided on Pinocchios we were not disappointed..service/atmosphere and food was on point..I love eggplant parmesian and this was the best I've ever tasted ..and the best part was i was able to get a free parking right in front on a Saturday night..oh the chicken parmesian was amazing also.I can myself flying to S.F for one night just to have dinner there..love love love!!!
author: sweden a.

description: We have been customers for over 20 years, since moving to San Francisco. Today the blonde woman manager treated us so poorly can we will never return. It was the North Beach Festival. We weren't sure if they would be serving our favorite sandwiches so we called ahead and asked. A woman with an Italian accent answered said yes, absolutely. When we got there, we were told they changed their minds and would not be serving the sandwich; it was too busy and too much trouble for them. Over the years, we were often one of 3 or 4 occupied tables and would receive good service.  But if there are many people, regulars are cast aside because it's too much work and trouble. Obviously their complete disregard for keeping their word and customer service supersede regular customers who come even when business is slow.
author: Presto G.

description: Quaint, cute and quiet corner spot in Little Italy on Columbus Street. This place offers indoor and outdoor seating but no matter which option you pick, the people watching is spectacular.  I stopped in for a light lunch (yes, a light lunch exists in the realm of Italian eating!) and was pleasantly surprised by their well-stocked yet well organized menu.  Plenty of pasta and pizza options as well as traditional soups and salads Well priced for the size of the portion as well.  I opted for the Panini lunch special which consisted of a beautiful mozzarella and prosciutto combination and a nice light salad.  I was so happy not to see french fries as the side being offered!  Portion was just right and the flavors were excellent together.  Attentive and prompt service pulled this package together making for a very enjoyable lunch in the city.  I would love to return for dinner at some point and really sink my teeth into some of their pasta dishes as they had my mouth watering just on reading the descriptions.  The only reason I knocked off the one star is because my plate was taken away with a large piece of my Panini left on it.  They asked if I was finished and after answering "not quite" it was still taken away.  Perhaps the gentleman did not hear/understand me.  Certainly not a big deal, but that last bite...
author: Jen J.

description: Best penne pomodoro in a long time! Fresh, simple ingredients. I haven't tried anything else, though, so my review is just based on that dish.
author: Katie-Rose N.

description: This place was our "Plan B".  Needless to say I was disappointed that I didn't have a list of places at my ready and had to stop in here for a quick bite before we left the city to head home.  Trattoria Pinocchio was great!  I had the carbonara and was thrilled.  My friend had the gnocchi and I can honestly say that I have NEVER had gnocchi that tender and airy before.  Staff was great and the price was reasonable, I will be going back again for sure.  Keep up the good work, but really, can't you guys tell me how you made that gnocchi?!?!?!
author: Elaine P.

description:
My girlfriend and I were walking around the city today and decided to explore the charming North Beach area and scour for some good Italian food.  Among the endless options among the authentic Italian feel of the neighborhood, we stumbled upon Trattoria Pinocchio.

The outdoor seating which allows you to sit next to your girlfriend without the social stigma of being "same side sitters" was a nice touch.  The pasta was homemade and the bread was outstanding.  I got the gorganzola gnocchi and my girlfriend ordered the linguini fruitte de mare.  The flavor was explosive and the portion size was solid.  I dropped a star because the prices were high (about $18-$25 per entree) for what you are getting.  I dropped the second star because the service lacked some warmth.  There was a really good server also overseeing some tables which I had hoped we had, because ours was disengaged and seemed like he was having a rough day.  Normally this wouldn't be such a big deal, but at a romantic outdoor Italian bistro I've come to expect the service and ambiance to count just as much as the quality of the food.

Overall a pretty memorable part of our day, but Trattoria Pinocchio won't likely be on our short list of ongoing dinner spots.
author: Joseph Z.

description:
I was a little disappointed with this place and it all stemmed from the service. 

The location was great. We were offered outdoor seating which provided us with great people watching. There were heat lamps to keep us warm on a chilly night. 

The server was borderline rude when we asked for wine suggestions. He said "it depends what you like. a wine is a wine and you might like it or not." Seriously? No recommendations for your extensive wine list? Dude: you didn't even take the time to ask for our preference to give a proper recommendation. 

When we ordered our selection and asked for it to be decanted, instead of saying yes, he spouted that there is a fee for it and questioned our request. We had ordered a $50 wine.  Dude: You could have played that a little better. I think the cost was around $2. You could have said, "just so you're aware, we charge a minimal fee". It was a little embarassing to question us over it. 

When he brought the decanted wine over to our table, it splashed onto my guest's shirt!  Dude: you could have at LEAST comp'd the $2 fee for that stain. 

Fortunately, the owner (or so the hostess told us) came by our table to say hello. I think he may have recognized my guest. He was very personable and made a good impression on us. I don't know if this had anything to do with the poor service we had received prior to meeting him. However, he wasn't there to apologize or anything so I'm not sure. 

Onto the food: 
The complimentary bread wasn't anything special. I guess I'm spoiled by the amazing bakeries in San Francisco because I found the bread basket to be dull and a little stale. 

The Antipasti platter was fantastic with a variety of delicious cured meats, cheeses, olives, and carby treats. 

When I decided to go out for Italian food in North Beach, I was on a mission to have Linguine with clams. The Linguine con Vongole e Cozze hit the spot! I ordered mine with all clams and they  happily accommodated my request. 

For dessert, we split the tiramisu and it was one of the best I've ever had. 

Overall assessment: The service we received really spoiled what could have been a great meal. I feel that it's generous to give three stars but the food was really good.
author: Colleen W.

description: Horrible service. Crowded. Food just ok.
author: Emily H.

description:
My favorite part about this place is the staff. From the moment we approached the front door of the restaurant, several employees welcomed us in with friendly smiles.

My three girl friends and I had dinner here tonight after watching Beach Blanket Babylon. We presented a coupon from the show's program that offered a free salad with every entree. Apparently, people don't do this very often because our waiter had to go double check with the manager. They were very nice about it though and gave all four of us a nice salad.

The bread was cold and a little dry, but the staff was very nice about refilling our bread basket. I ordered a plate of gniocchi, which was delicious. I only wish the portions were bigger.

After dinner, my friends surprised me by having the waiter bring a happy birthday lemon sorbet with a candle in it. Everyone sang happy birthday, even other patrons.

I would definitely recommend this place for its good food, welcoming atmosphere and awesome service.
author: Teresa G.

description:
Forgot that I was at this place!

I liked it and the food was great...It was a laid back atmosphere, and this is a great place to visit after walking the streets of SF....I would recommend.
author: Ariana C.

description: Updating -- we've been going here and loving it for 6+ years. It's as good as ever. Nice bar, good drinks and a lively place. Locals eat here and so do a lot of tourists, so it's a good place for people watching, too. Osso Bucco is tasty; same with the Eggplant Pamiagiana. And, easy parking a block away on Vallejo Street.
author: Kanani P.

description: The gnocchi was disappointing and overpriced, like eating pillows of boiled mush. Olive appetizer was similarly overpriced, consisting more of lettuce than olives. The bruschetta was actually tasty. Our service was adequate. We were attracted by the quiet ambiance of the place after a long busy day, but unfortunately even that didn't pan out thanks to the obnoxious singing maitre d. All in all, a waste of money.
author: E S.

description: Right in the heart of North Beach.  Prices are reasonable, food is very good but not great.  Pasta is homemade and tastes it.  I had the spinach ravioli, which was fresh and the sauce very tasty.  Casear salad was very good.  My son had tortellini which were excellent.  My daughter and wife shared a cheese pizza which I sampled and was very good as well. All in all I would recommend.
author: John M.

description: Great food and atmosphere! My husband and I stayed in Fishermans Wharf, which is walking distance from this place. We went for lunch.  I had the pesto pasta and my husband had the Italian sausage panini. The panini was huge! The pasta is what I consider normal size for lunch portion, and delicious! The restaurant is located on a corner with great views of the neighborhood.  Would definitely go there again.
author: C M.

description: food was good (spaghetti alla bolognese) but the service was great.  very attentive and friendly.  it wasnt very busy for lunchtime, so i hope they have a busy dinner service.  ill be back when next in town.
author: Benny F.

description: I was walking through streets on my last day before heading back to Detroit and all of the sudden this beautiful lady approaches me and in broken English and a bit of Italian she asked me to look at the lunch specials, which really are a good deal. 12.95 for a pasta dish and salad. The pasta is hand made and there were plenty of outdoor tables for me to sit, eat, and watch people. I was quickly greeted by a server and got a glass of wine and Pellegrino. I sat for a while and finally ordered the Puttanesca. The pasta was cooked perfect and the dish overall was as salty as it should be. I couldn't finish it because it was a decent amount of food. I ordered a coffee after and just enjoyed the day.
author: Chris M.

description: Went here for the 2nd time tonight - first time was 2years ago! As I was back In the city, we thought we would try it again. Had veal lasagne and it was fabulous. Much better than I ever thought it would be. Service was great - went a little early so the restaurant was quiet but still very polite & attentive. Not badly priced for this area & happy hour was still open so had a glass of the merlot which wasn't bad at all. Definitely worth a try!
author: Madison S.

description:
Best restaurant in North Beach. I don't even bother with the other ones anymore. Who cares about variety when the food here is so amazing and reasonably priced? 
The chicken parm here is better than anywhere else, hands down. I've been here with a vegetarian and she loved the food too, so there's no issue with non meat eaters.
author: Laura S.

description: 4 stars just for their seafood pasta. The service was weird but it could be that I was annoying and tipsy that night. The seafood pasta, bread and wine were excellent though. I hav ethought about it for weeks now. Must go back.
author: E K.

description:
First time visit to this restaurant.  Everything was OK but nothing was great.
Service was the best part - relatively timely and friendly and the food was just OK. Not bad by any means, and I would not hesitate to go here again, it is just not the kind of WOW experience you'd like to have.
author: Pete J.

description: The food sucked! Almost broke my tooth when I bit in to a pile of crushed clams in my dish. I will not be coming back! The whole restaurant is very corny.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
Recomended by a local foodie friend.  Glad we took her up on it!  So many restaurants in North Beach to choose from - can be overwhelming.

Prices - average for North Beach: Pastas start at 15ish, meats, 20 ish..caprese, 8.

Caprese - good. Not spectacular, but very good.

My pasta - lasagna bolognese - very good.  Not too chesey, more meat/pasta, nice finish of mozzarella. Filling!

Steve's pasta - YUMMM! Gnocchi - melt in your mouth buttery, gnocchi with bolognese.  I'm ordering that next time.

Good service, fun singing Maitre D', friendly waiter and hostess.

Next time, it's outside seating to soak up the people watching, cuz yes, there WILL be a next time:-)
author: Heidi M.

description: Staff was friendly. Food was bland. Even the dessert wasn't authentic. As soon as the hostess said the pasta was made fresh I was ready to try out this place. The chicken parmigiana tasted too fried. You could taste the oil which isn't what should be tasted, it should be the food. I had to add Parmesan cheese to give the food flavor. Tried out my friends food too and wasn't great either. Margherita pizza was bland as well and the soup. I had high hopes for this place especially in little Italy. Oh well I guess better luck next time.
author: Foodie S.

description:
Trattoria Pinocchio

We were greeted by the hostess and opted for outside seating which was comfortable and had a feeling of warmth.   The atmosphere was charming along with the music and we felt as if we were back in Italy.   Our waiter was the "Silver Fox" and he was not only personable, but his service was outstanding, along with the other wait staff.  He recommended a few of our dishes and was spot on.  We enjoyed Bruschetta, Insalata Cesare, Fettucine con Pollo, Ravioli di Vitello, Dungeness Crab w/pasta,   
The Owner is delightful.  He walks around singing and welcomes everyone as if they were at his home for dinner. 

Try Trattoria Pinocchio and you will not be disappointed!
author: Mary lynn R.

description:
Quality food and service but a little more pricey than it's worth.  Still, it was all delicious and convenient right on Columbus

They use Everclear in their cooking.  ; )
author: Jon M.

description:
I travel to San Francisco a couple of times a year and this restaurants was one of the places I make sure I hit.  I will not be going back.

Poor service, small portion size for a plate of pasta, overpriced, and what convinced me I am done with this place is they charge $3.50 for a glass of tea and no refills.
author: Cliff M.

description:
Yummy food, went here last summer. Large portions, enough for a paisano. Good prices. Nice servers.
If i could just find a restaurant that serves the food of Corsica, with their interesting take on seafoods like Scorpion fish, mullet, goatfish, and sea urchin.   Their special cheese that is eaten with its live worms inside must be tried!!!  From the internet : " Corsica is in the Tyrrhenian Sea in the western Mediterranean, 160 kms south-west of the French Riviera and 82 kms west of the coast of Tuscany, on the same latitude as Rome. Put crudely, Corsica is in the armpit of  Italy. It lies 14 kms to the north of Sardinia."
author: Bert K.

description:
Bathrooms: Clean! 
Atmosphere: Happening! 
Service: Above average!
I would go back and recommend it to my friends and family!

Reservation for 4 at 8pm on a Saturday! Sat immediately! 

Food was exactly what I would expect from an Italian restaurant in North Beach.

We had Chicken Saltimboca, Linguini Pesto, Mushroom and Sausage Ravioli and Gnocchi in the white sauce. Appetizer was a Crab and Scallop Ravioli all very good served hot.

I would go back and recommend it to my friends and family!

Rick
author: Rick F.

description:
BEST GNOCCHI. we talkin bout cloth napkins, so bring your classy sexy energy to enjoy the North Beach bourgeois vibe. most recently went during a rainy weekday afternoon: warm prompt service, perfect portions, calm ambiance.
BEST GNOCCHI.
author: eden j.

description:
We were in the North Beach neighborhood on Saturday and were looking for a good brunch place to eat. Always wanted to try Mama's but it was over 1 1/2 hour wait so we just strolled through the North Beach area and wanted to try the brunch at Pinocchio. We had been there for dinner once, about 2-3 years ago but don't remember what we had but I must have liked it otherwise I would have make a note to myself to never come back :)  We originally planned to order brunch for us and the kids but after reading the reviews, I changed my order to pasta. I went for Linguine with calamari in a tomato based sauce. It was very good. The pasta was super fresh and cooked perfectly and the calamari as well. The kids had a taste of my dish too so we gobbled it all up within a few minutes. The hubby kept his brunch order and ordered an omelette with smoked salmon and blue cheese. That wasn't really great, just average. The kids had eggs with sausage patty and potatoes - typical breakfast item so nothing out of the ordinary. 

If you are gonna go to an italian restaurant, go for the pasta, don't settle for their brunch special, it might be less pricey than their pasta dishes (which is more pricey) but it will make you leave with wanting more. They have an extensive pasta menu so you are sure to find something of your liking in there. I did! I gave it 4 * because a little on the pricey side...and I am not taking into account their brunch "specials". 

Will attempt to recreate this dish at home so wish me luck!!
author: Xuan P.

description: I'll save the trouble of a long review today ...Good food, SLOW service. Porcini.rissotto good so was the affogoto ... they also make fresh pasta which is amazing! this is a vegetarian friendly place
author: Krystal P.

description: After reading many reviews of Italian restaurants we finally chose this one and I'm glad we did.... The gnocchi was amazing it melted in your mouth and the sauce for the lasagna was wonderful... Our waiter "the silver fox" helped make our experience remerable. Can't wait to come back
author: Audra P.

description: I ordered the gnocchi with the Gorgonzola and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!  My husband enjoyed the pizza - absolutely fantastic!!  The ambiance was so warm and inviting - I love this place!  The owner even sang to everyone (he's got a wonderful voice!).  Can't wait to go again!!
author: Bruno B.

description:
I went to Trattoria Pinocchio by pure accident: was passing by and decided to try italian  food. What a refreshing surprise it was! Smiling young lady at the entrance lead me in and asked  older waiter to help me. Within 10 minutes I had my appetizer and wine served and main course ordered. Sicilian dishes no doubt prepared in authentic manner and with a lot of care! Finally I found that special place that stands out of mediocracy.
Hands-off: best food in town!
author: Karl V.

description: Chicken Parmigiana wasn't very good at all. It was the thinnest piece of chicken I've ever had, there was no taste, it was dry, and the breading was soft. Did not taste fresh at all.
author: A A.

description:
I love the north beach area, and usually every place I've tried has had more positives than not. Until Saturday. 

My friend and I stumbled on to this place while walking down Columbus, and when the hostess told us there was a 10 minute wait for a table for 2,  we decided to give this place a try, and wait for a table.

And wait.

And wait. 

35 minutes later, when I finally went up to the hostess to remind her that we do exist, she was apologetic but unable to do anything - 5 more minutes, she said. 

Fine. 

So we wait. 

Another 13 minutes. 

Finally, we see her signalling the waitress for our table. The waitress then goes up to another couple who came 20 minutes after we did! Thankfully the hostess quickly went up to her and re-directed her to us. 

Once seated (another mis-hap there! We were about to be seated at one of the tables, when the owner, yells! "not that table!", and then makes us change our tables), the waiter was abrupt and sort of surly. We get our drinks quickly enough, but when we ask for water - we're given water in plastic cups!  A bit stunned, I stopped the hostess who was walking by and asked her if this is normal - and she had the grace to apologize but did not take any steps to rectify the situation. Apparently, when they have too many customers, they sometimes run out of glasses...okayie then...

Our food comes, and admittedly, my pasta carbonara was one of the best I've had (which is why they get the second star). My friend's meat ravioli in walnut cream sauce tasted bland, but a dash of salt and pepper and she decided to just let it be, so we could eat and get out of there. Big mistake. That night, she had a mild case of food poisoning. 

When it was time to leave, the waiter came by to give us our cheque, and was really gracious then (guess it's time for the tip? :)) 


Two stars: one for the bartender who was really friendly, was helpful and polite, and one for my entree. Both really fantastic. 

Cons:  the overall service really spoilt the evening for us. And of course, the fact that my friend got food poisoning that night is another reason I'll probably never go back.
author: Simika K.

description: Stopped by while walking around Chinatown to get something from the bar. Got 3 Irish Coffee's for me and my friends to start the day. They were pretty gentle, found out the asian female bartender was on her first day so that may have been the reason. Cool spot, nice interior.
author: Jeff K.

description:
OK, some places either offer you great food or great atmosphere. This place gives you both; delicious food and a neat place to seat. 

I have eaten here many times over the past 6 years, but simply cannot bring myself to order anything other then the best Gorgonzola gnocchi you can find! It is fantastic! The other perk is that the restaurant has outdoor seating right on the main street where you can do some serious people watching.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Did I eat at the same place as these other people? This place was an italian sin. The pasta was not fresh, loaded with sauce. I was totally confused what the chefs were doing. Making Italian food was not it. Service was fine, which is the only reason I bumped them to two stars.
author: Djjr R.

description: Great food and service! Came in for lunch. Sat in the sun outside, ate a bunch of tasty snacks. The waiter Antonio was friendly and helpful. The owner, Giovanni came by the table and made sure we were happy. Going back soon.
author: Brett M.

description:
I must admit, I was extremely  curious to try this place, after having noticed its advertisements all over the city ... The subliminal influence  finally worked out :-).   When I go to an Italian restaurant for the first time, I usually opt for housemade pasta, if available. Plenty of interesting options here. I chose the lasagna (very long time since I had a decent one) and it was definitely good (especially the pasta itself) even if the excessively heavy tomato sauce didn't fully strike me.  In fact, I had asked to have lasagna with spinach pasta, but the waiter did't fully understand me or I had been not clear enough ... For the rest, I was favorably impressed by the crunchy bread, the german white beer from the draft and by the creamy tiramisù that ended my meal.  

By looking at the good looking pasta dishes flowing around to the neighboring tables, I don't have the feeling I have tried the best they can offer, so I'll be back soon.

For the moment 4 stars is more than enough ...
author: Andrea L.

description: Awesome location close to all in San Francisco. Spent day at Alcatraz, and ate here on the walk home. Great staff and awesome food. Come here every time we come to San Francisco. Pesto pasta is to die for. Moretti's on draft are great as well.
author: T D.

description:
Your kidding me?
So I had to try it again for the second time, with friends who's visiting from D.C., thought it will be different this time.  What a joke!!!  
The food was bland from the first time I ate their, and this recent visit the other night.  
Don't get me wrong, I like the idea of outside seating at Pinocchio, and being at North Beach area, but honestly, Their food is not that great.  I've had better Italian dishes.
author: M S.

description: I LOVED the atmosphere at Pinocchio! The chef came out and was so friendly and hospitable. You really felt as though you were in Italy at a family bistro. The gnocchi and the portobello mushroom appetizer was particularly amazing and the veal parmesan was excellently handcrafted. The wine was fantastic and was perfectly pair with each course to bring out the flavor in each dish. I highly recommend checking out  Trattoria Pinocchio!
author: Hilary Z.

description: Great gnocchi, good location and nice staff.  Worth a visit
author: Mark L.

description: We sat down a eight for a light dinner and expected a nice traditional Italian dinner. The ambiance was superb and the drinks were above average. Unfortunately, the caprese salad and the buffala mozzarella was excellent but the tomatoes were under ripe. It took two hours to get our eggplant, which we shared. I would go here again but be wary of unpredictable service and product quality control.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Since when does a resteraunt slip a gratuity on the bill and the waiter expects an extra tip. Bull shit. You lost out buddy. The food was excellent, service ok. Got the feeling 2 black people and their white neighbor weren't supposed to be there from the waiter Mario who added a 15%  graduity to my bill for 3 dinners. Looks like this happens alot. Been to this place multple times and this last experience tells me they don't need my $$$$ .

Cya

Dude u lost out because I was prepared to tip you more.
author: too l.

description: One of the finest authentic Italian meals we've had!  The hostess got us in, without a reservation on a Saturday night, with every table filled... It was everything our friends said it would be - delicious food, ambiance, great service - and the owners present, greeting customers at their tables. An enjoyable evening!
author: Deborah H.

description: This was our best meal of our week in SF.  I haven't had pasta this good since I was in Italy many years ago.  Fantastic service and nice ambience.  Do yourself a favor and give this place a try!
author: Laura C.

description: The service was pretty bad. For a restaurant with such a high price point, I expected exceptional service. First off, we waited about 10 minutes before waters were offered to us. The only times we saw the server was when he hastily took our order and when he gave us the check. The busboy was super friendly though. The food was ridiculously overpriced for below mediocre quality. I suggest checking out the other great Italian places in the North Beach area. I will NOT be returning.
author: Jenny T.

description:
The good:
* good gnocchi
* all the pasta is made by hand
* wine list is top notch

The bad:
* served stale bread
* I came here to have an Italian meal with "primi e secondi." They gave me vegetables with my secondi when I asked for none.
* service is friendly but incompetent.

Places like this can get away with less than stellar service because they think they are serving tourists. I want trattoria pinocchio to know that locals work close by and that in Italia if you served stale bread, they would tell the Godfather on you.
author: Jim B.

description:
My friend and I had a serendipitous meal at this wonderful restaurant. The caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had - crisp lettuce, just the right amount of dressing. The mixed salad was fresh and delicately dressed.
My friend had their homemade sausage ravioli with cream sauce - fabulous! My calamari fritti was just okay (hence the four stars) - crispy but not especially tasty. 
Tue ambience was pleasant, and the wait staff friendly and attentive.
author: Da W.

description:
If I could post zero stars I would.

I was showing a large group of friends and family the sights of the city (there were 8 of us total). We were in North Beach when we decided to stop for a glass (or two, or maybe three) of wine. Pinnochios looked ideal--outside seating and nearly empty. We asked the hostess if we could sit outside and order some wine and  possibly a dessert or appetizer. She said yes and we sat. As we were organizing ourselves, the manager came over kicked us out, telling one of my guests "this is not a bar, go somewhere else to drink." 

I should mention that our group ranged in age from 40 to 70, plus a 5 year old. We were not kids "bar hopping" or partying, just a group of low-key adults wanting to sit and enjoy a few glasses of decent wine in the freakishly nice weather. I should also mention this was about 3pm, which is a "dead' time for most restaurants and Pinnochios looked to be no exception.  

I worked for years in the restaurant industry and there is no excuse for this kind of rude behavior. Not to mention the total lack of business sense--we would have ordered two or three bottles of wine at least--our bill would have easily been in the triple digits and at a huge margin.They turned away very easy income (are you reading this, owner of Pinnochios?) from a nearly- empty restaurant. 

We went next door to cafe grecco instead. Not the same wine selection but they were happy to serve us, which was far more important at that point. 

The "poetic justice" footnote: after we left cafe grecco, we walked past "our" table at Pinnochios again. Empty, and there have not been enough time for someone to eat and leave since we left. I hope the empty table left a nice tip. We would have.
author: Christy B.

description:
After hitting up the usual brunch spots in North Beach, and being unwilling/unable to wait the 45 minutes for a table, friends and I ended up at Trattoria Pinocchio.  At first, the place seemed promising, because there was standard Italian fare and also brunch options on the menu.

The restaurant received its first strike (an unforgivable one at that) when we received a spoiled milk latte.  Yuck.  You can imagine how disgusting that dairy concoction tasted.

Strike two came with the receipt of the bread basket, complete with slices of stale French bread and pats of margarine.  Margarine at an Italian restaurant???  Are you kidding me?  We all passed at the trans-fat goodness placed in front of us.

Yet another strike (and yes, that would be strike three) came when our food arrived (after quite the wait), and one of the entrees had incorrectly prepared food.  It's not as though we asked for some substitution--rather, we simply ordered one of their brunch options, and they couldn't even make it in accordance with the descriptions provided on the menu.  When we pointed that fact out to the server, rather than leave the entree and return with that portion of the dish, properly prepared, he took the entire plate and left without barely saying a word, leaving one of my brunch companions salivating with hunger as he stared at the rest of us eat.

Three strikes, you're out.
author: Alexis N.

description:
I have come here a couple times for lunch and have always left happy. The staff at Pinocchio's is kind and welcoming and their food is delicious! 

Usually for lunch, I am more of a sandwich/salad person, so I tried their Mediterraneo panini and house salad and it was fresh and filling. The panini had tomatoes, mozzarella, olive oil, and basil on it. Very simple yet tasty and the salad was fresh and light. Another time I have come here for lunch, I had pasta - I had their cheese ravioli with marinara sauce and it was so good! I definitely recommend both. I also like that they serve brunch and also have a separate lunch menu from their huge list of entrees.

They also have a full bar if you are in the mood for a drink! Also love that they are playing the World Cup games.

Definitely will be coming back for dinner sometime soon!
author: Stephanie C.

description: The food was very good and full of authentic Italian flavor. It had that European cafe feel, but we felt the menu was just a bit too lengthy (which isn't always a bad thing.....but can make ordering for two tough with so many choices).  The staff was very attentive, although a bit slow, and helpful with the menu. For some reason they were out of the polenta at noon, and opened at noon........so that was a huge bummer.  I had the dungeness crab pasta.....would definitely recommend!!!
author: Daryl T.

description:
When we were in San Francisco for vacation this past September, my wife and I went to Trattoria Pinocchio for our "get dressed up and eat somewhere real nice" evening.  My wife has been in the Bay area before so she recommended this place for us to eat.  I was not disappointed for one moment.  This place is amazing.
First of all, it's part inside and outside dining.  What I mean is that the outside walls of the restaurant are made of glass and they actually open up to the sidewalk.  Everything from the drinks, appetizers, salad and main dish were very very good.  For dinner I had the best seafood linguini ever.  Nothing even comes close.
I have never been to Italy.  If I did I would think it would be like eating here.  Just being there you feel like your in Italy.  Everything from the decor to the servers seem very authentic.  The food is great.  I am just jealous of the people that live there who can eat there every week.  I highly recommend this place to anyone living or visiting the Bay area.
author: Paul S.

description: Undoubtedly the best chilled cracked crab we have ever eaten!! Special appetizer on the menu that nite. We made the mistake of ordering two servings and the platter was huge! Phenomenal! Cracked and chilled in marinade of olive oil, garlic and Italian parsley. Left us a bit overfed to finish the osso bucco and sausage stuffed ravioli. Luckily we could take those leftovers to eat later. But finished the crab!! We will definitely return.
author: Mary Anne S.

description:
Of all of the restaurants in North Beach, how is it that you can get a seat here without a wait? Unlike many of the other Italian places around, the wait is almost non-existent. I was not feeling very patient and waiting 45 minutes elsewhere so we decided to give the food a try.

While walking in, a man outside started serenading people to come for a meal.  That should have wowed me but glancing around inside, it feels cliche. It was a little on the late side and we weren't too hungry so we ordered a bottle of wine and created a pizza.

We put together a gorgonzola, artichoke heart and prosciutto pizza which surprisingly turned out nicely. We could only eat a piece each but managed to gurgle down the wine easily. Of course.

The service was decent and when it came time to pay for the bill our server was quick to the punch. I'm partial to another restaurant that seems a little more authentic in the area but if there is a massive wait I know of a restaurant that can get you in quickly.
author: Morgan M.

description: Awesome food;old school Italian food great for a special occaision.Good solid traditional Italian food;all the classic dishes.Good wines,good desserts.
author: David M.

description: Great dinner last night! The service was great, food was amazing. Authentic Italian! It felt like we were in Italy! The owner was singing to the tables. Great experience
author: Brigette B.

description: Our experience was perfect from the moment we stepped in the door. We were sat right away shared an appetizer and had a delicious dinner. The owner/ executive chef came out to our table multiple times to check on everything. He even sang to us, I would absolutely go back.
author: Mark M.

description: Insalata Estate and Tortellini al Bolognese were both very good but portions were quite small and prices were on the high side for ala carte lunch plates.  Wine pour was generous.
author: Jim A.

description: I love linguini (with clams and mussels) and Pinocchio's was fabulous!  Washed it down with an Italian beer (Birra Moretti)  and an open window view of Columbus Street.  I felt as if I was on vacation.  Service was excellent.  My pasta was perfectly prepared (al dente) that I complemented the Chef as I was leaving.  Will return! BB
author: Barbara B.

description:
There was a time that I would have given this place 3 stars - about 4 years ago. But the last 3 experiences there have been amazing. 
1. Showed up with 15 people + a baby after making a reservation 30 min ahead of time, they had a table ready and the service was great. No problems with complicated vegetarian and vegan orders and lots of people ordering things that were not on the menu. The meat was fantastic and the gnocchi AMAZING. 
2. came for a romantic dinner with my boyfriend 3 weeks later. Great deserts, friendly wine recommendations  - not the most expensive bottle on the menu with attitudes like at so many other place in North Beach. 
3. 4 + a baby. A singing owner, staff that loved the baby and food that had us wanting to come back. The Portabella mushroom is brilliant.
author: Tre B.

description:
I took a group of 12 there on a Saturday night (with a reservation). We showed up early and our table was set and ready for us. 

The service was outstanding, we left a generous tip. The food and wine was the best. ALL 12 people were impressed. 

Believe me, it's hard to please a large group, but they did it VERY well. 

Can't wait to be back.
author: Kevin S.

description: We weren't quite sure who our waiter was out of the three helping us, and the service was on the slow side, but the food and the personality displayed by the staff will definitely take us there again in the future.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Amazing!

Highly recommend the bruschetta to start with.  Seafood linguine as an entree.  And the cannolii for dessert.

Great atmosphere.  Great service.  

I think the Little Italy area in San Fran is amazing an this place is a great find.
author: Michael B.

description: My family dined at Pinocchio's on Christmas Eve 2014, with two adults, two kids, and two grandparents.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  The food was very good, the atmosphere festive.  The manager delighted the patrons by singing opera behind the bar periodically throughout the night.  He sounded fantastic.  We were very happy with our whole evening, though the waiter forgot a couple of minor requests throughout the evening.  We will come back here again and again.  Good place for romantic meal or any meal.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
How we found this Italian delight in the middle of little Italy! 

I took my sister and mother to San Fran for their Birthdays last April. We were on a Cable Car and asked where do the locals go for really good Italian? We were told the The Stinking Rose. My sister piped in "oh yeah my friend at work said we should go there, it was SO good". Without hesitation we asked for directions. We took the bus down Columbus from our hotel as far as we could go. We started walking and most of the restaurants on Columbus have outside seating. So as we are walking we can see what everyone is serving, and the smells Divine. 

We walk past Trattoria Pinocchio and the food looked amazing, we stopped and glanced at the menu and thought it might be pricey for lunch. We continued on to the Stinking Rose. Mind you all of the restaurants were pretty busy. We arrived at the Rose and it was dead, the menu looked blah and the prices were the same as Trattoria Pinocchio. The icing was when another guest came out while we were looking at the menu and said "don't eat here it's not very good". Game over we went back up Columbus to Trattoria Pinocchio. 

SOOOO glad we did. 

We started with Carpaccio prime beef tenderloin, arugula, shaved parmigiano, capers, truffle oil & grilled bread & Margherita pizza fresh tomatoes, basil & extra virgin olive. Delizioso! 

My sister ordered a bloody mary that she demanded I try, I don't like bloody mary's now I do damn that was good! I had to get a couple of my own yes I'm on vacation people! 

I had the Ossobuco braised veal shank served with saffron risotto & sautéed vegetables, my taste buds love me soo. This was the best Ossobuco I have had since it was home made for me. 

My sis had Tortellini alla Boscaiola meat tortellini with peas, mushrooms & prosciutto in a cream sauce. Outstanding choice. 

My mother had Ravioli di Salsiccia Our house made sausage ravioli served with a porcini cream sauce. Amazing! 

We all shared with each other and had a fantastic meal, we sat outside it was a beautiful day. Our fob (translation fresh off boat) Italian waiter was a shit but we didn't care the food came quickly and it was incredible. He just had a funky attitude like we were beneath him or something. That's fine we tipped accordingly. He will soon learn how you make a buck in the US. 

I would give it more than 5 stars but that is all they let us do on yelp! Tourist and locals....I recommend you go here you won't regret it! Most authentic Italian, more on the Sicilian side I have had in a long time. 

Piacere il Pasto! Enjoy the meal in Italian. lol : )
author: Kerstin B.

description:
Best Italian cuisine, Best service, Best atmosphere in North Beach!
A must return for every visit!!!
Ask for the Silver Fox
author: Ted B.

description: Absolutely perfect! Food, atmosphere, and service... I ate here alone after work for lunch and the hostess was so charming, she didn't just stuff me in a corner. My food came prompt and how can I not be satisfied when it was also cooked to perfection, try the salmon fettucuni!
author: Bella V.

description:
One word: YUCK.

Only had the chicken parmigiana but it tasted like Costco chicken nuggets with some pretty bad marinara sauce.

Only good thing about this place is that you can sit outside and people watch.
author: Anna E.

description: Long wait for waiters, long wait for check. Worse clam linguine ever, every bite is sand. The bottom of the plate u can see all black sands there. I complained and no one come back to address the issue after 20min of wait. Will never come back again!
author: Sam L.

description: Perfectly located for watching people go by on Broadway.  Food is very good and service is fantastic. Prices seem reasonable to me in spite of the incessant whining on Yelp about the cost of anything that isn't a food truck burrito.  One of my favorite places to hang for lunch or dinner on a warm night in SF.
author: Steve G.

description: We have celebrated birthdays, anniversaries, and recently a christening luncheon. The food is awesome and the service is outstanding. Giovanni has made us feel apart of his family and he is Uncle Giovani to our grown kids. If ever in the North Beach area you must visit.
author: Lucy V.

description:
First came here by accident while I was in town for work, I was walking around looking for another restaurants that I couldn't find and ended up here.  Thank god I did, I was alone so I sat at the bar and chatted with the bartender for a bit before ordering. 

I settled on the Spaghetti alla Carbonara with a glass of house red wine.  The dish was fresh and very creamy.  The peas were not soggy or dried out like I have had at other restaurants and the pancetta was perfect.  I was full and delighted as I made my way back to the hotel for the evening.  

The second time I came I had been living here for a couple months and was so excited to finally get to take some else here.  I brought my mom here for an afternoon lunch on Friday in November.  We sat outside on the sidewalk, enjoyed a glass of wine and order an appetizer of Bruschetta.  The tomatoes were still firm and mixed perfectly with the garlic and olive oil, one of my biggest let downs it soggy tomatoes in bruschetta.  I ordered the lasagna with veal and my mom had Cappellini al Pomodoro.  Both dishes were cooked to perfection with plenty of leftovers for later that day. 

I cannot wait to go back here again and try another dish!
author: Kristen B.

description:
I really would not recommend this place.  I have walked past it many times without going in.  A friend said it was good, and one afternoon after missing lunch, my husband and I ate here, desperate for a good, filling meal.  And I must say I was disappointed.   

The food was just mediocre, and for the price not worth it.  The service was lacking.  With so many great restaurants to choose from in San Francisco, I wouldn't eat here again.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I thought of the perfect sign for the outside of this place. It would be a picture of Pinocchio with his nose extending all the way down the block, and a speech bubble beside his head, saying, "The food is delicious here!"  It would be appropriate, as only a real liar would say such a thing.
 
Three of us went to dinner here the other night. We wanted to go to Pulcinella, which may have the best Italian   food in the area, but they were closed.  I have tried, since our visit, to try and think of ways to bump my review up to 2 stars, but it isn't possible. 
Shame on these people for ripping off tourists with their horrible food.(I refuse to believe that any locals frequent this place).

We were really hungry.  They did seat us and take our orders right away. Each entree was hovering at around 17-25 dollars. The waiter may have been Italian, I don't know or care, but he certainly was playing the part of an Italian..dancing around and singing O Sole Mio..(didn't impress us, but whatever.)

Two of us ordered chicken parm entrees. The menu said that  we could get it with either mixed veggies or pasta but the waiter said it would be much easier for them to make pasta as it was late...so fine. They brought us some cold, hard, tough bread with cold butter. We didn't eat much of it.  When the entrees  arrived,  and I am using tactful language here, they were over-salted and had sauce from cans..no love or care in its presentation. Had it been 4 dollars I would have just thought "ok--it's bad, but it's cheap", but this was bad and expensive..The pasta was overcooked and the sauce on it tasted canned.  I'm Italian. I cook a lot. I know canned sauce when I am unfortunate enough to taste it.  

My Girlfriend got the Pizza Margherita. It was smothered in globs and globs of cheese that looked and tasted like the cheapest possible product they could get their hands on . It was flavored heavily with sage and lots and lots, and LOTS of salt. There were flavorless, unripe diced tomatoes and green herb flakes sprinkled all over the top.. yuck.(I tried it and all night long I felt as if I had drunk a glass of salt)  She couldn't eat more than one piece. When the busser came to remove our "finished" plates and saw the not-eaten pizza they didn't ask her if she wanted it to go; they must have known how terrible it was.  They simply don't serve good quality Italian food and they know it. This place is EXPENSIVE and what you get is  embarrassing!!  If I were to open a place and serve this kind of fare  to people I would be ashamed. 

Do yourselves a favor and  avoid this place, unless you really don't care what you are eating or how much you are spending---or unless you want to hear the shameless waiter singing and dancing IN YOUR FACE for his tips as the swill they serve up is being brought to your table.

Remember folks,  in literature, Pinocchio is a well known fib teller. Don't believe him when he says that the food is good here! Go to Pulcinella's. Or Gepetto's...or Mcdonald's.. Or skip dinner and go to sleep early. You won't be missing anything. When you wish upon a star, I suggest wishing to be transported to any other restaurant.
author: craig v.

description: Was on a business trip to the bay area and stumbled on this gem.  My service and meal were absolutely fantastic.  The owner made you feel as if you were visiting his own dining room and the staff delivered service and food like they were trying to make their mother proud.
author: Jackson I.

description: Just ok.   Three people, 4 glasses of house wine and the entres, 3 dinner salads,  bill came to $178 with tip.   Have gone there before,  and might go back depending on wait times at other restaurants
author: Peter G.

description: We were told that a table would only be 20 minutes max. We ended up waiting  an hour and a half for a table for two, and then were told that there was no more dough to make pizza. The staff should have been honest up front about how long the wait actually would have been.
author: Ruby K.

description: Absolutely wonderful.  Gnocchi sorrentina was amazing! Gnocchi melts in your mouth and the sauce and the cheese paired perfectly the delicious smoky flavor of the mozzarella  cheese with creamy tomato basil was to die for, truly a treat. Foodie must. Excellent service the hostess was very charming and our waiter was on too of it! A+++
author: Marie B.

description: My friend and I were in North Beach and had a late lunch at Pinocchio's and yes it was great food and funny, great waiter, HOWEVER when we got our bill we had an added 4% health Care tax added on it...WE ARE SICK OF BEING TAXED TO DEATH!! If we go back there the 4% will come out of the waiter's tip - I know that isnt right, and not his fault but you know what?  we are tired of paying for everyone simply cause we are working tax payers.
author: Mary Ann N.

description: After walking around couple of times we decided to eat here. The food was really tasty! I had the chicken parmigiana and I got the roasted veggies and they were so tasty this was an excellent choice! we sat outside and were admiring the moon and the whole ambiance was great! I will definitely come back, I give them 4 stars because the service was just okay! and the spaghetti a la carbonara was not good at all. But other than that it was great!
author: Luis P.

description: The worst service ever. I went there with my family tonight and sat 10 minutes without a single person acknowledging us. Got up to leave and told them why and got no response. Went down the street and had a fabulous dinner elsewhere.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Very cute dining place to go on a date - I did! We sat outside and it was very nice and cozy. The staff and service was on par, the food was spectacular and the drink menu was delightful - a great high rent intoxication! I ordered the pesto pasta dish, and it was so creamy and decadent! 

I've eaten there twice and I can't wait for my third!
author: Thao L.

description: The old, pretentious host turned us away because we only wanted a bottle of wine and no food. The restaurant was completely empty.. What idiots turn away patrons?  Needless to say, we will never attempt to try the place again.
author: Monika F.

description: I LOVED this place! My girlfriends and I were in the mood for Italian food and what better area than 'little Italy' - aka North Beach. They literally have anything you could think of when it comes to pasta dish varieties. They don't just have one type of ravioli or tortellini - they have 3-4 of each to choose from. Great selection. The table bread was nothing impressive, however my 'gnocchi enzo' was seriously the BEST gnocchi I've ever had. Incredible. I passed my entree around the entire table and everyone agreed - unbeatable. Prompt and attentive service as well.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Great little gem in North Beach! After walking down the streets of little Italy for a while we stumbled upon this place. What attracted us to it was the large selection of pasta, some with white sauce  which we absolutely adore. There was a 45 minute wait when we got inside -- they made us sit at the bar which wasn't bad;-). We had a vegetariano pizza and gnocchi. The gnocchi was just out of this world -- it was delicious, the sauce was thick and creamy and the gnocchi itself was succulent. 

The pizza tasted so good -- it came with fresh vegetables and herbs. This restaurant even offers a generous serving of bruschetta and butter cubes to start with. We were so full at the end of the meal and decided to skip dessert. We can't wait to bring family over the next time we are in the area. 

Ambiance is lovely. The seating is comfortable . Mostly suited for a couple or a small party because of it's size.
author: Divya K.

description: We ate here twice this past week for dinner.  we wanted to return after finding this place last year when looking for a place for lunch.  I had the pollo linguine one night and the crab & lobster ravioli the other night, both were excellent.  The service & atmosphere was also excellent, can't wait to make it back there.
author: Karen D.

description: Loved it! My boyfriend and I came to San Fransisco for a long weekend from Portland, we came with goals of eating great seafood and italian, pinocchio was definetly some good Italian! I had a ceasar salad (a little pricy) and vegetable lasagna which was incredible, my boyfriend had mixed salad and fettuchini Alfredo with chicken.. Also great but not as good as the lasagna. We split tiramisu for desert and it was very very good. Next time I will try the gnocci. I recommend this restaurant for good Sicilian eats.
author: Christy G.

description: A wonderful place in North Beach with a wide menu to satify! Bruschetta is one of the best in the city, and we have tried a lot. Not always the best service but the ambiance and food certainly make up for it. Highly recommended for lunch and for dinner.
author: Brittany A.

description:
With all of the great restaurants in North Beach, I didn't know which one to pick.  Was sorely disappointed with my selection at Trattoria Pinocchio.  

We went there for lunch and I had the fettucini alfredo w/veggies.  Very bland, needed salt and cheese flavored.  What is the point of alfredo if it doesn't taste like cheese.  The only saving grace is that the pasta seemed to be fresh and it was tender.

My daughter had the salmon ala vodka - again, not much flavor.  

We did have the caprese salad and the tomatoes lacked flavor and were hard - similar to the ones you get in the grocery store.  

Not impressed with the place at all. Only saving grace was finding "Stella's bakery" across the street - yummy!
author: Michelle S.

description:
going to cities and fooding out..thats what i do..
u know how you sorta have a list of spots to hit before you leave?
well,i went here twice in 2 days.

antipasti platter was great..mar-gee pizza with some prosciutto
def hit the spot..
sat outside in the warm sf sun..
yeah i said it...warm sf sun.

my waiter was a trip, had laughs and people watched like a mofo...its a great locale to post up, and snack on some italian foods with your crew.
author: WHATS g.

description: This is an excellent place .Went with four people for an early Sunday lunch.Everything was good.I strongly recomend the gnocchi.Everyone in my party was happy and that can be a tough thing to bring off.If you like good Italian food and dread the Olive Garden you'll be happy.I'll grant the service was a little harried but the place was crowded.
author: John K.

description:
Great food, though I would've liked more sauce on my pasta.  Our waiter was gruff at first but really warmed up.  Love the owner.  We really enjoyed sitting outside and we were happy we didn't have to wait too long.

Having said that, one of the hostesses was a raging wench.  We randomly picked this place as we walked and as I waited in the doorway (next to the hostess desk, by the way) she yelled at me to move out of the door.  I told her I *was* going to put in our name for a table but no thanks.  I walked out.  

My husband and I walked around a bit more (while I cooled off) and didn't find any other menu that we liked as much.  When we went back, he went to the desk and asked if we could sit outside.  She replied, "I don't know. Is there an open table?"  My husband replied, "Isn't that YOUR job?"  She was awful.  Steer clear of the young girl with the severe eyeliner.

Lucky for the restaurant, that was all we had to see of her.  The remainder of the experience was a delight.
author: Katie P.

description: We went here on a whim, out in NB and hungry and seemed ok. The service was good, wine selection was good but the food was disappointing. I ordered the chicken parmigiana, it looked good when the plate arrived but the chicken was tough and rubbery, I hardly ate any of it. It is probably the worst chicken parmigiana I've ever had. The prices were ok, not too expensive so I guess you get what you pay for. Thankfully we had a bottle of wine and a salad so I wasn't starving. But considering how many awesome Italian restaurants there are in SF, you should def skip this. My husband had the ravioli's and said they weren't that great. Oh well.
author: Kimberly R.

description: When we lived in SF, this was a regular stop for us.  It's one of the better Italian places in North Beach, and we alway seemed to find an open table.  Service is always a little slow, but don't take it the wrong way...Italian cuisine is supposed to take some time. The social aspect is just as important as the meal.  Don't just order a single plate.  Order a primi then a secondi (share plates if you want, no problem), and whatever you do, do not skip the dessert.  It's all good.  They have some nice, inexpensive Italian wines.  Just ask for their recommendation, it never misses.
author: Shaun H.

description:
Trattoria Pinocchio is a good place to go for a drink and appetizers sit outside and people watch.
The food is ok not bad kind of Olive Gardenish. 
Five of us had a late lunch here .They were not busy at all so why
our waiter kept RUSHING US the whole time I'll never know.
I felt like asking him what are you catching the next plane back to Italy?
He even started to take my friends food before she was done saying
finished finished. The rest of the service he gave was just as bad.
The worst part was he added a 18% tip for 10% service.
There are so many better places to dine in North Beach that have GREAT FOOD AND GREAT SERVICE.
Do I smell a horse's head in my future LOL.
I've been to Italy many times and love good Italian food.
My all time favorite Italian restaurant is Pasta Moon in Half Moon Bay.
author: Bill H.

description:
We stopped here after another place had a really long wait and we didn't want to wait. 

There was a short wait of 10 min or so and we just sat outside and started with a bottle of merlot (Salmon Creek, yummmmmmy). We asked for bread and they said they only served it with the meal which I though was odd, but oh well.

Once we were seated in doors, we ordered from our very charismatic waiter. I got the penne arrabiata which I really enjoyed. It was well spiced, cooked perfectly, and a good portion (not too much and not goo little). My friend got a light linguini with roasted vegetables and that was tasty as well. Light and well seasoned also. 

The disappointment came with the desert. We ordered a poached pear that was spiced and drizzled with dark chocolate sauce. It was served room temperature or cold. We were both expecting something hot just from the way it sounded. They weren't misleading about it, nowhere on the menu does it say anything about temperature; it just seems like serving this dish hot would taste better. 

Overall, I liked the entree and would go back for it :)
author: Kristie M.

description:
The most enjoyable time I've spent in a restaurant in a long time.  Waitstaff is excellent, as is the atmosphere.  All four of us had a different selection and all agreed it was the best.  Have never had a better Puttanesca dish.  Will go back again and will recommend to all I know.
Thanks Giovanni!
author: Sue K.

description:
Great place to eat.  The food is good, the ambiance is great.  The waiters are nice.  Granted we came on a Wednesday night & were seated right away.  The food took awhile to come out, but the quality was great.

Overall a good spot.  Quite pricey, so don't come here on your Pasta Pomodoro budget.
author: Nathalie C.

description:
FOOD: Good, I loved the pesto pasta! 

ATMOSPHERE & STAFF: This is why i gave it two stars. Normally I dont care about atmosphere but this was miserable. Its cramped and they squeeze you in! I got hit by patrons and staff throughout the meal. The waiters were RUDE and really want you in and out fast! We felt rushed. I did love the food but wouldn't go back.
author: D. S.

description: I'd like to give this place zero stars: horrible, rude, inattentive service, mediocre, overpriced food. The worst dining experience I've had in San Francisco.
author: David O.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian!
So a whole bunch of us are vegetarian, and we find lots of apps and entrees to order. Everything is superb! The roasted potatoes and veggies in my eggplant parmigana are cooked to perfection. the basil linguine and ravioli pomodoro are perfect too.

The staff was super friendly and they gave us an endless supply of bread, unlike other stingy restaurants! Two of them came over with our friend's b'day cake and sang the birthday song nicely too!
author: Soniya R.

description:
Delicious in the face.  I got the lasange and tried many of my friend's dishes and it was so wonderful.  We have wines and pastas and the bread is amazing with the most wonderful oils.

Imma keep this review short.  Go here!  You WILL love it.
author: Devon S.

description: Delicious veal saltimbocca, and great menu variety.  Very friendly service...almost to the point of entertaining.  Will be back next time I'm in town!
author: Darcy B.

description:
Gorgeous day, gorgeous date, sat outside, ate tender ravioli, feather pillow gnocchi, the only minestrone I've ever liked and a decent glass of Chianti to wash it down cliche' style. 

I even managed to provide some theatrics for all to enjoy when my bra strap snapped and I had to sidle over to the bathroom to fix it while being careful not to fall. The floor of the restaurant is unusually slippery, like it's covered with baby powder...and my less than practical shoes weren't loving it. 

But it only added to the fun. Good food - great company - great weather and attentive yet laid back service. I would recommend going here on a nice day and sitting outside, enjoy the people watching and get the gnocchi for sure - you'll miss out if you don't.  You may even need it to cushion a fall if you happen to have a skating session across the floor.
author: wendella a.

description:
At 1 time this place was my fave Italian in the City. I forget with whom it was with that I went here with the 1st time but they knocked my socks off! Their Spagetti Puttanesca began a year long love affair with this dish! It was a perfect blend of the Salty (anchovies, olives) with the acidic tomato sauce.

Love their alcoholic Cappuccino's or Espresso Coretto. The best of both world's really. I'm always fighting with myself on whether to do caffeine or alcohol. Their kitchen is pretty open and it always surprises me how little Italian kitchens are and how efficient they are despite there only being 1 or 2 cooks to execute a bulky menu of items. The only bad thing that I can say about Pinocchio's is that out of all of my visits there was only 1 time when I received absent minded service. 

On one of my visits I  went with my friend Rebecca and while the food was great. We waited a really long time between courses and our drinks were left unfilled. We then left without anyone noticing. It was so bad that I told my friend not to leave a tip. Atrocious I know but it was THAT bad. Embarrassingly enough my gal pal left her wallet in the restaurant and had to go back. She said that the whole staff apologized for their oversight. I guess our visit coincided with one of their long time staff members last day. So they were pre-occupied. Just an FYI. Everyone has a bad day I would still give these peeps a try if you are in North Beach.

Top Picks
* Octopus Luciana
* Carpaccio
* Ravioli di Vitello love love Porcini cream sauces
* Spagetti Puttanesca
* Spaghetti alla Bolognese
author: Amanda R.

description: The food tasted good but the portions were not as big as we were promised when we were talked in from the staff who saw us reading the menu outside on the street. It most likely is true that all pasta dishes are prepaired fresh every day, we liked the tortellini bolognese a lot. Otherwise the Pinot Noir was not good at all (for 8,50$ the glass), pitty. We´ll probably not be back for another ~ 18-22$ plate (each).
author: Anna K.

description:
The food is great!

I came here with 3 friends and we were all impressed with our meals. I had the angel hair pasta with an arrabiatta sauce. It was excellent with just enough spice. The mixed green salad to start was just like any other.

A friend had the turkey ravioli which he raved about.

Another friend had the spaghetti bolegnese which was very meaty.

And yet another had the chicken parmagiana which was excellent.

I would recommend to anyone for dinner.
author: Ashley B.

description: Mon-Fri specials on the pasta. Friendly waiters and really good pasta. The pesto and the spaghetti was amazing. They are not stingy with the meat. Nice location, in the Italian district area.
author: Jackie S.

description: Worst breakfast since I ate at mcdonalds last year. @ least they were fast. If you like to wait on leftovers.. join them for brunch !
author: tara R.

description:
I went into this place with heavy skepticism and left thoroughly impressed. At first glance it seems like a magnet for douchebags looking for a pseudo-upscale meal. Well, maybe it is... but I didn't really care once their wait-staff seated us and paid careful attention to us the whole night.

While you wait for your entree, try the bruschetta. Afterwards, go with the tiramisu for dessert.

Trattoria Pinocchio features great food, impressive portions, reasonable prices and very friendly service... what's missing? Nothing if you ask me.

I've been trying to not give out as many 5 star ratings, but I just can't find anything to complain about with this place. It's even close to a cheap parking garage!
author: Alex C.

description:
The worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant. We were seated, our order taken, then ignored for oh, 15 minutes. Then we were given a basket of bread - no water, no silverware, no plates, no butter. After asking for the silverware, etc. twice (no apolgies either time for the delay), and waiting another 5 minutes, the waiter came by, SLAMMED a stack of silverware and plates on the table (some falling on to my friend's lap). No water, no butter. No apologies at any point.

By then, we were so upset that we got up to leave and eat elsewhere. On the way out of the restaurant, we told our very rude waiter that we were leaving. He said, "You can't expect your pizza to come fast, it takes a long time to cook!"

None of us had ordered pizza. No one expressed any regret when we left.

And by the way, this was with my best friend and both of our mothers - four polite, well-dressed women - our mothers are middle aged, we're mid-twenties. I don't think that a restaurant should treat teenagers/elderly/casually dressed people badly, but we just could not understand the service.

The restaurant was quite busy, but there's no excuse for that kind of rudeness. I have NEVER left a restaurant before recieving my food and I hope never to need to do it again. But I'm glad we left.
author: zoe s.

description: It was a pain in the butt to find parking for this lovely hidden gem but the headache was well worth it. They offered bread with oil and balsamic vinegar right away and their menu was HUGE. I ended up with a chicken risotto, a special of the day, and the rest of my family ordered some pretty awesome pasta dishes. The location  was great for people watching and the staff was efficient and playful.
author: Denise A.

description: Must son and I came across this treasure last time we were in San Francisco and it was the first place I wanted to go when I was back in town!!! Everything was just perfect from the hostess at the door to the wait staff to the owner who breaks into Italian song out of the blue. The food is just amazing. From the appies straight through to dessert you won't want to change one thing (except maybe to have more room in your stomach so you could keep eating :) Highly recommend visiting Trattoria Pinocchio when you're in town!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Your chances for getting decent Italian food in North Beach is pretty good, so why should I go to a place that expects me to pay $28 bucks for ravioli?  Look, I know the tourists need a place to go, but sometimes the locals want good Italian food as well.  I tried this place on a whim, and decided to stray from my normal joints, and kind of wish I hadn't.  Don't get me wrong--the ravioli was fantastic, but I can't imagine it being worth $28.

Maybe I'm cheap, but there are worse things in life.
author: Casey R.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a plan to take a cab to North Beach, an are of town we seldom visit, to find our "new favorite Italian restaurant". I know, this is quite a task, but we weren't yet starving, and felt up to it. We walked around and around and around looking at menus looking in windows to get a feel for the atmosphere, and alas the long search brought our weary feet (and now empty tummies) to Trattoria Pinoccio. It fit the bill in 3 main areas: 1. they had a great, varied menu 2. the light was dim (perhaps not quite dim enough for our taste) 3. they could seat us shortly (approx. 15 min.)

We ordered the beef carpaccio to start. This is one of my favorite dishes, if done right, and let me say, it quite frequently isn't done right. T.P. made the BEST carpaccio I have ever had. Perfectly chilled (not fresh from the ice box, as it often is) It had a healthy amount of lemon juice, capers and parmesan sprinkled on it, and to boot, truffle oil. Oh happy day! My sweetie got the puttanesca, which was just exactly what he was craving and I got the spaghetti carbonara: divine. The preparation of the carbonara is exactly how it is meant to be done. The pasta perfectly al dente, the sauce, cheese and bacon perfectly coating every noodle. My mouth is watering as I type. We ate too much pasta, so we were unable to order desert. Maybe next time.

As for the service, I don't recall. I was too busy stuffing my face.
author: Liz R.

description:
Well, honestly i am kinda picky when it comes to food and i really love italian food so I tried their pizzas, pastas and also chicken dishes. It was amazing, i feel myself at one of my italian friends apartment for dinner or lunch. The people who work there, are really friendly and hilarious. If you are lucky maybe you can see some of them singing Italian songs while they are serving the best italian food for you.. :) Its really cool.. 

PS: If you like Italian pizza, you must try their four cheese pizza.. PERFECTO ;)
author: Erdem O.

description:
OK so I ate a pot brownie in GG Park then went to a beer bust at Daddy's, I mean 440.  But I managed to make "friends" with a really cute guy and decided to ask him to dinner immediately.  No let's get numbers and text for a week and maybe try to make a date in 10 days BS for me, let's go get dinner now!

I wanted something good in a nice restaurant after the long string of WT I had been out with.  Come on man, I eat weed in the park and hang out at Daddy's why wouldn't I date WT?

So he comes up with this place and NOPA was at the top of my list as usual.  I went with his choice since I am sooooo adventurous.  

I really liked the atmosphere.  There was no crud in the corners.  There was no funny smell at the bar.  And everything looked nice.  Actually nice.  A nice restaurant in SF, who knew?

The food and wine were good.  Today I cant remember shit about what I ate though.  It was almost a week ago man.  We sat at the bar and got great service.  I remember really liking it all.  I'd go back for sure just to eat in a clean restaurant. I'd go back for the food too.
author: Ian M.

description: Wish I hadn't wasted one of my three evenings in San Fran at this place. After reading some reviews we went and were pretty disappointed. The food was average. Nothing special. The ceasar salad was just okay with a little too much dressing over-powering the plate. Pizza was alright with a bland, dry crust. Not very authentic. Spaghetti alla Carbonara had good flavor but just nothing impressive enough to recover the whole meal. Best part of the meal was my Peroni. Service was fine, neat to see the open kitchen with what looked to be fresh ingredients. Best to find somewhere else to go in San Fran if you have limited time....just average.
author: James A.

description: Dinner was wonderful.  In a party of 4, we all thought our dishes were terrific.  I even liked the lamb and I do not like lamb.  The only thing I did not like was the carpaccio.  I though the truffle oil was overpowering.  Overall, one of the best meals I had in a week of SF eating.
author: Scott P.

description: My mother and I passed by this place yesterday and the food being served looked delicious so we decided to give it a shot tonight. It was really chilly outside so we wanted a table inside. The Italian woman seating guests said it might take a while to get a table indoors but then suggested that we might be able to get one in five minutes. Fair enough. We waited a few minutes and sure enough, a table by the window freed up. She asked us to wait while the table got cleaned and then, ordered us to stand by the door while that was happening. She kept demanding that we stand by the door, even though that meant we were in people's way. It was embarrassing and awkward, not to mention disrespectful on her part. Anyway, we sat down, ordered, got our food, which was good but not mind blowing for $80, and the same woman kept eyeing our table to see if we were going to order the bill. We did, and paid the bill + the tip, and for the next 5-10 minutes while we finished up, I kept noticing her looking at our table as if to say, it's time for you to go. I never felt as on edge in a restaurant as I did in this one. One or two of the waiters were exceptionally sweet, but that lady needs to learn a little bit of etiquette. I can understand the pressure that comes with managing a busy restaurant, but I know I won't be going back there again anytime soon.
author: Alia A.

description: We love everything about this restaurant, the service, the food and atmosphere. We love to take guests from out of state here. They have a great selection of manly cocktails which is important after dealing with the usual SF parking cluster F.
author: Scott A.

description:
Does anyone else find it awkward when your waiter refers to their wine menu as a clusterf**k?  There is a difference between being honest and being uncomfortably honest.  Mr. Waitperson, you crossed that line.

All in all, this place was pretty good.  Typical North Beach Italian joint: rude-ish host, very rich dishes, heated outside dining, and fairly quick service.

I got the creamy tortellini.  It was quite rich and made my stomach ache a little bit afterward even with some Lactaid.  My date got gnocchi, which was excellent.  With a glass of wine and a shared salad, the whole dinner was about $40.

Took a star off for the fact the people next to us were not getting the best of service.  Another star off for the waiter dropping the F-bomb.
author: Chris M.

description: Came here for lunch. Anchovy spaghetti was too salty.. don't order it. And the onion soup was OK.. Paid around $25 bucks for food that wasn't even that great.. bread could have been better.. service was.. ehhhh.. OK
author: Princess N.

description: Little Italy was kind of overwhelming...we weren't sure where to eat so we kind of stumbled into this place. Then we came back a couple of weeks later with my dad cause we enjoyed it so much the first time. Both times we had excellent service and really delicious food. Great Italian, and great seafood. The seafood risotto was sooo good.
author: Cami J.

description: We got scammed.  After paying cash, the waiter came back to tell us we didn't give enough cash.  We counted it before paying.  We gave enough cash.  Then we ended up paying more to avoid an issue.  My meal was supposed to have shrimp, but instead it had tiny pieces of sponge that were made to look and taste a bit like miniature shrimp.  The reason there is a wait at so many other restaurants while this one seems to always have a table waiting is that this place leaves a bad taste in your mouth.  Oh, and they charged more on our bill for the than the price stated on the menu.
author: Russ S.

description:
Changed from 4 stars to 3.

I've been back a couple times since my first review. The food's not bad at all, but really overpriced for the quality and what you get. I'm more than happy to pay for a nice dinner out, but it's got to be really damn good if I'm shelling out $30 for a meal.
author: J K.

description:
If i could give it a half star I would, it truly was that bad. I eat out a lot and I used to be a server so I understand that sometimes being a server is difficult but in this instance there was no excuse. 

We had made a reservation for 8:30 and arrived at 8:37 and they did not have our table ready. So the hostess asked us if we could wait outside at one of the tables until they did get our table ready. We all sat outside for about 5 minutes until the hostess came outside and asked us if we could move out of the table so she could sit another party at the table even though A. she asked us to sit there and B. there was another table empty right next to us. I was very shocked.

Finally 10 minutes after we arrived we were seated(even though we had a reservation). Once we sat down it took another 8 minutes just for us to be greeted by and our server who had already  walked by us twice without a word. When he finally came to the table he still didn't really greet us no name or anything just asked us what we wanted to drink. 

From the time we placed our drinks to the time our drinks arrived took 9 minutes (yes i timed it i don't usually but with such a bad start i felt that i needed to). The drinks were all ordered with expensive liquor and all poured with cheap liquor. Two of my friends out of five of us actually enjoyed there drinks but the rest of us were not impressed at all. Twenty minutes after we were seated at the table bread was delivered to the table. Yeah the stuff that should be dropped off 2 minutes after you are seated with the waters which we had to ask for. 

When he delivered our drinks he took our food order we ordered the bruschetta and the mushrooms for appetizers. They took 17 minutes to come out they are pretty brainless dishes it should maybe take 10 minutes. The bruschetta was ok but the mushrooms were disgusting COVERED like I've never tasted with balsamic vinegar.
