While we were waiting for our entrees to come out I made the mistake of going to the restroom, the ladies room was semi clean but their was no toilet paper and I was told the mens room was really awful.  Also while i was standing in line to wait for the one-person bathroom i watched one of the cooks pick up a chip dip it in salsa eat it then resume right back to work. Did not wash his hands didn't even wipe them off on his pants.

When our entrees finally arrived 22 minutes after our appetizers they were definitely not worth the wait. For one thing my friends risotto was seen sitting under the lamp for at least 10 minutes. YUCK. I tried her risotto and even if it had been warm it would have tasted gross I can't even describe the taste but it wasn't a good one. I split the manicotti with my b/f it was ok but for an italian restaurant i expected better. The gnocci was actually pretty good I mean i guess they finally got something right. 

Overall the service food and drinks were awful. The only thing giving them one star is first i can't give them a half of a star which would only be for the gnocci because everything else was horrible.
author: Samantha T.

description: Love this place. Have eaten here for over 5 years and it never fails to serve well. Outstanding menu. Delicious pastas. I always enjoy the  mixed greens with the lemon vinaigrette. Their chicken saltimbocca and roasted potatoes are to die for. Delicious house wines my favorite is a nice mellow Chianti. Highly recommended. Great people watching. I've eaten outside here in the pouring rain the freezing cold and in beautiful weather. always a hit.
author: Anthony A.

description:
Disservice all round, unless you're idea of a good time is being ripped off by the waiter (pretending not to understand our orders, bringing out more expensive plates that we did not order, etc) failing to replenish beverages, only becoming attentive when a woman joined the table, etc etc.  (And I know there is a segment of the dining crowd that likes this treatment, so go here!)

Hard to evaluate the food fairly.

As for me, I don't need it.  There are better places to hit up after a hard week's work to relax, kick back and visit with your friends, and who have service staff that know how to treat everyone right and make it a good time all round. 

If you need confirmation just see how many Friday & Saturday nights this place has lines running out the door... exactly.
author: Jim W.

description: AMAZING Italian food. I also appreciate that they have an entire vegetarian pasta section. And the wait staff is charming. Love this place!
author: Sarah B.

description: My friends and I were visiting from New Orleans and we were craving some Italian food. We came across this place and it was delicious! It was authentic and definitely hit the spot. Also, there were some live music aka the owner sometimes walking around singing Italian opera. Needless to say it made the visit entertaining!
author: Emily B.

description: Iam going to keep it simple, the food is not great atleast I did not think so and too much attitude from the servers to top that..... Not worth it
author: Sri V.

description: Pastas are not bad but pizza was meh. Beware though, if you get fountain drinks they'll ask if you'd like to get it refilled, which we normally do, but they charge drinks by servings! When I ask the server he simply shrugged and told me "you don't get pastas free if you order another one", which to me is a dumb analogy; you don't ask customers to REFILL their pastas, smartass! I can't believe I fell for this tourist-money sucking trick in the US.... Anywhere BUT the US!!! Also the owner is kinda annoying because he kept on bellowing out to whatever Italian tune they're playing and he wont leave your table until you acknowledge him. Do yourself a favor and just skip this place.
author: Vicky R.

description:
Ugh, North Beach restaurants in SF are SOOOO for tourists.

Oh wait, I'm from L.A./San Diego.  Damnit.

'twas delicious, and delightful company, including Yelp SF's very own Kirk B.  Huzzah.

The pasta was tasty, they frequently hooked a brotha up with some water, and made me grin like an idiot with a delicious tiramisu.  Everyone wins.
author: Teej T.

description:
Good, not great. $10 for a smallish Caeser to go with my veal ravioli. Ravioli was tasty, but nothing special. Sat outside on a cold night to avoid the 45 min wait inside. Waiter was ok, but didn't seem very nice.

I probably wouldn't go back until I've been everywhere else in North Beach.
author: David M.

description: Friendly service, no waiting for a table outside on a beautiful summer evening. Perfect for people watching. Oh, and the food was incredible!  I had the spaghetti alla carbonara and it was fantastic. Just like Mamma used to make. :)
author: Tami S.

description: Now, this is great Italian food!!  I go here with family and we are treated oh so well!!  I recommend this place.
author: Elaine B.

description:
Let me start by saying, no soy Italiano.  So I am no Italian cuisine connoisseur, so don't know the difference between great and good pastas or sauces.  All I know is I liked this place.  The service was attentive (helps when you sit near the bar) and the food  was good.

I wouldn't make this a destination restaurant, not many of those in North Beach in the first place, but if I'm in the area or plan to be around there, I would head back or recommend.
author: Will C.

description:
3.5 stars

There are so many Italian restaurants in the North Beach area and we've been working on trying a new one each time.  On a rare warm Friday evening, we decided on Pinocchio because of its outdoor seating.  Yes, there are a lot of sidewalk seating but Pinocchio probably has the best because it's located on a much wider street that doesn't have too much people or car traffic yet with view of Columbus where the action is.

We got a good sidewalk table and it was the perfect evening to be outdoor to enjoying the night.  The waiter was very friendly and helpful.  We had the following:

bowl of minestrone (6.50) - it was good and hot, that's important

cappellini al pomodoro ($12.95) - it was al dente and that's hard for cappellini.  simple but very flavorful.

seafood ink taglitele ($19.95) - that was the pasta special of the day, this was very flavorful with a nice smokey flavor.  It is one of the better ink pasta we've tried. 

Poached pear al chocolate ($7) - this was delicious!  The pear was not soggy but still has a nice texture but the chocolate was fantastic.  I wish it came with something to wipe the chocolate but I made do with my finger, YUM!

We got a bottle of the Rufino Chianti ($28) and it was pretty good.
author: Gloria H.

description:
If you want some delicious heart attack pasta order the gnocchi gorgonzola. It is so good except bring some Mylanta, yikes. The gnocchi is the reason for the 4 stars. Super, super delicious.
My friends have gotten chicken parm, bruschetta, and several pizzas. So far the food has always been good. 
Service can be a little cheesy, especially when we ordered a bottle of wine and the server insisted we order the "better bottle" of the chianti. We politely decline and sucked down our cheap bottle happily. 
Kinda touristy location so be careful of the people walking around trying to sell balloons and shit. They won't go away even when you tell them to.
author: Jamie G.

description:
We went here last weekend on my 1st trip to San Francisco. I had a great pasta and a couple of martini's Lovely place and big up to our waiter Lorenzo, who was friendly, efficient and a great waiter. 

I enjoyed the pasta it was great
author: Dwight M.

description:
Bleh.  I took my kids here because they liked the open windows.  We all ended up regretting passing by several better choices.  The food was expensive and ridiculously bland.  We had the lentil soup from the specials menu, and it tasted like wet beans- not a speck of salt or any other seasoning I could detect.  The bruschetta was burnt and even that was bland.  

Worst was the $20 plate of risotto, full of raw carrots and stringy asparagus.  Worse than bland- this dish was simply disgusting, and not one person at the table would eat more than a bite.  The staff was apathetic and paid us bare attention, even though there was only one other party in the restaurant.

When we tried to pay the bill, we discovered they were having trouble running credit cards- something they'd never mentioned.  They left us sitting for over twenty minutes, trying to run cards, until I finally ended up walking two blocks to an ATM just so I could get out of there.  

This is the first time I've ever left a restaurant and headed directly to another, so we could actually eat something edible.
author: Jennifer E.

description: I live in San Francisco and this is my favorite Italian restaurant! Love the polenta with mushrooms, tortellini, lasagna and especially the rack of lamb! Try the rack of lamb with the burgundy sauce , its as good as it gets! I order the chianti wine, which  is a reasonally priced italian wine and it go well with, of course Italian food!  Menu covers everything you could think of, maybe too big, but stick to the basics and you will really enjoy this Italian restaurant!
author: Robert L.

description:
well, 3.75

For a Saturday, the wait was still a little long (maybe 45 min?) and there really isn't great standing room either, so I knock off one star for that.

The food is yum, service was great, and prices seem reasonable, although I was here on a date and didn't really look at the bill, lucky me!  Good date atmosphere, pretty casual, condusive to conversation, and I saw a bunch of groups too, who seemed like they were having a great time.  I had gnocci with a tomato cream sauce--delish!  we saved room for TWO great desserts, creme brulee and tiramisu-- yum!

Outdoor tables available, but SF weather is often freezing.  Ample space inside, comfy.
author: Mai T.

description:
Been here a few times now. Nothing too great, but decent Italian fare. Last night I had Scaloppine Piccata (veal sauteed with capers and white wine demi glaze). I thought the veal was too tough and the sauce very lemony.

A friend of mine had the filet mignon, which was pretty decent.

Overall decent place in North Beach.

No, I don't know why I end up going here.
author: Premshree P.

description: Loved it - definitely will return.  The gnocchi was exceptional... Little tender pillows of loveliness.
author: Pamela R.

description:
The food was extremely mediocre, as in I could have made just as good fettuccine alfredo with a bag of frozen Biutoni crap.

On top of that we had to wait over a half an hour for our food as we watched our neighbors receive their food 10 minutes before us, when we showed up first!

And, when we tried to complain, the waiter took it personally and gave some sort of lecture about how he's also a BofA customer service rep., as if it was relevant.

Oh, and btw, SODA REFILLS ARE NOT FREE!  What a joke!
author: Jonathan B.

description: The food was good (ravioli), the service was good and I enjoyed them both sitting outside.
author: Dave B.

description: I went there because some people gave four stars. What a disappointment. Overrated and way too expensive for what we had. Basically one not crisp but chewy calamari and two linguine for almost  $ 70.  Vongole with bad mussels and my pasta with scallops swimming in oil. I had a peak in the kitchen as I left and I understood, cheap labor will result in poor quality, that's simple. Service wasn't any better.
author: Chantal L.

description:
I definitely like this place. My first time here was for a large group dinner in December 2005 for my friend's bachelorette dinner. Everyone was pleased with the food and drinks. I think I ordered a pasta in a gorgonzola cream sauce which was amazing. 

I had dinner here last night with my boyfriend after the North Beach Festival. We ordered the bruschetta, veal lasagna and meat tortellini in the walnut cream sauce. The bruschetta was awesome. A great balance of flavors--the crispness of the crust, the freshness of the tomatoes and the basil. The lasagna was delicious. It came drenched in a delicious meat sauce. It was a hearty portion which was great because I was hungry. I also had a bite of my boyfriend's tortellini. I thought it was okay. He was not a fan. I think the walnut cream sauce sounded better than it actually was. 

We will definitely be back but the next time I'll suggest he go with the gorgonzola cream sauce.
author: Valerie C.

description:
Check your credit card statement after you dine there.  We charged our dinner there on a credit card, and when the statement arrived three weeks later, the restaurant had blazenly bumped the total up by $5.  No, there was no chance of a a typo because a $25 tip could not possibly be mistakne for $30.  

The food's not bad, but the service is lacking, you have to ask for everything.  Now with the liberty they took on my credit card, I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: R W.

description:
Solid experience here with the food, but the service was a bit lukewarm unfortunately. 

I arrived here a little before closing time on Saturday night as was promptly seated. There I sat for a good while waiting for someone to acknowledge my presence. My waiter and the hostess decided they would chat about life and co-workers for 10 minutes while I sat watching them. Eventually he came over and said he didn't notice me, but that's not really true since I was in the corner of both their eyes. Additionally he has other customers so if you're spending all your time chatting with staff you're not going to notice them trying to flag you down. I think he tried to play catch up after I was a bit grumpy about that and because he waited until the kitchen was closing to start putting orders in, which I think rushed the chefs.  

I opted for their special which was a fish dish which was done reasonably well and a salad which had good presentation. I would say the food is slightly overpriced although there was nothing wrong with it. I'm curious what else they can do. 

A solid place worth trying again, and perhaps worthy of 4 stars, but I hate unprofessional service and I don't want to watch staff talk about their life problems or who likes who all night when I'm hungry.
author: David G.

description: Utterly charming, scrumptious appetizers, and amazing entrees in an environment that makes you feel like you are, in fact, in a trattoria in Italy.  The old-school Italian waiters are friendly and fun.  The cocktails are a bit wanting, but the entire romantic atmosphere makes up for it.  Bravissimo!
author: shojua p.

description: We selected this restaurant among the many on Columbus because it looked inviting and the gal in the front said the pasta was homemade. It was empty at the time (5 pm) but we knew it was early so we stepped inside. By the time we left, the place was full - mostly with locals, which is always a good sign in North Beach.  We had a very nice meal. Started with generous size gin drinks, and a couple of nice appetizers, including a warm portabello mushroom dish that was a hit. Everyone enjoyed their entrees which all tasted fresh and homemade. Service was just fine - perhaps because we were early. We would go here again when eating at North Beach.
author: Speranza A.

description:
i made a dreadful mistake of taking my two children and wife to this establishment. i have never felt so demeanored. for one, the wait for a table took ten minutes to be seated, even though there was lots of tables available. i just figured they didn't want to seat us near certain people because we have a five year old boy and  a beautiful seven year old daughter. 
finally, when we were seated, it took ten minutes for the waiter to take out drink order. i ended up ordering my children soft drinks from the bar. which were completely overpriced,the soda machine must have been broken, because they were completely flat. i asked the waiter later for some new sodas, and he acted like we were asking for a huge favor and charged us again for replacement sodas. 

 i asked the host for a booster chair. he responded" isn't your boy a little big for a booster chair." i  have never felt more embarrassed for my son. we never were served bread till our meal came. the bread was hard. my food was hot but my wives was cold. we asked the waiter to heat it up. it took him fifteen minutes to return it. 
all in all , the food wasn't too bad, if you don't mind the wait and enjoy cold food. the place is also not "kid friendly"
author: vito q.

description: We often visit Trattoria Pinnochio. Because parking in this part of the City can be difficult we nearly always park down the street in Public Parking (next to the SFPD Station). The restaurant's staff is always friendly - the food timely served and the price moderate for its level of excellence. This is a nice family friendly restaurant.
author: Mike H.

description: Of all the great spots to explore in North Beach, I end up at Trattoria Pinocchio quite a lot. It's reasonably priced, and to date, I have not had better gnocchi sorrentina anywhere else in San Francisco. Table service can sometimes be spotty, but hey, they're Italians and we Americans sometimes expect too much ;-)
author: Meredith R.

description: If you eat here, get the calzone! It is the best calzone I have ever had and it's HUGE!  It can easily be shared by two people.  Service is pretty good but the calzone is better :)
author: Aubrey B.

description: Amazing food.  Service was spot on and the "silver fox" (our server) was both funny and helpful.  Also, the prices were pretty unbelievable given the quality of food and atmosphere.  This is NOT a break-the-bank night out.  Definitely recommended.
author: Ian C.

description:
This was our third time at this restaurant and although the service was not too great the last time we were there, the food was good and my husband and I decided to have lunch there again. I should have known that our experience would not be a good one as soon as I was seated.  Shortly after a family was seated next to us and I was surprised that they were offered water and asked for their order before us. 

 We eventually were asked for our order and I looked over to my husband and suggested sharing an entree.  To my surprise the waiter gave me a disapproving look.  We decided to order drinks and the Carpaccio as appetizer and told the waiter we needed more time to decide on the entree.

 Feeling a bit intimidated in the prospect of ordering a shared entree and thinking maybe it's not appropriate to order an entree to share,  we decided we would order two dishes once the appetizer is served.  So while we were enjoying our drinks and  getting  pretty hungry we realized the appetizer was taking longer than we thought and we had  no bread on our table.  I looked over at the family beside us and they had bread so I thought that the bus boy just forgot.  No one was around for me to ask so since I had to go to the ladies room any way  I decided to ask on my way there.   I tried to gain the attention of the waiter who ignored me twice.  I decided to ask to the bus boy who replied that the reason he didn't bring the bread was because we had not ordered our meal.  I was shocked and told him we ordered drinks and appetizer and awaiting to order the entree. He turned away to get some when I noticed he was complaining to the waiter about it. 

The bus boy brought the bread and I said "as you can see we ordered drinks and appetizer so is there a problem" and he answered "yes".  At this point my husband wanted to leave but we had already ordered the appetizer.  As it turns out the bread was stale and finally our Carpaccio was served.  I then asked the waiter why the bread had not been served earlier and he said "it's served when the bus boy is ready" I was dumbfounded, and had  enough so I asked for the check.  

We decided we might as well eat the  Carpaccio  since we were charged for it, but it was awful, tasting more like Mortadella.  We spent $35 and left no tip.  We walked across the street while hearing the family next to us complain about their meal and had a  wonderful lunch at Colosseo.  I will never patronize Trattoria Pinocchio again will tell all my friends how we were treated.
author: carmen d.

description: I am Italian living in Cali. Pinocchio is a place for tourists or for people that have no idea of the quality Italian food. Nice environments, nice service but the food is pretty bad to me. In Italy a place like this would not stay open for one month. We ordered 4 dishes yesterday, none of them was fresh or decently made. My pizza was a joke: defrosted pizza, and for 19 bucks. The ravioli are not fresh hand-made (you can buy the same at a grocery store). I will go somewhere else with real Italian cooks next time.
author: Carmine Z.

description:
One word: gnocchi

it's so creamy, tender, and delicious, the way gnocchi should be! (IMO) 

This restaurant was a bit expensive but definitely a fun date night dinner! My boyfriend and I had our first serious date here and two years later, we're still head over heels for each other. I hold a special memory in my heart for Pinocchio's.
author: K S.

description:
It was Bootsy Collins who originally proposed the Pinocchio theory in 1977 - Fake the Funk, the nose grows.  

Coming here a few nights ago, I expected to be faked on the Italian.  The place looks pretty tourist-trappy, and while the ambiance is nice it lacks the charm of the smaller places down the street.  However, the food and service was superb, and prices a little steep but not unreasonable.  Our group went with the gnocchi mozzarella, lasagna, margarita pizza, salmon, and fettucini.  All except the last were delicious and filling, and I'm not a huge fan of Italian.
author: John H.

description: We were on our way to a different Italian restaurant and decided to stay here for dinner instead.  We were so glad we did!  Service, excellent.  Food is very authentic to Italy.  Fresh, delicious and plenty of it.  Highly recommend.  In fact, we liked it so much, we went back again before we left San Fran.
author: Dodo H.

description: My sister and brother in law love this place, being from the East Coast, they expect a lot in Italian food.  They have the North End which is also great.  So every time they fly in, they want Pinocchio's.  My brother in law loves the cioppino.  This time I had the Penne, simple and great.  The service on the other hand, not that great.  And on top of that, they charge 18% and that was for a party of five.  I guess they know they are going to get their tips so must not worry about giving great service.  I almost felt like I was begging for some extra bread.  Besides the not so great service,  I loved the food.  Appetizers were delicious though.  All the dishes we had were very good.  But I am still bugged over the 18% added gratuity, since when did tipping go to 18 instead of the courteous 15.
author: Leslie Y.

description:
The food is excellent! I've eaten here many times, and I always love what I get to eat.  I've had the Gorgonzola Gnocchi, the pesto fettuccine, Caesar salad, calamari, and some others....
All of the sauces are absolutely delicious, and you can definitely tell that the pastas are homemade.  The Gnocchi literally melts in your mouth.  It's a bit pricey though, so definitely works better as a dinner place. Wine list is good as well!
author: Courtney M.

description:
Since there's 230+ other reviews out there, I'll try to keep mine short.  The food was excellent; they have quite a few fresh pastas they make in house which is always a plus. I ordered the Tortellini alla Boscaiola (which is meat tortellini with peas, mushrooms & prosciutto in a cream sauce).  It was excellent; the sauce was delicious.  The only downside was that the portion was a little small.  Maybe it's because I eat a lot, or maybe I was just too hungry when I went there, but I wasn't hardly full at all.  So, to make up for this I ordered some dessert (plus it was my Christmas dinner, so I felt I should splurge).  I ordered the Baba (a sponge cake with a rum sauce and vanilla cream inside).  The dessert was mediocre; the cake tasted sort of tough (maybe it needs to be like this to stay together after soaked in a rum sauce?), but I didn't really enjoy the flavor either.  But, that's okay.  All the staff were very friendly and helpful when ordering.  Be careful if you stop by the front, you're likely to be drawn in by the nice female hostess that I always see out front greeting people.  

The restaurant is very nicely decorated, seems like a pretty upscale place.  The prices aren't horrible, but not really that cheap for the serving size (about $15-$30 for entrees, then add $7+ for a glass of wine).  They also have a pretty good happy hour ($3 or $4 glasses of wine and other stuff). 

All-in-all, the service is excellent, the food is tasty (at least the mains), and the atmosphere is great.  So go check it out!
author: Kyle H.

description:
I just ate here Monday night and would go back in a heartbeat. I had a dish with penne, eggplant and a wonderful spicy marinara. It was fabulous.

Atmosphere was clean, well decorated and not at all corny (as you know some North Beach restaurants can be). Would come here for a date, with friends or with family- it'd work in any scenario. Oh, and our server and the hostess were actually Italian. That's always a good sign. :)

Only precaution I'd throw out is that the wine list isn't great. Basically all stuff you can buy retail. That said, I didn't care because I was too busy enjoying the food.

Mangia!
author: Daniel M.

description:
We had wanted to have some North Beach Italian for dinner all weekend - I was skeptical about this place because of the location and name, but the high ratings on Urban Spoon, the fact that we were tired and STARVING and that it wasn't super crowded drove us in here for dinner. 

We started with Bruschetta and some red wine (of course!). Mmm-mmm. Good appetizer. In fact, everything was good - the only thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars was that I think I ordered the blandest dish: Ravioli Pomodoro (Spinach/Ricotta). It was good, but not to die for. However, I had some bites of my friends' Fettuccine Pollo Alfredo and the special w/Sausage and they were both SO TASTY. 

After dinner, the waiter brought us all complimentary Limoncello (SCORE!), and we ordered 1each of the deserts. The tiramisu was great, the creme brulee was yummy - but the best was the poached pears in DARK CHOCOLATE SAUCE. Omg. Why have I never ordered these before??? They were amazing. 

I'm marking this as a good dinner place in SF - there were a lot of restaurants around the area that looked cheesy/touristy, but this one proved itself to be better than its name.
author: Amie S.

description:
I had the walnut sauce tortellini, and it was incredible!  My companion had the pea tortellini.  Both were very good.  Service wasn't great, and the drinks weren't wonderful.  But I'll go back for the food.

Update:
Went back again--had the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce.  Maybe the best gnocchi I've ever had.  Definitely not super filling, though.  Get an appetizer.  It's also a bit expensive for the amount of food you get.  Super yummy, though.
author: Monika M.

description:
I went here with three friends for Sunday brunch.  We all loved our meals, however it took forever to get served.  Happily, we got our drinks very quickly. :o) 

I always like kitchens that are open, so that you can watch the cooks prepare the meals while waiting in the line for the bathroom.
author: Taylor S.

description:
OMG ! I am seriously shocked that that this place doesn't have a 5 star rating.  I've been here about 7 times, each time with diff. ppl and we've always had an excellent Italian meal.

The staff is super friendly and even more attentive, I love the outdoors seating, complete with heat lamps for those cold SF nights.  I can't even remember all the stuff I've ordered here to recommend since every dish had been delicious.  One in particular does stick out in my mind - a did a create your own pizza (about two years ago) and to date, it is still the best pizza I've ever had.  Waiters are also great about recommendations for Italian wine to complement your meal.
author: Kristine T.

description:
Best Italian Food In The City.  There, I said it.

The Gnocchi (any kind) is my favorite.  Always tender.  Everything else I have tried there has been good, and the friends that I suggest this place to have always said great thing.

Good atmosphere, not to mention the attractive wait staff.
author: Adam O.

description: Terrible experience, the service was absolutely awful. In my past 10 years of dining this stands out as one of the top 3 worst service experiences. Food was average at best. I strongly recommended you avoid this restaurant.
author: D F.

description: Loved it! Sean (SP?), the bartender was awesome. My boyfriend & I were in town visiting from Florida. We sat at the bar and had the best lasagna (shared it b/c it was enough for two). I would definitely go back! :)
author: Toni O.

description: As a north beach resident for over 20 years, an Italian American who can cook, has traveled extensively in Italy and Sicily, I consider myself to be a good referral for Italian restaurants in my neighborhood.  I have been eating at Trattoria Pinocchio for many years and have never had a bad experience with the service or the food.  Last night was no different.  At prime time dinner hour, we were seated immediately and the restaurant was busy.  As usual our waiter was attentive and the generous portion of veal lasagna was delicious.  Over the years I have sampled many dishes here, including the pizza, and have never been disappointed.  Giovanni is a wonderful host who has a passion for serving authentic Italian /Sicilian food. I give this restaurant a 5 star rating.
author: Suzanne L.

description: Food was good to fair.  The theatrical older waiter was a joke...a bad joke.  If this were my restaurant, I'd fire the guy ASAP.  His manner and comments ran the gamut from archly seductive to coldly dismissive.  It was small comfort to see that he treated the busboys equally badly.  We won't be back.
author: Dick L.

description: Service was very good. The food was okay. We had gnocchi & pizza. The gnocchi was homemade and very good, but the sauce was bland. The pizza was extremely salty & over cooked.
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday and had reservations at 7.  Almost all of us were there on time, a few stragglers.  However, at 7:05pm, the waiter tells us that there are alot of people with rezzies, and our rezzie was at 7pm so we need to hurry up.  -_-  Ok just because not everyone is there, you are telling us at 7:05 that we need to get out?  Hm..  

Other than that, the food was alright.  Calamari fritti was a little cold once it got out.  Chicken fettucini alfredo was decent but not memorable.  Although the boyfriend enjoyed his spaghetti bolognese and the coffee.

Overall, food is ok but service could have been better.
author: Yosie G.

description: Pretty nice restaurant. The Server was very nice and friendly. I had the Linguine al Pesto Giovanni which is made fresh daily *thumbs up!*. I really liked the portions since I'm not a big pasta fan or correction I can't ever finish a plate so I was quite happy with my dish.
author: Marlyn D.

description:
Two of us got the "menu" which includes a basic (cheap) pasta and small salad. My friend loved the penne arrabiata and my linquine with pesto was good, and enough for two meals. $13 seemed kind of expensive to me but I guess you're paying for the corner North Beach location.

The pepperoni pizza could only be described as boring. (If you're having a pizza jones skip the ambiance and head for Golden Boy on Green St)

The 11 year old couldn't say enough good things about the lasagna and scarfed it up before anyone could have a bite.

Once the restaurant got busy the service got more disorganized although it was ok. This restaurant could be called a "safe bet" but I would definitely try other places next time - especially because the bread was just so so.
author: Susie W.

description: Gnocchi was amazing but the fettucine pollo was out of this world good.
author: Dominic M.

description:
Without a doubt would not ever return or recommend this place.

My parents made reservations for five early in the day. We arrived and our seats were in the back-- literally in the kitchen. There were other tables up front open. My father did not want to be rude and say anything, but he and my mother were visiting from their small town and treating us to dinner in the city so I went up to the front and told them we needed a nicer table closer to the front so we could be part of the restaurant's atmosphere. The hostess tried to say no, but a busser came up and said he could give us the next table he cleared (he  was wonderful, charismatic, and hilarious). Our server was rude, cocky, and put out by every request such as "May I have my water refilled." I wanted to order a drink but the waiter was so absolutely rude and dismissive that I decided I would just try going to the bar in order to be faster. Wrong wrong wrong. Bartender ignored me and my cousin and I didn't even end up ordering a drink because he didn't deserve the revenue. I didn't order dinner either because the server was condescending (I know, super mature of me...) and I felt horrible that my parents were trying to treat us to a wonderful dinner and we ended up at this joint.  I did try people's dishes and they were delicious. It's a pity our busser wasn't our server. He was the best among the staff.
author: Holly M.

description: Maybe its because I'm not a city gal but it was really nice to go to an Italian Restaurant where the staff are actually Italian! The food really was quality Italian food that is unlike anything you can make at home. My mom ordered the lasagna and I had the pesto linguni. Both were incredibly rich and flavorful. You can really tell that everything is handmade here. Go during lunch and order from the lunch special list. For $12.95 you can get a fresh pasta dish, crisp mista salad and perfectly baked bread. The bread is crunchy on the outside and melt in your mouth on the inside. I will definitely go back to this place next time I have a hankering for true Italian cuisine.
author: Jaimie B.

description:
While passing through North Beach with my parents who were in town over the weekend the look of a pizza a couple was eating prompted us to stop in here for an early dinner yesterday. We split a couple of pizzas among the three of us and had a few slices leftovers. We had the fresh tomatoes and basil pizza and a pie with artichokes, mushrooms, prosciutto and salami. Both were typical North Beach thin crust, wood oven pizzas that actually made me realize how good wood oven pizza is and how much a little bit of fresh basil goes a long way. 

The service over all was rather average: though the dining room was almost empty since it was so early I felt like they were trying to rush us through the whole meal. The prices were so-so and I get the feeling like everyone else has mentioned that this place attracts a lot of tourists coming up from the Wharf. That doesn't mean this is a bad place, just, as I said, kind of average. I imagine a quick walk down a side street will yield something a little more local and less touristy.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
2 stars may be a bit harsh for this place, but I've rated better places 3...and SF has a really high standard for restaurants, so 2 it is.

I was a 1 person party this evening, so I sat at the bar. A full bar is awesome...but would be even awesomer if the bartender understood what I was asking for (I said NEGroni not PERoni, I said Bellini not Peroni...he was seriously pushing the Peroni...weird).

The menu had fairly common, traditional dishes, so I was assuming this was a superb ingredient place. In other words, stick to a classic, and you'll be rewarded. I picked the veal lasagna...was kind of a let down. It wasn't bad, but it was very Olive Garden. Too much sauce - if a cute baby cow got to live in a pen his whole life so I could gobble up his awesomeness, please don't slater it in sauce...

Service was pretty slow, as the 2 bartenders seemed to be moving all over the place as fast as they could, yet there were only 5 people at the bar. You had to make some cool sign if you wanted to get their attention. They were pretty nice though after you had their attention.

Nice enough decor, off the wall bad music. It is a casual place with over the top opera playing in the background. Its like hearing 80s music while getting a prostate exam. It just seems somehow grossly inappropriate. 

Clearly this place targets tourists, and probably does pretty well...not really up to this local's standards though.
author: Sean C.

description: The SERVICE by our waiter was bad! Excuse my language, but he was a di-- head. He was tall and thin with dark hair. Another server/employee, who was bald, was helpful. The food was good, not spectacular. My husband had a chicken dish and the glaze/sauce had skinned over, due to sitting too long before being served. My daughter had the pizza and it was too greasy. I had the alfredo with vegetables, it was ok. The waiter didn't ask us if we wanted dessert or didn't ask my husband if he wanted another glass of wine. Go figure.
author: Jamie M.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to do something nice and decided last minute to go to the city for the night and get some yummy food. We dressed up and he made reservations at Pinocchio's. The service was great and the food was so delicious. I had the Cioppino (spelling??). The sauce was thick and full of fresh garlic and herbs. MMMMM. We toasted with champagne and enjoyed each others company in low, romantic lighting. If you go to North Beach soon, try this place. You won't be disappointed.
We stayed there until almost 11pm so if you are hungry and you think it's too late to stop by for a meal, think again! Perfect place for a filing late night dinner. Top it off with some tiramisu or spumoni!
author: Alyssa E.

description: My  husband and I ate here for dinner and loved it!  The food is fresh and delicious and the wait staff was excellent. Our waiter Antonio provided excellent and prompt serve.  I highly recommend this restaurant. The pesto dish I had was amazing.  My husband and I were trying to decide where to eat in Little Italy and as we were walking by this restaurant we stopped to look at the menu and a lady eating at a table next to us told us how delicious her food was, so we tried it and were quite pleased.
author: Maggie M.

description: Giovanni, the manager, was very pleasant and we noticed that he was eating some dungeness crab when we walked into the restaurant. When asked if we could order the crab (I dont think it's on the menu), he had some brought to us on the house. My friends and I (we were here for lunch) proceeded to order the Mediterranean sandwich, the veal lasagna, spaghetti primavera Sophia, and the pear/gorgonzola/honey/walnut antipasta. All were excellent. Wait staff was courteous and attentive. I'd go back.  Molto bene!
author: Stanley W.

description:
Pinnochio's  could be touristy or not depending on the time of year.  This time I did here Val-lee-joe as a cross street so there was some tourist flair.  Mostly there were more locals than tourists, the few times I have gone. It is on Columbus,  so you have to expect some visitors.  = )

We go for the namesake for our son so he can see the myriad of Pinocchios all over the bar.  I would call it Italian comfort food.  The dishes are well made, a little heavier than some Italian fare and completely satisfying.   I didn't discern any cut corners on the meal and no "interesting" extras.  When you want real basic Italian food, come here. 

Sitting outside affords you a view of both North Beach and Chinatown. It is a great pleasure to watch the world go by as you drink and dine.  The wait staff, as mentioned previously, is from Italy so you get some Old World flair and flirting.  It has its own charm.

Buon gusto!
author: Holly J.

description:
Some one else said it and I repeat it, I don't like giving one stars but this place deserves it.  The service was horrible.  They seat inside and out and when asked where we wanted to sit the hostess looked at us like we were idiots.  The waiter continuously walked by us not giving us bread, water, or asking us if we were ready.  

My friend ordered a beer and was brought wine and when we asked what it was the waiter did not even know what type of wine he brought us.  

My food was horrible.  I AM an Italian connoisseur and I detested it.  The bread was stale, and my main meal was bland and tasteless.  I ordered Raviolis with a cream sauce and I believe the entire sauce was only cream.  No salt, no spice.  The waiter did not ask us if we would like parmesean cheese, yet other waiters were providing that service at tables around us....

All in all I did not enjoy the experience or the food.  This neighborhood has so many great italian places so don't waste your time or money at pinocchio's
author: Tim M.

description:
I was with my buddies and we wanted something to eat after the North Beach festival since nothing was appealing to eat at the festival, so we walked around twice and our dumbass went in for a late lunch.  Here's a question, Honestly does a restaurant really need hooker type people harassing people to come into a restaurant for good food?

The bathroom: Dang I think they only have 2 stalls for both men and women.  There was a line to use the stalls and the restaurant wasn't packed at all, imagine if it was full.

The food: Had the prosciutto and mozz sandwich, which was ok. If I were you, just go across the street to Molinari for a sandwich. The calamari was alright, typical, but too pricey.

As Big P and Will "the thrill" would say, "Is it a one and done place?" Heck yeh.
author: Calvin H.

description: You know, we'll have to find another place to eat  in North Beach because I had their gnocci again and it was different.  It was thicker and overcooked and the sauce was reduced down to a sweet tomato paste-not very fresh tasting.  We also had their bruscetta and it was way too oily and there were giant chunks of garlic in it which made me hate myself for days.  Not a winner, looking for another Italian place on Columbus.
author: Sarah B.

description: Amazing chicken alfredo...and everything else!!! My boyfriend and I stopped at about a dozen different Italian places in North Beach before choosing this one. We loved it! Great wine, great food, great service (we had the silver fox as our waiter and a very friendly hostess greeted us at the door), and I love how they have seats on the sidewalk so you can enjoy the atmosphere and people watch, makes me feel like i'm in Italy all over again! Favoloso!
author: Barabra B.

description: This place has the best pasta I have eaten...ever! I got linguine calamari. Best thing there, in my opinion.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Such a misleading restaurant. Like most North Beach Italian restaurants, they had a beautiful woman standing outside their door who's only purpose is to lure-in the foot traffic. The restaurant seemed cute enough, so we gave it a try. Almost as soon as we sat down our waiter didn't give two hoots about us. He was arrogant, condescending, and didn't even refill our water glasses once (isn't that in waiter-101?). I know some jaded waiters assume that young-looking folks don't tip well if it at all, and that's how he made us feel. Like we were some punks that didn't appreciate good service. Well we do. And we appreciate good food too. And this place fails at both. So note-to-all: do not be lured by the singing Italian sirens of North Beach. Because sometimes there's a shitty waiter standing behind them.
author: Katie S.

description: As my two friends and I were wandering through North Beach looking for a nice Italian place to enjoy lunch and a bottle of wine, we happened apon Trattoria Pinocchio.  They had tables outside, which was perfect since we were looking to enjoy the beautiful weather as we dined.  The food was excellent, as was the wine selection.  Our server Michele had such a dry sense of humor and we had a great time joking with him.  He definitely added to our positive experience.  So if you find yourself wandering through North Beach, definitely check out Trattoria Pinocchio, take a seat outside and ask for Michele.
author: Jamie S.

description: We went there tonight for an early dinner so that we can be home before the craziness of the 4th of July crowd at the Wharf starts descending toward North Beach.  Service was excellent.  We shared the polenta with mushroom and truffle oil for appetizer and I had the gnocchi with basil and tomato sauce.  When I commented that I couldn't taste the truffle oil on the polenta, they immediately gave it an extra drizzle.  The polenta was deliciously creamy and earthy with the mushroom and the oil.  My gnocchi was cooked perfectly, fluffy and not starchy at all as it sometimes could be.  Overall, an enjoyable meal!
author: Yvette F.

description:
I've frequented this place over the last few years and I've always found it to be very consistent.  

The food is wonderful.  Even if you have plain old spaghetti, it's really really good.  Well worth the price.
author: Susan T.

description:
My favorite meal of my whole San Francisco vacation was lunch here at Trattoria Pinocchio.  I make my own pasta and sauces so I can really appreciate the effort that goes into their homemade creations.  We sat outdoors which is always ideal.  I can't say that the service was exceptional, but the food certainly was.  

I enjoyed the carpaccio appetizer that was different than what I am used to.  At Pinocchio's they include bread, mixed greens and capers in the dish with the sliced beef and shaved parmesan - nice touch.  I ordered the lunch special (spaghetti bolognese) and it came with mixed greens (the lunch special ended up being cheaper than the appetizer).  

I have made gallons of bolognese sauce and Pinocchio's sauce was so excellent that I am going to alter my own recipe to start including ground veal and run it through the food processor to get that fine ground texture.
author: Christine M.

description: Found a new place in North Beach!  Have been there a couple time now and have enjoyed both visits.  Need to go back and try their pizza and pasta.  Have tried their steak (yum!) which I don't see on their online menu and was served with a subtle/complex tomato 'sauce' (sorry, don't know what term to use to accurately describe it), mushroom soup and their chicken al limone.  Would recommend everything so far.
author: j d.

description: This is a standout in North Beach.  Excellent seafood & pasta.  The Sicilian cracked crab was outstanding.   Try the Gnocchi Gorgonzola as an appetizer.   The service is fantastic, and occasionally the sicilian owner has come to our table and offered his unique humor and singing talents.
author: Paul K.

description: Lunch here was spaghetti bolognese and minestrone. Excellent food, superlative service, and cafe style dining on the street make this a quintessential North Beach dining experience. The pasta is all made in-house, and I was impressed by how delicate ordinary spaghetti with meat sauce could be - as if made by faeries.
author: Darren M.

description: they sat us at a cute table for 2 outside under a heat lamp with a plant giving us a little corner of privacy from the rush on Columbus.. this is where our rankings of Pinocchio peaked. Before we even had the chance to order our entrees they were out of 3 items we tried to order claiming they had a very busy weekend (it was a Wednesday night). Between the lack of options and the server who gave us little indication he cared that we were there we decided to move on for our meal. We had already ordered 2 glasses of wine and did not want to be rude by leaving abruptly so we ordered the beef carpaccio which was actually very tasty and a nice presentation on the plate, only recommendation to them is to include a little more toast. Maybe Pinocchio is great on the weekend when prepared with items on the menu but we will not return.
author: Barbara C.

description: We've been here a few dozen times (we live in the neighborhood) and the service has generally been good.  My wife likes their pesto linguini.  I don't really have a favorite here.  I think the owner bought a few cases of limoncello on the cheap as they give them out as free after dinner drinks.    I am not a fan of limoncello.
author: David H.

description: Solid place, serves up the italian classics like you expect them to be.  I had the Linguine Palermo  (baby shrimp, bay scallops, olives, capers & garlic in a savory tomato sauce) which had a nice but not all that exciting flavor.  Dining companions had chicken parm, which was done perfectly except for a touch of extra sweetness in the sauce.  This is a good place for picky eaters, who like the classics without any "weird" additions.  Personally I enjoy the weird, creative meals otherwise this would have been 4 stars.  You will also notice that your fellow dinners are 90% tourists.
author: Katie M.

description:
What an awesome meal.

It is hard to choose a place to eat when you're craving Italian food in Little Italy. By random, my boyfriend and I decided to dine at Trattoria Pinocchio on a Friday night. We sat at one of the outside tables. The waiter was friendly and attentive. For our entrées, we ordered the Chicken Parmigiana and the Fettucine con Salmone. Both were delicious. Portion size was perfect. For dessert, we ordered the Vanilla Creme Brule with two espressos, which was the perfect way to end such a wonderful meal. Definitely don't judge this place by their bread, honestly, it isn't that good, but everything else was fantastic!
author: K L.

description:
Great little place. I went there on a date, we had wine, an appetizer and entrees. Everything was great. The wine selection by the glass is very very limited, so expect to buy a bottle. 

The bruchetta is great, the Chicken A Limone is fantastic! Roasted garlic and potatoes!MMMMMM

I would reccomend it if your looking for authentic italian fare. Its a nice little romantic place in north beach, the service is good, not always terribly prompt but kind and skilled. 

Give it a try

I gave it a three star due to the lack of wine by the glass selection.
author: Bobby P.

description:
Pinocchio used to be one my safe bet, old familiar places in the city. Now, it's just a comfortable place with good memories that should return to the days I recall.

I have eaten at a few of the usual places in North Beach (our Little Italy) and I keep coming back to Pinocchio. I used to enjoy this place immensely. Although, the food has declined in richness/quality and flavor over the past couple of years.

I'm not sure what the deal is. I suspect that the Italian cheeses, vinegars, and seasonings are being replaced with local options. That's just a guess.  I don't know this for sure of course.

I used to enjoy dropping in during my single days, dining at the bar especially.  The staff is friendly, Italian and helpful.  The wine selections are good. They offer great suggestions and I personally enjoyed every encounter with staff.

Still, I like the lobster Ravioli.  Also the smoked salmon and grilled salmon choices for brunch are my personal style of cooking.  It's treat when cooked by others.

As far as the venue goes, the restaurant is larger than average when compared to many of the tight seating places found in North Beach. 

The wood finishes are pleasant and add to the richness of the  experience. It feels classy, mature and old world. 

Since it is a Trattoria, it is a great property that transforms for sunny days, cold days, classy evening feel or casual breakfast brunch. 

I don't recommend sitting outside on the sidewalk facing Columbus if your preference is outdoor. That would be okay if you want that experience on a Friday or Saturday with a cool mix of international travellers passing by as you enjoy light snacks and heavy drink. I suggest indoor above all, open window or on the side street as nice secondary options. I always sit inside. 

The ownership is Italian which effects the outcome of the experience; The waiters are Italian; The food is Italian; The ingredients have been  Italian. 

Initially, I did not understand some of the negative reviews I have read for this place. After all, I have been there evening, afternoon, and morning. I have been there alone, as a couple, with friends and even with an infant. I keep returning. 

Ironically, communication issues that were indicated by some here are aspects of what I enjoy: A truly Italian experience, including Italian speaking staff -- Italians. It is not an American restaurant serving Italian.  I feel like I have stepped board a classic Italian Line ocean liner, or at least, that I escaped from America and found myself in Italy. 

Occasionally there is a music trio performing tasteful jazz music in the entrance area on the weekends.
author: Jason K.

description: Great location with seating outdoors which is great when it's 75 degrees in sf. But food is sub-par and bottle of $40 wine tastes like water. Didn't think anything in north beach would be that bad but I guess I was wrong.
author: Philip L.

description:
We were going to Beach Blanket Babylon, and we wanted an Italian meal.   This was a fantastic choice.  The food was wonderful, the service was exceptional and I loved the flirty Italian Waiters, especially the "Silver Fox."  He would sing snippets of songs as he approached the table.  We all loved our meals, and there were some picky eaters in the crowd.  
The wine list was fine, and the bar was well stocked.
I will be eating here again!
author: Mary B.

description: I have never written a review, but I feel like the way I was treated here was unbelievably rude. My nana who is 80 years old and cannot eat anything very heavy, was out with us to pick up a dress that I had brought to have tailored. We were hungry, so we bought her a light snack and then thought my mom and I would have lunch here. We asked the lady that sat us if it was ok that my nana have her snack while we ate. She said yes, and I thought so that it wouldn't be rude, we'd sit outside. The manager basically kicked us out because my poor nana was not eating their food. I understand the rules and health policies, but I also work in customer service and know how to treat people. If you'd like to know how it feels to be treated like you're not decent enought to eat somewhere, then this is the perfect place. I've lived in the city my whole life and never encountered such a rude place.
author: Anna T.

description: The food was medicore and the shell fish was old and previously frozen. The service wasn't any better.
author: Cheryl M.

description: My husband and I went to Pinocchio for the first time this past weekend based on the ratings we saw on yelp. I have to say that the overall service was good. I had a Caesar salad and thought it was really average compare the all the Caesar salads that I have had so far. We made our own pizza, and I think the pizza was average. It was a nice outdoor place to try, but you can definitely find better places in north beach!
author: CN M.

description: Tasty Italian Food!  I've liked everything I tried the two times I've gone so far.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The worst restaurant experience I've ever endured!
The waiter Mario was rude, slow, impatient and doesn't have the slightest clue what customers service means. 
It was my first time in SF, and this place was recommended by the hotel we were staying at, and from here on, I'll be checking Yelp instead of listening to one person. 
The food was slow in arriving, and then I found a long, straight, black hair in my food! Fyi, my hair is curly and blondish...when the waiter finally deigned to grace us with his presence, he said "that's impossible, we don't have anyone with hair like that". He kept arguing with us. We asked to speak to the manager, who kept us waiting for 15 minutes. When he showed up at last, he too said that they didn't have anyone with hair like that. Keep in mind that it's been roughly 30-45 minutes, I have not gotten angry, I have not raised my voice, but I have yet to have anyone in this joke of a restaurant apologize. I asked for the check and got the hell out! It's sad because I was really looking forward to enjoying the food in San Francisco...maybe next time...but avoid this place at all costs!
author: Michelle E.

description: best Italian food in North Beach! its not just food here, its an experiance!
author: Hank B.

description: Dried bread for sandwich, expensive for the quality. The lunch menu is kind a trap. They say it is cheap but eventually it is expensive for such a quality. Antipasta was not bad. So, go there in very emergency case...
author: Ali E.

description: They initially balked at our request to only have drinks and appetizers, but begrudgingly seated us inside. We had a very good antipasto plate and drinks.  After reading the reviews, I'll go back for the gnocchi.
author: Scott R. D.

description: Eat the gnocchi! It's by far one of the best things on the menu. The staff is really great, and the atmosphere is great. I was at the place a few years ago, and on my more recent trip it seemed a lot bigger then I remembered. Most of the items on the menu are  great but their homemade pasta is the best, by far! If it's a warm night, try to grab an outside table and a bottle of wine to really enjoy the experience.
author: Melissa G.

description: My two friends and I were strolling through the neighborhood on a chilly New Years Day and were in the mood for some good Italian food.  The hostess was cute and chatty in an authentic Italian accent (I think).  I took her recommendation and ordered her favorite dish, I forget the name but it had peas and proscuitto-VERY bland and the proscuitto had an odd flavor to it.  My one friend ordered a chicken and fettucini dish and that was HORRIBLE!  The chicken had a fishy flavor!!  The other friend had a decent calzone that we all shared.  The portions are quite small for an Italian restaurant.   $105 for the three of us, including a drink a piece.  Nice atmosphere but food ordered was very disappointing.
author: Ray S.

description: Had the gnocchi, excellent. The server was quick and on point, the food took barely any time to come out of the kitchen. It's a good place to take visiting friends and relatives. The food isn't heavy enough to put you in a food coma, but filling all the same.
author: Gabriela O.

description: My friend and I were here yesterday. We were in north beach to do a little bar hopping across Little Italy. We chose this place as our first location due to it having outside seating. We were sat quickly and placed an order for 2 beers. We received them then another waiter came over and asked us for our order. We said we were just having a beer then leaving. He left and returned a few minutes later saying there was a mixup and we were not allowed to sit outside without eating any food. He offered us a seat inside or to leave the restaurant. We were halfway through our beer, no line at the restaurant and PLENTY of seating available. What it boiled down to is we were not spending enough money in a restaurant that was less than 1/4 full. Pretty lame and extremely rude I must say.
author: Corey B.

description:
During such tough economic times you would think a restaurant would treat their regular customers well. But this is not the case at Pinocchio. 

After spending over $70 on food I received tiny portions and a screwed up order. I spoke with the manager, Maria to complain. Intially, she implied it was my own fault and then reluctantly agreed to send me a gift certificate for $25.  Several weeks passed and I got no certificate - so I called to find out what happened. She dodged my calls and never called me back. To my surprise I received something in the mail this morning from Pinocchio. Delighted my certificate had finally arrived, imagine the surpirse when I see it was for only $10. 

If you want rude service, managers who lie, overpriced small portions than this is the restaurant for you! And the food is mediocre.
author: sap m.

description: The family and i came here hungry on a day walking around china town. We knew it would be good when they had people outside the place trying to entice you inside (that's how it works in NYC). Mom got the lemon chicken, which was really delicious.what can i say?  im a sucker for capers. I got the ravioli. They sound plain but theyre cooked perfectly, the stuffing is just...magical. We come here whenever there's a special occasion to celebrate. Oh, and you MUST try the bruschetta(?) appetizer, i swear it might've even been better than the pasta, so packed with flavor! Anyone complaining about Michele the silver fox (the hilarious waiter) needs to leave because you obviously haven't met many italian men. They're loud, outgoing, flirty, and fun! The moms loved him, he's so nice and made us all laugh on several occasions. He treats you like family by making you feel comfortable. Obviously some people are too uptight and need to learn let loose and have fun. When we left, he hugged us all and kissed our cheeks the italian way, waved and said, "ciao bella!" Don't walk past this place, go inside, i tell you!
author: Brooke S.

description: I have wanted to eat here as we usually go to Calzones across the street and always walk by this place.   It has  a nice atmosphere. In the begining I was leaning for a 5 star rating.   THEN the bread comes and it was so -  so and kinda hard.  I had to ask the server for a soda refil and was informed NO REFILLS!!  If you are a soda drinker or addict then you understand.  I have no problem with the. $30 steak,  the $6 soup and $6 bottle water but a fountain soda with no refil?   Is this 1975??  Anyways I ask for a manager (principal-not cause I'm cheap) and find out my server "Renzo" is the manager. I informed him it's my first time here and I eat out every meal and he is really upsetting me.  Don't ruin my expierence over a 5 cent refil especially if you are the manager.  He says in a school teacher voice "RULES ARE RULES".   I was so upset I wanted to leave.  Then the meals arrive.   Rib eye was over cooked and the pasta was flavorless.  Renzo could tell he was getting NO TIP and when he brings the bills says Im sorry i took the soda's and refills off the bill.  Of course then I had to tip him but didnt want too.  Bottom line there are tons of restuarants on Colombus Street.  If you must eat here demand a free refill first.  Us soda drinkers need to stick together
author: Tony K.

description: My ex and I came here one Saturday evening a few years back to enjoy a nice Italian dinner. We didn't intend to eat here but after our first choice had too long of a wait, we kept walking and found this place. The service was excellent, the staff was very warm and were not baffled by my questions. Our table was in a crappy location but meh, it didn't effect our dinner too much. I had a seafood risotto and I can't even remember what my ex ordered. But, our food was delicious. Prices aren't terrible either.
author: Jenna L.

description: Excellent service, excellent food. Our server was charming, the wine was great and we would have stayed all day if it hadn't been a work lunch. Try the lasagne!
author: Carolyn P.

description:
I'm easy to please when it comes to dining, and I waited tables for five years, so I'm super understanding of the plight of servers. 

That being said, this place was really disappointing--both the food and the service. My wife and I chose this on a whim (without consulting Yelp! ... oops) after we found that Sotto Mare is closed Sundays.

We ordered two glasses of wine and the bruschetta. The wine was ok, the bruschetta never came. We already had our main course when we told the server (and also told him no worries), he shrugged it off and didn't even apologize. Not that we needed or wanted one, but at least some acknowledgment would have been nice.

My wife got the Pescatore, and for the the first time in her life, she sent a dish back to the kitchen. I tried it, and not only did it taste bad, but the sauce was watery and the seafood was all cooked poorly. When we politely asked the server to take it back, he just grabbed it off the table and didn't even ask if she would like anything else to eat, nor did he seem to care that she was not satisfied with her dish.

I was feeling simple and ordered the fettucini alfredo with chicken. It was ok. Not great. Not terrible. Hard to mess up that dish. 

After the meal, the server did not even acknowledge any of the missteps of the meal. He brought us our check and ran off. Luckily, we were eager to get out of there.

Again, we are not picky diners. We are not demanding. We even laughed this experience off and were not really mad. We left and went right next door to Caffe Puccini and had a wonderful meal with good service with a much smaller tab.

If you are in North Beach, don't eat at Trattoria Pinocchio. There are much better places to eat and have a nice dining experience.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Quaint place in North Beach.  Friendly and funny staff; especially manager Enzo.  Went here twice for dinner while on vacation in San Francisco.  Had the Fettuccine with Salmon the first night; it was amazing!  The second night I had the Chicken Parmigiana which was also delicious.   

Highly recommended for everyone!  I'm definitely returning next time I'm in San Francisco
author: Anthony W.

description: I've eaten here a couple times and the food was pretty yummy.  I'm not usually one to go out and order expensive pasta that I could have made on my own for way less...but I dont mind doing that here every once in a while :)
author: Robin L.

description: This restaurant is brilliant!  My wife and I have eaten here several times in the last year, for both lunch and dinner, and everything was excellent each time.  My wife gets seafood and said it was always excellent.  For carnivores, I especially recommend the steaks.  The manager is very particular about where and how the animals were raised, and the quality is consistently outstanding.  And I order my steaks extremely rare (aka "blue", "black and blue", "seared"), which can only be done with quality meat.  All the apps we've had have been great too.  The bar pours good cocktails, and you can taste the vodka in your vodka-and-tonic.  And Manager/Waiter Michele is "Mr. Personality".  I'm always happy to dine here.
author: David B.

description: I had heard of this place by a recommendation from a friend who is usually pretty dead on about restaurants, and I'm happy to say I agree with her assessment. From the moment I saw the "gnocchi, fresh daily" on the top of the menu I knew that was a no brainer. We ordered the gnocchi with a cream sauce, though I had eater's remorse when I saw the pesto sauce at the table next to me...gnocchi with pesto would have made those doughy little balls even better. The veal saltimboca was soooo tender, and the petrale was fresh (both were served with grilled veggies and potatoes which were seasoned to perfection).  The downside is that this place is long and narrow, so maybe not the best for groups though our party of 5 fit comfortably.
author: Kelly N.

description:
"Let's see if this works, otherwise you'll be doing the dishes."

- our waiter to me, as I handed him my credit card.

For background, my girlfriend and I are in our early 20s, and we probably look younger.  Our check was $35- a satisfying brunch, but not exactly busting open the piggy bank.

We will never go back there again, and unless you enjoy unjustifiably condescending service, I'd suggest you shouldn't either.
author: Andrew S.

description: A pleasant oasis off of Columbus. If you are walking North Beech and want to get out of the noise and bustle then stop in here for a drink and relax.
author: Chris E.

description: We visited this place with a party of 7. Excellent service; and the manager/owner was a riot. Very sociable (sang operas) but knew when to leave us alone. The food was very good. Fresh, but not too heavy (which can be a common problem in Italian places). I had the sausage ravioli and it was excellent. The ravioli is made fresh and from scratch. The wine selection is limited. Overall, decent place for a small gathering.
author: Premal S.

description: Always get the same thing when I come here - Linguine with clams (vongole).  Favorite Italian place to get this dish.  I've had the pizza margherita and brunch here, been happy with each visit.
author: Gary D.

description: Very sweet service, authentic, and do-able.  The alfredo sauce had a little too much nutmeg, and the vodka penne could've been a little more creamy/tomato-y.  BUT, worth the cost and the people watching was lovely.  Would NOT cringe if a visiting friend dragged me there. For sure.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
The menu reads: "A North Beach Tale of Culinary Delight"

Someone's nose just got a little longer.

Exhausted and having abandoned another restaurant that was taking over 20 minutes to take our order (damn forgot to write the name, otherwise I'd 1 star that place), my brother and I were a bit on the testy side. Not to mention we had just gotten into a little sibling spat. Anyway, we were in search of some place that had 1) fresh pasta and 2) vegetarian options. After the horrifying experience at the first restaurant, I just wanted to sit down outside, order, and get some food in my belly. 

They advertise their fettuccine, gnocchi, lasagna, risotto, and ravioli as made fresh daily. I had the Fettuccine Pollo Alfredo, with fettuccine made fresh daily, sauteed chicken, and vegetables in an alfredo cream sauce. Blah, blah, blah. The fettuccine did not seem fresh to me and was far too chewy to be al dente. Chicken was tough. Sauce was a little thin and bland (think: more Parmesan than parmiggiano reggiano). The brother had the gnocchi in gorgonzola cream sauce. The gnocchi were actually quite good, light and pillowy in texture, melting in your mouth against the intense backdrop of pungent gorgonzola. However, gnocchi is one of those dishes that I find very hard to finish, as did my brother. It's always so heavy, especially with the very large gnocchi that Pinocchio makes. The creaminess and sharpness of the gorgonzola was overbearing by the end, and I wished that we had ordered some vegetables to balance it out. 

As far as the service, we came in for a very early dinner and the place was far from busy. While the perky hostess and the cute Italian-accented server were very friendly, everything was sooooooo slow. Maybe it's a cultural thing? I don't know, I very rarely eat in North Beach and am not a major Italian restaurant fan to begin with. It wasn't as bad as Evil Italian Restuarant #1, but I think that it could've been a little more attentive. Obviously, this is a relatively cheap (each of our entrees was $14.95) Italian place so expectations should be adjusted accordingly (though you really should be able to get tastiness at any price range!). As I told my nonplussed brother, "What can you expect from a restaurant that has Costco olive oil and balsamic vinegar sitting out on every single table all day and everyday?"

Don't even try to fudge your way out of that one, Pinocchio.
author: Steph P.

description: Great food but be weary of your cash/cards! On several occasions the waiters here have broken themselves off to as much tip/charge as they want. All I gotta say is keep your reciept!!
author: Eugene G.

description: Short, and succinct review here. We had pasta here (some Angel Hair and regular Spaghetti). I was a little skeptical at first, because they had a Italian guy outside trying to get people to enter the restaurant. It kind of reeked of desperation (or a tourist trap), but after eating there, I had to say, the food was quite unexpectedly tasty. Well cooked, served hot and well-portioned. Service was excellent and well mannered.
author: Seymour L.

description: This was a very good place to have a casual, but nice dinner with friends along with the kids.  Eight of us in total and we were the biggest party in the restaurant.  It was pretty darn busy for a Sunday night, so i suggest you make a reservation so you don't get boxed out.  The restaurant sits on a flatiron shaped corner, so the seating is somewhat compromised.  Plenty of outside seats if you don't mind eating under the french fry heaters.  The lasagna was well made and tasty with nice al dente noodles.  Could have used a little more internal cheese, but the suace wis nicely done.  The grilled salmon was very nicely prepared and served with roasted potatoes and garlic cloves that were nice together.  The gnocchi was ordered by two people in our party - one as listed on the menu in sort of an alfredo-style sauce.  The other (my daughter)  "off-the-menu" in a pesto sauce.  The gnocchi themselves were well-made.  Very fluffy and light.  And both sauces were good. The tortellini with mushroom sauce was also good and my spaghetti bolognese was good enough to come back for.  My one regret:  I talked my wife into ordering the insalada mista instead of the Caesar and three others in our party ordered the Caesar.  Bottom line?  Shoulda listened to my wife and ordered her the Caesar.  Many restaurants make weak Caesars.  This place makes a VERY GOOD Caesar.  Great flavor and finished with large shavings of Parmesan cheese on top.  Lucky for me my friends shared theirs with my wife.  Whew.  No doubt we will be coming back here.  And this time I will get her the Caesar.
author: Lewis C.

description: Wow,  came here on a saturday night and the place was busy with a nice vibe.  Atmosphere was perfect.  The ossabuco with veal shank had some nice bone marrow and flavor.  The cioppino was very good and the flavor was spot on,  only wish it had some fish but the shellfish portions were generous.  The gnocci was very good.  And a nice cup of americano to complete the evening.  The waiter was very attentive and made the evening enjoyable.
author: g s.

description:
on top of feeling rushed the entire time we were scorned at, given dirty looks, and even questioned about our place of origin. now, don't get me wrong, this place had a fantastic chef. everyone loved their food. but our server was awful and down right nasty to us.

everything started normally - drinks, menus, etc. when we ordered, two of the people ordered salads, no big deal. but apparently it was to our waiter. both women who ordered salads were asked, in a very rude tone, "is that all?" not "can i offer you a bowl of soup with that?" or "can i get you anything else?" just a simple question that implied his shock at their lack of ordering more than a salad.

our food popped in front of us in less than 12 minutes. impressive, and almost redeeming of the rude attitude served with it. until he attempted to gather our plates before we were done. at this point we had all commented on the pace of our service and the lack of amiability, and were slowly taking pennies off of his tip.

my plate was taken at the same time our check was dropped off. minus $0.50.

i wanted coffee. i received a set of rolling eyes with my cup of joe. minus another $0.75.

i think it's important to note that at no point while we were there was there a line out the door, a rush for tables, or even a full restaurant. it's not like he was under pressure to get the next table in the door.

two of us went to the bathroom to return to a table for 4 with only 3 chairs. the bastard took the 4th chair before we were even done! minus a whopping $1.00.

then came the worst part. the part that anybody who's worked in the service industry knows is a sin. he took the bill, looked at the tip, and then looked at the two of us who'd split the bill on our cards and glared at us. of course we hadn't tipped him perfectly, he practically rushed us out the door from the moment we arrived and treated us like we were children.

i went to the bar and asked to speak with the manager. i was given the owner. we spoke, he said "he's fired!" really loud, with a jolly laugh. (uh huh, sure buddy.) then he apologized and told me that "the best way to communicate dissatisfaction with a server is to not tip him." too late - he didn't even offer to refund us our tip and there was no doubt in my mind that this guy wasn't even going to know i spoke to his boss. until right when i was about to finish my complaint.

our server walked behind the owner while i standing there and said, to my face, "so now you're talking about me to him, huh?" you're damned right mister! i was appalled at the balls this man had. really? you're going to confront me, the reason your job exists, in front of your f'ing boss?! who are you?

and then finally, for the icing on the cake (which we didn't even get offered): as we were gathering our things he walks up to our table, one last time, shoots us a nasty look and asks "where are you from, anyway?" as if OUR attitudes were unacceptable.
author: Danielle S.

description: Why are you so mean to me, Italian Waiter??
author: Jill C.

description: Everything was pretty good.  Caprese salad is always tricky because it's hard to get good tomatoes, and this was no exception  (should have doused it in balsamic vinegar), but it was ok.  Carbonara was very good, very rich.  Crab/spaghetti was very good.  Polenta was odd, a runny consistency, but good.
author: Magic M.

description: We brought our kids and they treated them like kings. Its was a very warm and inviting experience. The service was phenomenal. The pasta was very good. The dessert was great. it is worth a trip to this restaurant in North Beach.
author: Andrea F.

description: Great service. Great food. Recommend the gnocchi or chicken parm.
author: Jacob C.

description:
I've had the pleasure of dining here several times and everything about this place is great. I'm a native of the City and I've been eating at North Beach Italian places since the early sixties. Everything from the original location of the US restaurant to Fior D'Italia. I've been to all of them. I'm fussy about restaurants. One bad meal and i'm gone never to return from any place that I don't have a personal history of good meals from.  Even a proven restaurant will lose it's place in my rotation with a couple of bad meals or service. There are too many good places to eat in this town to put up with mediore food and/or service. 
Having hopefully established at least some local knowledge, I wanted to write that this place is the real deal. Gio, the owner is from Italy and he knows the way it should be. He and his wife Maria are great hosts who know how to deliver great food, service, and atmosphere. Great wine list, incredible pasta dishes, fair prices served up in an elegant, yet comfortable space. I've never been disapointed, never left feeling less than satisfied with the whole experience. It's a family owned place, but a family of professionals. Perfect.  Go there, you won't regret it.
