North beach is full of Italian food places, but some are simply tourist traps, or worse, living off a reputation that is no longer deserved. Not Piniocchio.
author: Martin C.

description:
Yes I am a big fan of this place.

If you want to try out some authentic Italian food, this is the place!!

I love the ambience of this place, the service is exceptional, prices very reasonable for the city and the food is one of the most authentic Italian ever!!!
author: Hetal P.

description:
I stopped here for lunch one Monday afternoon. The menu specializing in homemade pasta looked appealing and there were plenty of vegetarian dishes so I was very optimistic,

They kept trying to seat me in the front of the restaurant by the door even though it was cold. I politely kept trying to take a small table in the back and got there with a bit of awkward insistence  Then the maitre de started it all up again trying to get me to move to the front.

The service was good and the food came quickly. But over all I was 
pretty disappointed. I ordered the spinach ravioli and it was bland and drowning in tomato sauce. The bread was pretty sub par. It cost about 19.30 for a average size plate of ravioli that wasn't that great. Add on a tip and that's about 25.00. Ouch. 

Won't be back
author: Gem J.

description: Can't tell you how the food is because we walked out before we ordered.  As others have mentioned we were hustled in by the gal at the front door.  She walked us past several available tables by the windows and seated us by the bathrooms and loud kitchen.  I walked into the bathroom to wash my hands and it smelled like the men's room at the ballpark in the 7th inning and was dirty.  The menu was very overpriced and didn't match the lower priced menu posted outside by the door.  We were looking for a more family friendly experience and weren't getting it here.  We got up and left.  We went over to Cafe Maria and LOVED it!!!!  Check it out instead !!!
author: Kurt B.

description: Absolutely fantastic dining! A group of friends and I went there after the North Beach Jazz Fest. Who cares if the place is touristy... if they do great Italian food, that's all that really matters! I had the Ravioli Carne (veal) with Sage Butter Sauce. I loved it. We also had a great outdoor table on the non-Columbus side of the street. Amazing food, very friendly service, and great times were had by all!
author: Megan D.

description: My sweetie proposed to me here so I must give it 5 stars for the locale. I had the parpadelle bolgonese. The noodles appeared homemade and the meat sauce was fantastic. I could taste the red wine and it must have been sitting on the stove for hours. The restaurant gave us fruity champagne to celebrate and the tiramisu was light, layered in fluffy cream, soft ladyfingers and rich in amaretto and coffee liqueur. I'll always remember this place. (sigh)
author: Ready To Be S.

description: Nothing special as far as food is concerned.  Good service.  Better food in the neighborhood.  Will not come back.
author: V s.

description: My boyfriend and I ate here last night and everything was superb.  Every member of the staff was friendly and attentive. The spinach salad was so fresh, we wondered if they'd just picked the spinach from the garden. The steak was tender, tasty, and done to perfection, and the pasta melted in our mouths.  The wine was lovely and the latte was delicious. All in all, it was well worth a trip from the peninsula to the city to enjoy this European-like restaurant.  Thanks for a great evening Trattoria Pinocchio!
author: C W.

description: Love the customer service, and Love the atmosphere, but the portion are to small. I payed the same price at franchino and I am super full. Quality for the food would be okay.
author: stephanie n.

description: I love this place! Reasonably priced, authentic Italian food. Great service, better location. I recommend dining outside under the heat lamps on a warm evening. Makes for some good people watching. Also, the gorgonzola gnocci is pretty unbelieveable!
author: Christine S.

description: Found this place by accident after trying to find parking for half an hour. The tables were too close together for my liking, but the atmosphere was good. Our waiter kept trying to look down my shirt, but he visited our table often and comped the appetizer we ordered. The appetizer, the calamari, was really tasty. I had the salmone for my main course and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of my meal. I would come back here if only for the salmone. The quality of the service is chancy.
author: Amanda R.

description:
I am not liberal with one-star ratings - this is my first.  But if I had the option, I would give this place zero.  

The service we received was bad to the point of farce.  I showed up with my parents, as we were unfortunately in the position of  wandering around this cartoon of a neighborhood looking for a place to eat on a Tuesday night - they were visiting from out of state and had found a good deal (by SF standards) at a nearby hotel.  We were shown our seats at Pinocchio's and it went downhill from there.  Overall, the server seemed annoyed to have to wait on us; he was snide when we asked about dishes, did not bring bread to our table until I asked for it, and when it did come it was hard and low quality.  We were waiting a while for our entrees, so I thought we might be able to choke it down in the meantime if we had some good olive oil.  So I craned my neck, waiting for so much as a glance from the waiter, who was hanging around the bar.  
.... Eventually I asked a guy who was bussing tables about the olive oil.  The waiter then showed up to impatiently point at the vinegar-and-oil combo on the table.  Wha?  Seriously?
 
Having read Emily R.'s review (see below), I sense a pattern.  My party had basically the same demographics.  I wonder if she, her friend, and their mothers ordered wine.  We did not, and that was my only hypothesis as to why our server was so apathetic and disrespectful.  Honestly, as some one who was hosting my parents, I left this awful restaurant embarrassed and furious.

The food was (as has already been said) bland and not at all unique; you'd do better at Trader Joe's.

You know the not-quite-40 year old single business guys who don't have any taste and spend their weekends putting on too much cologne and blowing large wads of cash at pathetic clubs downtown? The ones who can't help but fail in their bids to impress and who you have to imagine go home drunk, alone, and violently frustrated?  My hypothesis is that this place gets by on their ilk.  A couple of men's men who roughly fit that bill were entertaining what seemed to be business associates from out of town at the table behind mine.  Their server was DOTING on them shamelessly.  Lots of embellished stories about the food they were being served, the wine, etc. - laying it on good and thick like you would for a group of starry-eyed, gullible, ignorant tourists.  And I'm pretty sure they had some real olive oil on their table.
author: Josh C.

description:
Confused by all the restaurants in North Beach, my friends and I scoured for low prices with long lines in deciding where to eat. Thankfully, we stumbled upon Trattoria Pinocchio! At first, the prices seemed a little much, but the hostess convinced us to give it a try and I'm glad she did.

I ordered the Lasagna Pinocchio and can easily say I've never had better lasagna. The pasta is made fresh every day, so it was very tender, yet not mushy. The veal sauce was perfect. The tomato flavor was very light and perfect, not piled on the cover the taste of the pasta.

Entrees are about 15-20 each, but expect to leave satisfied. They also have a lunch special menu with soup, salad and sandwich options for 10-15.
author: Richard C.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday evening with two co-workers during a medical conference.  Surprisingly, it wasn pretty vacant.  I was expecting an amazing experience as I read great reviews in magazines and on yelp. Here is my feedback:
Service: very great, responsive.  My co-worker drinks a lot of water and they made the best effort to re-fill his glass.  
Ambience: average.  We had a table by the window which became distracting with the pedestrians and cars.  Our table was next to the bar.
Food: average.  My co-worker and I ordered the spaghetti with bolegnese sauce.  We both thought it was ok.  We also ordered the calamari and bruschetta.  They both were average.  The tiramisu, on the otherhand, was well made.  I would recommend ordering this!
Price: Two glasses of wine, bruschetta, spaghetti with bolognese and tiramisu = $52.00.
Overall: Average Italian experience.  If I was to return, I will definitely order something different.  There were other items on the menu that sounded great, but I was just in the mood for some spaghetti with bolognese sauce.
author: T P.

description: Kind of touristy, but the food wasn't bad. Large portions and quick service. But damn! they don't have Anchor Steam on tap! Ok, I'm partial to Anchor but we are in SF afterall, the home of the steam!
author: Peter S.

description: My girlfriend and I wanted to have happy hour in north beach (for a change of scenery) and planned to head to calzones when, lo and behold, I spotted this place, which is basically across the street. We decided to come here instead and didn't regret our decision. We were intitally lured inside by happy hour specials (buy one get one wine!) which I can't pass up - my parents are from the subcontinent after all. Also, they had a dinner special (soup or salad and pasta for $14). The food was good and the price was okay. All in all, we still ended up spending about $40 each which isn't bad but not the best deal either. One thing though - they were playing carappy Italian music super loud which sucked - hence the 4 instead of 5 stars.
author: Sadia J.

description: Was in the city and got a tad hungry so we came across Trttoria Pinocchio and decided to partake of the food.  The restaurant is clean and decorated with long nosed marionettes.  Ordered the minestrone and the Pollo alla Griglia which is a Italian Panini with grilled chicken, tomatoes and a balsamic vinaigrette.  The minestrone was piping hot which was good because it was really cold out but didn't really do it for me.  The panini was tasty and fills you up without making you feel full.  Our waiter was okay but he never came back after he brought us our meal.  Ran out of water early and went the whole meal without getting a refill.  All in all, not a bad experience for the price.
author: Ken L.

description: I went here for a business dinner with 10 people from my company.  Overall, the meal was good, but it was not terrifically exciting.  It's what I'd describe as typical North Beach Italian cuisine.  The wine list was reasonably priced.
author: Will T.

description: This is my 2nd and definitely not the last visit in  Trattoria Pinocchio. They say you dont get impressed on your 2nd visit, but we were.  Not only the food is excellent but the service is superb! Dining here reminded me so much of my visits to Italy...good Antipasti & great pasta. Michele added the touch of Italian hospitality  & fun (of course the Italian way) that nobody can beat. I asked him why their food is so good.  He answered its Amore!!! And I believe him.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Can't say enough about this place! Everything was perfect- from the host to the attentive wait help! Our waiter Michele made the night! He has to be by far one of the best waiter's I have ever had. Thank you Michele for the laughs and your wonderful service! 

Aloha,
~Josh
author: Josh A.

description:
When I purchased tickets for Beach Blanket Babylon, I found this restaurant on the area map on the BBB website. I chose it because it is close to both BBB and the North Beach Garage.

I had a very flavorful lemon chicken, and my companion had veal parmigiana. EXCELLENT! Our waiter, Michele (pronounced MEE-kuh-lay) was attentive and fun. The atmosphere was pleasant as well. My only complaint is that the music was too loud, and I suspect that was because we were sitting adjacent to the bar where the speakers are. As we walked through the restaurant to use the ladies' room, we noticed that music wasn't as loud away from the bar area. Overall, this is an excellent place and I wouldn't hesitate to return. It's a little more upscale than some of the cafes in the neighborhood, but still very reasonably priced. You can see their menu online.
author: Judith S.

description:
all the dishes here have wonderful flavors and the people are very friendly 
: its hard choosing which resturant to go to when you are in the north beach neighborhood 
this is a must try
author: Isabella T.

description: My wife and I, accompanied by our two youngest (age 11 and 13) took a fantastic lunch here on Wednesday, February 22nd.  Perhaps it was the fluent Italian spoken by the gracious hostess and respectfully attentive waiter.  Or it could have been the robustly genial owner (who introduced himself in an exuberantly Italian manner, and took great interest in ensuring we had a great dining experience).  It could also have been the food- ahh, the FOOD!  No doubt, the service was also a highlight- I've never before tipped 30%!  Then again, we've never before been spoiled so thoroughly!  My glass never approached 1/3 empty, and I don't even know when or how the glass kept mysteriously refilling by our unobtrusively attentive server.  Each need was anticipated, and my family was delighted by the atmosphere, the aromas, and the FOOD!  Did I mention how great the pasta was- I mean REAL Italian, the way it is in Italy, Italian.  We hope to go back soon, only later in the evening, and without the children in tow.  Highly recommended!
author: Mitch F.

description: I am surprised by the ratings for this place. I will return. My experience was pleasant and included good food and service. Sitting outside is fun and warm under the heat lamps and makes for great people watching. We guessed where the tourists were visiting from. The wine by the glass list is disappointing and I had to work later on so no bottle of wine for us. A friend and I split the spinach salad. It comes with a tremendous amount of soft Gorgonzola and a zingy dressing. The cheese alone seemed almost like another appetizer and we enjoyed it with some bread. We split the linguini and seafood entree and had plenty of shellfish and fresh pasta to share. We skipped dessert but did have a cappuccino. This is a place where you can smoke outside and have a coffee when you are finished with dinner.
author: erin k.

description: We ventured over to Trattoria Pinocchio around 9:30pm on Saturday night and I'm glad we did. We were all in need of some carbs, and this was the place to go! I had the gnocchi with tomato sauce and smoked mozzarella and it was dreamy. Our waiter was really great and the hostess was very fashionable! I loved her blouse. Anyway, the food was delish, and the restaurant is situated on a corner, so it's a great place to people watch.
author: Tatiana J.

description:
Went here with the parents last weekend. (President's weekend so tourists out numbered locals 5-1) Walked in around 7:45 on Saturday night. Hostess told us a 10 minute wait. We ended up waiting about 25 minutes, but I've been a hostess, I know how it goes. No harm no foul. 

As soon as we sat down we were given water bread and our drink order taken. My Mom ordered a wine she hadn't heard of but the waiter (hot Italian straight off the boat) had suggested a full bodied Cab. Well Mom didn't like it, she said it was fine when asked, but after the waiter noticed she hadn't drunk any he brought a new glass of wine on his own. Glass of wine #2 a hit! A very good sign of a very good waiter. 

Our bruschetta came shortly after we ordered it and it was amazing I'm a self proclaimed bruschetta connoisseur, and it was almost perfection. Then out of nowhere our waiter brought a complimentary insalata caprese without any real explanation, just that it was on the house. In my head I thought this was because said hot Italian waiter was preparing to ask for my hand in marriage and was preparing my parents for the question...Anyhow the gesture was much appreciated. Our main courses came. Pops had the lasagna Francesco, second only to Grandma's. Mom had the zuppa del minestrone, best I've had in my young life. I had the Penne Vodka, which had bacon in it...I've experienced this before in some Vodka sauces but normally it says that on the menu.  I moved around the bacon pieces and the penne ended up being very good. Peroni on tap, YAY!!

Great old school/old world service and food. I will defiantly be back.
author: Anna F.

description: The one star rating is based entirely on a beverage. I stopped in for a spicy bloody mary and was given probably the worst beverage imaginable. The bartender poured low grade vodka in a glass and then topped it with Daily's Original Bloody Mary Mix. YUCK. Also, his lack of garnishment (which is one of the main reasons I enjoy a bloody) made this drink unbearable. This might honestly be the very first time I have paid $10 for a beverage and then refused to drink it. I will NOT be returning!
author: Sarah E.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here early on New Year's Eve for a nice pre-firework dinner.  We ordered two entrees and some wine.  The eggplant parmesan was really great, but the gnocci that we had was flavorless.  

We gently spoke to the waiter and asked if it would be possible to exchange the gnocci for another entree.  The chef (and we later found out also the owner) came to speak with us.  He said that he had the best gnocci in the city and that it was supposed to be bland.  I said that while I understand that the gnocci itself has a mild flavor, the sauce is generally quite flavorful.  He insisted that his was (it wasn't) and began to berate us right there in the sidewalk in front of the cafe!  He insisted that his gnocci was the way it was supposed to be, and that we had no idea what good gnocci is.  Having recently returned from Italy (and having enjoyed a lot of great Italian food) I was really put off.

The waiter was apologetic, but the chef was a real jerk.  We ate only two pieces of gnocci from the plate and not only would he not exchange the bad entree, he made us pay for it!  Definitely not going back.
author: Kristin M.

description:
Okay, so I'm giving this restaurant two stars for only one reason. The red-haired host is to blame. I have never met someone that is so rude; I usually let people slide on rudeness for the most part because I am passive, but she was just terrible.
First, she put us at a small table when there was five of us. She said there was no other tables in the restaurant (except the four open ones I saw in the back five minute later on my way to the bathroom). We said we would wait. My mother-in-law was freezing and wanted to move. We said we were willing to wait. She responded by saying it wasn't cold in the restaurant and we were lucky to even be getting a table. Not good business manners in my opinion. Then my mother-in-law that the restaurant felt cold to her and she wanted to move regardless. The host then rolled her eyes, turn and walked away. To add to the kicker as she was walking away she said very loudly "oh Jesus Christ." I think she didn't think we would hear, but we did. So rude. Then she went up to the host stand and complained to a server about us. Small restaurant and this was very obvious. When my mother-in-law got up to talk to her to tell her she was being rude to us, she responded that we were being rude. Does she not understand that we are the customers and she needs to be accommodating. I'm not saying that moving us wasn't going to be a little bit of a hassel, but I mean come on.
The server on the other hand was a doll. I can't remember his name. I think he said he has worked there three years. He apologized for her. His service was fantastic. Very sweet and attentive. The food was good as well. Everyone was satisfied with their meals. And the dessert is some of the best i've tasted. We got the cannoli and the mousse. The server really saved our experience and made it more enjoyable. However, the host might have been enough for us to never go back.
author: Denise C.

description:
Started with a spinach salad that had a citrus vinaigrette and orange slices around the side.  It was not overdressed and had a nice flavor.  Main course was veal cutlet and a side of penne pasta.  The veal was well cooked and not greasy as it can sometimes be when pan-fried.  The penne had a light red sauce and was cooked, as it should be, al dente.  Dessert was a rum soaked cake that was just OK as the cake tasted a bit stale.

Although the meal rated 3.5 stars, the service, at least from the waiter was about a 1.  If it was not for the busboys, I do not know if I would have ever received my food.  The couple at the table next to me sat for about 10 minutes with no service and finally got up and left.  The couple that was next seated at the table did not receive their salad until after their main course arrived.  

The waiter overdid the Italian shtick and thought that he was far funnier than he was.  As previously stated, the busboys really hustled with the water, bread and meals and were very responsive to the requests of the various tables.

Took advantage of a nice evening and ate outdoors so am unable to comment on the interior of the restaurant.  

I would return for the food, but hopefully with a different waiter.
author: Mo M.

description: This place was deliciousss. The pasta anyways... Came here with my friends and boyfriend. Sat out on the patio. I ordered the lunch special. You get pasta with either soup/salad. I got the pasta al americina? Don't know if that's spelled right, but it was SOO GOOD!!! Penne, with Peppers, Onions, and something else, but my god it was delicious. So was my boyfriends lasagna! It was one of the best lasagnas I've had in a long time. Downfall, no refills on drinks? w...t....f so jewish (no offense). but the food and service was awesome.
author: Steven T.

description: Great place. Delicious food. Perfect carpaccio and pasta. Comfortable atmosphere.  I'll definitely go back!
author: Julie A.

description: YUM! My friends and I stopped here for lunch after walking around for hours. We were hungry, and this place sounded great. We were not disappointed! I had the veggie lasagna...and holy God, it was amazing! I couldn't even finish the piece, it was so big! And the waiter was awesome. Funny, helpful, and most of all, cute! A big plus in my book.
author: Lindsay R.

description:
A friend was visiting so of course I thought to bring her to north beach for dinner. We stopped in here because it was a place I hadn't been to, and we were both very happy with our meals. 

I got eggplant parm, which was very good ...and also came with some veggies and potatoes
She got the grilled salmon that also came with veggies and potatoes (you could have gotten pasta if you wanted)
We also got some bread - nothing special, but it was something

I'd go back :)
author: Caitlin B.

description: I can't speak for the actual dinner menu items, as all I ordered were the marinated olives (which were great). However, I had a really great drink: Vodka, Espresso and Kahlua. I forget the name but its obviously a martini concoction. They gave my dog a bowl of water as I drank outside at one of their heater friendly tables. Obviously a touristy place, but since I live down the street had to give it a try...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Me and a few of my friends came in here for some yummy pizza and drinks. We sat down and ordered a round and a margherita pizza. The waiter actually came BACK to our table to ask us to order more because it "cost him more for us to sit there than he would make." WHAT? As an ex-slave to the restuarant business, i was appalled. He then did not come back to our table the rest of the night and after we asked the bus boy for our bill, he rudely dumped it on our table and walked away. I will never be coming back to this place, we complained to the owner. Ive had some bitchy waiters, but he took the cake.
author: Erin F.

description: OK customer service but excellent Italian Food.  My friend Merri and I checked this out after Beach Blanket Babylon, a perfect place to dine before or after the show.  North Beach is always lively and opened late for the late eaters.
author: Ben L.

description: The polenta - not our best choice. The cheese plate - yum! Service excellent. Not a long wait on a Friday night. Nice atmosphere. Clean.
author: Angela H.

description:
I love this place. I was walking by yesterday and decided to go in, pretty much because this adorable Italian man kept telling me I should go in, so finally my friend and I went in.
The food was great as was the service. I think it's a really good place for a large group or  a few people.

Like Stephanie P., I highly recommend the bruschetta--delicious!
author: Nicole R.

description: Blah... Tourist stuff. Their food was tasty enough, but not fresh enough for my freshness nazi ass.
author: Base M.

description:
We first happened upon Trattoria Pinocchio the other evening while looking for someplace to enjoy a coffee drink and a connoli.  The manager was standing outside the front door, and with a welcoming smile and a booming voice with an Italian accent invited us inside.

We each enjoyed a Black Russian Cappucino and a connoli.  The coffee drinks were very, very good, and the connoli was delightful and delicious.  We decided to make dinner. reservations for the following evening.

When we arrived for dinner we decided to eat outside, and our hostess made sure the patio heater over our table was working.  It was a great place to enjoy the last of a great summer day and some people watching.  We order calamari for an appetizer, along with a bottle of red wine, which seemed very reasonably priced.  The calamari came with two sauces, a spicey red sauce as well as a pretty standard tasting tartar sauce.  It was well prepared, lightly breaded and very good.

The bartender had told us the evening before that they make all of their own pasta. I ordered the lobster and crabl ravioli and my wife ordered the veal and porcini ravioli.  My ravioli were delicious and I felt the sauce was perfect, and my portion was just right for me.  My wife thought her ravioli were delicsious, but thought the sauce was a tad too rich when combined with the already pretty rich veal.  She very much enjoyed it though.  For desert we ended up enjoying several more Black Russian Capucino's and an order of cannoli.  The coffee drinks here are just over the top good, and the cannoli was once again very, very good.

Our service was perfect, and there is not much room for improvement.  Our water was kept topped off, and someone showed up just in time to keep our wine glasses full as well.  We were allowed to enjoy a very liesurely pace and linger with our coffee drinks afterwards as we interacted with some of the great staff.  It seems that most of the staff is very much Italian and very passionate about the quality of food that they are serving.

Though there are some other great looking choices for Italian in the North Beach area this place really impressed us and we will visit again when in the San Francisco area.
author: Jeff K.

description: The only reason I gave it a one star is because the waiter was nice.  We were walking around trying to find some Italian Food in Littly Italy.  The owner actually came out of the restaurant and invited us in when we were looking at the menu.  He was going on about how great the food was and he could help us make our budget, it was then we realized he was talking into a bluetooth. He continued to talk into the bluetooth the entire time he was seating us.  They put cold hard bread on the table, no style or taste at all.  Our appetizers were salads and we both had a seafood pasta dinner.  First of all its PASTA so why are the portions so small...for $21.00.  Then the scallops were frozen on the inside.  Waiter took the food away and came back with the food with the scallops gone...they must have picked them out.  We had a cake soaked in Rum for dessert, that the waiter advised against ordering??? Should have listened.  Would never go back, it was awful
author: Kas B.

description: My friends and I were walking around the city on my birthday trying to find a place that could accomodate a group of 8, and this place, though busy, amazingly got us seated right away.  The caveat: we waited ~1 hr for food service! Good thing I drank enough not to notice! The food wasn't memorable though... I would say below average Italian.... I wasn't too impressed...
author: Grace M.

description:
Went here on a whim, had friends in town and stopped on this corner.  I would wait forever for this place to open, their lattes vanilla....AMAZING.  I could sit there all day and sip on those.  

Also we all had a breakfast dish, nice portions, we could have shared and the taste was very good...not the Italian I am used to but the flavors were really nice.
author: Lauren F.

description: We ate at Pinocchio for lunch on one of our buzy days in the city. I fell in love with their veal lasagna! So juicy, with 5 layers of ricotta and amazing bolognese sauce! This place is definitely famous for a homemade pasta. My friends had gnocchi in Gorgonzola sauce and Risotto with pistachios.   I'm looking forward on trying their brunch there soon!
author: Jennifer B.

description: After a long time, I had amazing Italian food in the Bay Area.  We had lunch outside on the patio.  The mushroom appetizer was amazing.  So was the veal lasagna that followed.  I'm definitely going back.
author: John J.

description:
Wohooo.... this restaurant is worth every single $. As said earlier the North Beach area is full of tourists like me... BUT who wants to eat with people from back home and understand their complainings? We walked from the Piers up to Columbus Street to find a nice place to get some rest in between our sightseeing tour. And it was a treat. We had a very good service and delicious food. And the prize? They have special lunch offers so no reason to complain about on what you have to spend to get fresh and very tasty dishes or some good vino!
But the best of all was the service. Our waiter was perfect. He took good care of us. Not even was he very attentive but also very friendly and a real professional recommending the right vine for our menu. Besides that both me an my friend were thrilled by this relaxing atmosphere sitting in the sun, listening to italian music and just enjoying our lunch time.
author: Christel D.

description: Eh... authentic feel - yes. Good location - of course! But the food, I wasn't that impressed with. Tomato sauce with the veggie lasagna & ravioli was kind of sugary & watery... and there weren't a lot of vegetables in either, just a lot of cheese. Also, it tasted a teensy bit bland. I'd try somewhere else in North Beach next time.
author: Anika K.

description: The prices have gone up by two dollars for each item on the online menu.  Their portions are large, but I'm not sure it's worth the price.  The 4 Stagioni Pizza was tasty but wasn't really all that special.  We had a reservation, but they weren't ready for us even though we checked in 20 minutes early.  We ended up freezing outside.  Their heat lamps didn't reach to the other side of our tables.  This place isn't really meant for large groups.  The inside is really small and the bar only seats six people.  The Italian waiter was charming and helpful.
author: Hoa Q.

description: I LOVE this place. The food and the people are so authentic. Not only is this place for a nice romantic evening, its good for larger parties, where you can watch the line cooks make your favorite meal. Try the gnocchi with the spicy tomato sauce.
author: Stefanie H.

description: Yes, it is touristy, but I found the food quite good.  I definitely recommend the eggplant start whatever it was called.
author: Peter O.

description:
As I am sure you already know, Pinnochio is a fine Italian restaurant in the North Beach area of San Francisco. It is surrounded by a bunch of other Italian restaurants that look exactly like it and probably have food that taste quite similar. Oh, and all of the prices for restaurants of Pinnochio's caliber are the same. Don't try looking for cheaper prices. We tried and you won't find them. Pay up, you're in the City!

Food: I had Pinnochio's signature Lasagna with a glass of Barolo red wine. I have been drinking red wine for a few years (just turned 21) with fine dishes including pastas and meats of all kinds but had my first real - and truly great - wine/food experience. The meatsauce of the lasagna perfectly matched the fine taste of the Italian Borolo red wine. So much so, I had a sip with every bite and was absolutely stunned by the flavor combination of these two food/drink items. Thus, I highly recommend this combination. The Lasagna by itself was good, but nothing totally special. It was tasty but did not have anything unique about it. You look at it and you say "Yup, that is lasagna, yay." It's honest, but these days I like to see a little design and special signature touch to a dish when paying such high prices (must be all the Top Chef watching). 

Service: The waiter could have been a BIT more attentive, but seeing that I was with a group of six and we were in our early 20s, the service was good. 

Ambiance/Atmosphere: Busy, crowded, kind of loud, but makes you feel like your in an Italian restaurant. I would not go here for a romantic date - it is too loud, crowded and slightly cramped for that. For some friends, it's good. 

Overall: I would good back if I was in the area and needed a sure-thing, but I am not going to go out of my way to make another visit. It was kind of a "been there once, it was good and now I'm ready to move on" experience.
author: Matt S.

description:
This was our second time here.  This one was better than the first.

Caeser Salad was good.  The spaghetti bolognese was very good.  The bread was a little stale, though.  Good olive oil.

A little pricey, but the food was good.  Service was okay too.  Owner signing Italian songs a plus.  :)
author: Karen B.

description: Now the food here wasn't bad, but I did feel that the service, though good, was a little obnoxious at times. When I first approached the restaurant, the host proceeded to keep reading off every menu item in Italian for us, and once we were seated he hovered behind us most of the meal. Definitely avoid sitting outside during the day when the crowds are thick--we almost had our table bumped multiple times...try the gnocchi
author: Heleena H.

description: I would say that this is a solid choice if you want Italian food. Everybody in a group of 5 agreed that the food was tasty and that they waiter didn't move his hands that much for being Italian ....
author: Javi V.

description: Have always had exceptional service, food, wine and company at this restaurant! Not one complaint. My favorite dish is the pesto pasta and of course my regular glass of chianti. Also love the pizzas.  When the weather is nice my pug and I will sit outside and people watch. The inside has a great decor and ambiance and I have brought many a friend from out of town here to experience a great italian feast. One of the top restaurants I recommend in my neighborhood!
author: Stephanie J.

description: Definitely a tourist-vibe restaurant, as most of the joints in this area of the city are.  I took a chance on it and was content for the most part.  The actual "attention" part of the service was o.k., with routine water refills and bread basket replacements.  Onto the food:  the Calamari I ordered was quite obviously frozen and somewhat undercooked.  The Margarita Pizza was good, entirely what I was expecting.  It had fresh ingredients with a good tasting sauce and a light crust. I was happy with this experience post-calamari.  The cocktails my girlfriend and I had were good, mixed well and tasty.  The rationale for the 3 Star Rating is that the wait for a 12" pizza was double what you would expect, and there was a congregation of 15-20 flies in the middle of the restaurant.  Unless there is  a special reason for it, I most likely won't eat here again.
author: TJ D.

description: My first experience of gnocchi and still my best. I'm really surprised more people haven't enjoyed this restaurant, especially with all the variety on the menu. I would love to come back and try more. Even the location is great, right in the heart of North Beach, a view of Cafe Trieste across Columbus. I'm worried about straggling into a bad Italian place in North Beach, mostly because all the restaurants stay in the same mid-high price range, so, fearing spending too much on an underpar meal, I researched before going out and I was not disappointed. And I really didn't find it touristy at all, not like at least half a dozen other places I've passed on Columbus. If you can, sit out on the sidewalk to escape the noise inside. Much more peaceful and relaxing.
author: Kimberly C.

description: I went here for dinner last night with a date.  The food was nothing special and somewhat pricey but it's obvious that when you walk in there you are paying for a nice atmosphere and to be "seen" eating in little Italy, it is a total tourist trap.  It's a physically clean looking restaurant and fits in well on that corner.  Lots of windows and nice lighting.  I was a little surprised that the hostess was dressed so casually, I was hesitant to ask her for a table because I didn't know if she was just some random girl standing there, but she was very nice and polite and got us a good table.  More about the food:  my date was not impressed with the shrimp pasta dish he had at all and he felt like we were rushed (but that's because I was starving and scarfing down my ceasar salad and spinach ravioli), which I quite liked by the way.  He needed tobasco sauce in order to eat the shrimp because they were apparently flavorless, but the pasta part was good.  I just didn't feel like a lot of "love" went into the food.  Our waiter was nice.  The shrimp pasta, ceasar, and spinach ravioli with 2 peroni's came out to $68 + 12 tip so 80$ total.  Great for tourists!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Although this is the only place I could find to sit outside on a Sunday afternoon, I was a little disappointed. The wine was good, the gnocchi was average, and the service was VERY slow. I waited for about 20 mins to get my wine and then another 25 to get my check...and I was dining alone! For the price of food, I was expecting better service!!
author: Lindsay C.

description:
So we're in North Beach, we were hungry but not enough for a full meal, and it was five o'clock somewhere in the world which means I'm getting a beer.  Figured it was a nice day, sit outside and people watch while getting drunk and stuffing our faces.  We ordered the antipasta platter which was the perfect amount of cured meats, cheeses, veggies, bruschetta, etc.  A couple beers later, a satiated belly and we were off.  
All in all, this place is a reasonable little stop off for a quick bite and a drink.  One could say the service was a tad slow but my beer was never empty and the bread basket always full, so I'm not going to.
author: Mike F.

description: Cute inside and the service was quick, but the food was absolutely mediocre. I didn't expect much from a touristy north beach place but this was below expectations. If you really want trashy amercianized italian food smothered in cream and cheese go to Calzone's or Cafe Delucchi where it's actually good.
author: Veena S.

description:
wow. the gnocci was melt in your mouth amazing. the rest of the food was excellent.  they had one of my fave old vine zins on the menu, so one star is just for how incredible that bottle was. i'd say pinocchio is above-and-beyond-better than any other ristorante italiano on the block, a suprise. nice atmosphere, super friendly staff...all around a *very* pleasant evening!
...i'll have to make sure that i return with un altro amico so i can be sure my review isn't too colored by how much i enjoyed being out with my date that night.  (you know that warm, laughing, easy joking banter, happy feeling after sharing a bottle of wine? yeah. like that.)  oh well, questa e la vita...even if he never calls, i still have the memory of that gnocci, right? ;)
author: rachel l.

description: It is what it looks like, a "italian" restaurant in North Beach. Nice service
author: Alex A.

description: There is not really a whole lot to say about this place.  The pasta was good, but it should be if that is their speciality.  It's nice to known the pasta is all made there at the restaurant, so it's fresh and cooked perfectly.  The one bad thing about my experience was the service.  Our server was more interested in talking to his friends all night rather than serve our table.  A couple of times we had to get his attention to get new beers after our glasses had been empty for a while.  We waited for him to come after our meals where done and offer the dessert menu, but that never happened.  Once he finally glanced our way, we just motioned for the check.  I can't say I will go back to this place but the food and location are very good.
author: Rise G.

description: We went in a group of ten and got seated right away! Not sure if thats an anomaly though.  The service was friendly, patient and helpful -- its hard to deal with big groups! I had the vegetarian lasagna and it was very good!! Normally when I go to north beach I try to go somewhere new since there are so many italian restaurants, but this is definitely a place I can see myself going back to!
author: Angeli J.

description: This place has decent Italian food and decent decor although you may be surrounded by quite a few tourists.  But that is hard to avoid in North Beach.
author: Manuela P.

description: OK prices, very nice waitstaff.  And incredible bruschetta, topped with tons of sweet sweet tomatoes!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Good restaurant, great wine (try their whites) and service.  Food is a bit pricey compared to neighboring Italian restaurants, but on the fresh and healthy side.  Good for groups.
author: Megha S.

description: YUM!!!  This place rocks.  My husband and I went here for lunch one Saturday and were really impressed.  The service was great, the food was great and the atmosphere was great too.  They make fresh pasta which is my favorite kind of pasta!  The calamari was cooked perfectly and my husband ordered a dish from the daily specials that was to die for.  It had homemade sausage in ravioli with a creamy mushroom sauce.  I can't wait to go back.  The price was a little high for lunch but we thought it was well worth it.
author: Shagen M.

description:
Very poor experience. We met some friends here and ordered some drinks while our friends finished dinner. The waiter didn't want to give us a separate check but reluctantly agreed to. The drinks arrived and the two vodka-tonics were iced water with lemon in them. We complained to the waiter who informed us it wasn't his fault and that the barman poured the drinks. He was still able to charge $6.50 per drink, however. Didn't want to cause a scene in front of our friends so waited for them to finish dinner and left.

Won't go back.
author: Julian B.

description:
how do we say "not worth it" in Italian?

1.  the hostess was going to add a chair to the tiny table next to the entrance door to seat us 3.  we told her that we'd wait for a better table.

2.  we got a great table outside right under the heater.

3.  waiter took 10 mins. to come to us.  bread and water took another 5.  waiter didnt offer or suggest any wine.

4.  they forgot our salad.  Only one of the appetizer came.  salad was made in haste and the dressing was all vinegar.

5.  main course was decent.  i ordered their Osobucco which was good except 1/2 of it was fatty.  my sis ordered sea bass.  it was a bit over cooked.  it wasn't soft and flaky.   the sauce tasted good.   My bro-in law ordered their crab ravioli which was really good.  If only it wasn't drenched in sauce.  the sauce should be light since the falvour of the crab is rich enough and it should come through.

For dessert we had their chocolate moose and tiramisu.  Moose was delicious.  skip the Tiramisu and get something else instead.

6.  their coffee was cold.  i asked for hot coffee and the waiter was very apologetic and gave me great hot coffee....  except it came after we finished out dessert.

7.   they got so busy that they started putting tables everywhere.  felt a bit sleazy/cheap.

They have potential.  hope they improve on the details.
author: Marcia B.

description: My family and I ate here our last night in San Francisco. It was an overall pleasant and nice restaurant. The food was delicious, and the service was pretty good. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal in the heart of a bustling part of town. However, the food is a little expensive, but it's understandable because of the location and atmosphere of the restaurant. :)
author: S. F.

description: Got some dishes for takeout. Bruschetta (very garlicky, very good but soggy), Chicken al Limone (great!), Pollo Alfredo (mediocre), Osso Bucco (slightly above average), Caesar Salad (pretty good). Prices are pretty reasonable, I think, for North Beach. They did however mess up our order, and they're pretty stingy with the bread on take-outs.
author: Rohan N.

description: I took a out of state friend here a couple of weeks ago after learning about it in a magazine in our hotel room, what a great place. Everything from the food to the service was just great! I will be going back to eat here very soon!
author: jodee s.

description:
My family visited this so called Italian place, and I felt I should go to Trader Joe, just order some frozen dishes and throw them to the microwave... No taste!
And today I found they over charge me about $ 3 and I called the manager, he is very nice. I must found the receipt and go to talk to him or get some short special during next time visit...
I do not want to waste my time and money again.
author: Jacy G.

description: I love this restaurant, I've been there at least 3 times- both with family and my boyfriend- and I've never been disappointed. Although the menu is kinda short, the food is great. The owner is super friendly and so is the rest of the staff. I would definately recommend this place to anyone!
author: Amelia R.

description: Good atmosphere IF you are looking for a traditional touristy kind of place. Very good service. BUT the food was too salty and my Chicken Parmigianna was a little rubbery. The salad and the melon with prosciutto were both very good.  All in all I would give this a restaurant a 6 out of 10 but I probably would not return.
author: Louie R.

description: The Linguine con Calamari was excellent as was everything else.  A tad on the expensive side with lunch coming in at $70
author: Douglas M.

description:
Went here randomly to get my Italian fix. The gnocchi sorrentina was soooooooooo good, and the tomaresca tantalizing. But that's not why they get the 5 stars.

My friends and I were on our way to an ugly holiday sweater party. Maybe it was to save other patrons from our obnoxious sweaters, or the fact that we were obviously going to be entertaining, that the host decided to seat us outside right next to him.

We spent the next 2 hours having a blast joking around with the staff, shouting, "ho-ho-ho!" to recruit random passers by, and jeering at pedestrians quizzically staring-down my friend's headgear. What, you've never seen earmuffs before? Welcome to 1987.

I can't remember the last time I had so much fun at a restaurant. The staff totally made the experience. The ridiculous holiday garb helped.
author: Shannon M.

description: First things first: you're in North Beach, so go ahead, chant a little in your best Indian accent for good parking kharma.  Seriously, I wouldn't tell a lie.  It works.  Drive, chant, wait, chant, hope, chant, park.  Then, head over to Trattoria Pinocchio for honest, classic Italian pasta.  It's going to be tasty, and, again, I would not tell a lie.  The hostess standing outside threw me for a bit of a loop because this is a restaurant and not one of those "other" establishments in North Beach where one commonly finds "barkers" on the sidewalk, skulking about, waiting to lure you in.  But this young woman's countenance was open and inviting, and she wasn't really barking in the least.  I didn't think she would tell a lie.  She recommended the vegetarian lasagna.  I love pasta--and, hello, who wouldn't love pasta layered with yummy stuff? My super friend and I took a chance and went in.  We could have been seated outside, which would have be fun if the night had been warmer, but we opted for an indoor table.  Inside, another hostess seated us immediately, and we had cocktails and bread almost instantaneously.  Nice.  Our waiter spoke Italian, which added to this establishment's authenticity and charm factor.  And yes, I ordered the lasagna.  And yes, yes, yes.  Yes.  It was as fabulous as the hostess promised.  The sauce could have been slightly less pedestrian, which is why I am giving the four-star rating for now. My friend's pasta and pancetta equally pleased and satisfied the hunger inside.  When we left, our outdoor hostess waved us a friendly arrivederci; her nose hadn't grown an inch.  If you honestly desire decent, Italian pasta, no need to wish upon a star--just pop over to Trattoria Pinocchio. Yum.
author: Shadi G.

description: I dined here for brunch. THE BEST EGGS I've ever had in my entire life.  This is my new Sunday brunch spot.
author: Elizabeth O.

description:
The perfect corner in North Beach!  A great place to mingle and meet friends.  Maria & Giovanni really know how to make you feel at home.  They offer delicious Italian food, great service, and friendly atmosphere.  A full bar for that special toast.

Pinocchio's has it all!
author: Fred D.

description:
Good, but could've been better.  

The bread was nondescript...  I enjoy a crisp crust, but this was a little tougher than I like.  I ordered the Ravioli salciccia for my entree.  Good combination of ingredients & nicely flavored, but was barely warm.  

Had the poached pear for dessert...  good, but again, could've been better.  The pear was cold and completely covered in chocolate sauce.  I think it would be better served warm, to bring out the flavors of the wine & spices it was poached in, and serve the chocolate sauce on the side as a dipping sauce.   As it was, the chocolate sauce obliterated the flavor of the pear... could've been a water chestnut for all I know.   

All in all, a decent meal... 

Now, I'm not opposed to paying good money for good food, but charging $3.50 for a diet coke seems a little excessive (I'm not a wine drinker).  And to pay ANOTHER $3.50 for a refill screams rip-off to me.  Next time I'll bring my own.  Definitely a down-note to an otherwise aggeeable meal.  Not bad, but think I'd try another restaurant up or down the street before returning.
author: R S.

description: love the gnocchi.  love the wine selection.  -1 for being a bit too touristy, but i knew what i was getting into when i agreed to a friday night dinner in north beach.  chicken saltimbocca is very good too.  they also have some great outdoor seating - great for people watching.
author: Timothy S.

description: The food here is just OK, not bad. But, what left a bad taste in my mouth was how the waiter handled our change. He rounded the bill up to the nearest dollar and gave us the change - in the restaurant's favor! If he didn't want to give us coins, he should have rounded the bill down to the nearest dollar, in our favor. That would have been the classy move.
author: Bree C.

description: yeah..... confused is this suppose to be good? maybe that's why they have a hot girl at the door asking you to come in for some food.... maybe i ordered the wrong food.. but was my pasta suppose to be cold? and did i have a server or five men coming to my table confused if they were suppose to help me without helping me.. can a place really mess up a belvedere soda? hmm.....
author: Nina M.

description: i swear when i go to North Beach i always attempt to try new places....yet i always find myself coming here...i dont know if its the animated waiters or just that the food is just plain awesome. I came here yesterday with my mom and we both had a glass of the Kopriva Chardonnay...very smooth and fruit forward....we booth shared a caesar which i love because although i love the flavor of anchovies i dont like to eat them! their dressing is the best of both worlds for meno anchovies but lots of anchovie flavor (i guess im just weird like that)!! my mom opted for eggplant parm which neither of us have had in a really long time. it was thick and not soggy like some eggplant parms tend to be. the breading was lite and it was served with roasted potatoes and veggies...i ordered one of the chef's weekly specials. homemade tagliatelle ( basically homemade linguine) with spicy italian sausage, mushrooms and a spicy creamy tomato sauce that was TO DIE FOR! i was so full but it was so good and i just ate the whole thing...ahhhh.....we finished with the usual (skip dessert lol) and opt for two double decaf (for mom) and regular for me espresso...they use illy brand coffe and you can tell...its my favorite and its pricy but soo worth it...bunogiorno and ciao pinocchio!
author: shannon b.

description: for some reason this is my favorite place in north beach.   i guess even because it's so small and we always get seated by the door the pomodoro sauce is delicious.  that's how i judge an italian restaurant--by the quality of their simplest dish.  the tomatoes and basil are incredibly fresh and and olive oil is creamy and delicious.  this freshness and attention to detail shows in all the dishes i've tried and all of my dining companions have agreed.  pinocchio will have my business every time i'm in north beach!
author: kate s.

description: b and i went here last nite after seeing beach blanket babylon. im not a big fan of italian food, but he is. since we were in north beach, might as well eat there. plus, its open late. north beach reminds me of north end back in boston, only more touristy. the places there were more authentic seeming than this. we were seated right away, got some bread and oil, which was good. i had the chicken something that begins with an s. ive had it other places. it has proscutto and mozzerella and ive always liked it, and liked it here as well. i chose a side of angel hair, which was good. b had shrimps in a white sauce, and angel hair. he liked it (he's been there before). i think it was good, not great, not bad. average. i did enjoy my food a lot but i probably would try someplace else next time. although i wouldnt be sad if i did end up there again.
author: Merredith L.

description: This place was ok. We went before the dinner rush and got seated right away. I got the eggplant parmesan it was good, but it had a bit too much mozzarella (and a little pricey). However the espresso drinks were very well made. If I go back I think I will just order some appetizers, espresso, and sit out side under those great looking heat lamps.
author: John B.

description: I tried this restaurant on a whim & it was fantastic. My friend & I sat at the bar since the restaurant was packed & we were served by the friendliest bartender who kept us entertained throughout the meal. The servers were very attentive & the food was delicious. I ordered the limone chicken & my friend ordered fettucini with salmon & pink sauce. At the end of the night we left with smiles on our faces & satisfied stomachs. This is a place I'd definitely come back to.
author: Stephanie B.

description: I don't know exactly what other Sicilian cooking I've had, but this definitely doesn't top my list of Italian Restaurants.  The Seafood Pasta I ordered was just OK. My friend had chicken parmigiana that was bland in my taste.  Maybe this part of Italy doesn't use a lot of flavor.  I've also heard that American Italian is more rich in flavor than authentic Italian, so I may be accustomed to the more garlic infused flavorful Italian.  Also, the service was lacking.  We were left waiting for our main course for over 20 minutes and nothing to drink.
author: Rachel S.

description: This has been one of my favorite North Beach spots for several years.  Yesterday I ate there again for the first time in awhile.  My favorite dish, Gnocchi Enzo, Pinocchio's homemade gnocchi in gorgonzola cream sauce, was just as fresh and delicious and filling as ever.  My companion had Rigatoni Giovanni, Kalamatta olives, eggplant, fresh mozzarella in a tomato garlic sauce.  She loved it.  Despite being garlic sauce it was not too garlicky.  We shared Spinach Salad, Gorgonzola, orange fragmente and lemon vinaigrette, which was fresh but a bit dull, it could have used more orange segments or some pinenuts.  The bread served with dinner is pretty good.  The prices haev risen in the last couple of years and the online menu as of this writing does not reflect the actual prices, so you need to add a couple of dollars to most dishes.  I hope they do not raise their prices too much more as there are many other North Beach pasta spots that are about equally as good for less money.  I do like the decor of the restaurant, the outdoor seating is nice.  Our waiter was attentive and the food came pretty quickly despite being a busy dinnertime rush.  I will go back again as long as the quality remains constantly high, though I am wary of the raising prices.
author: Richard W.

description: nice looking place that seems comfortable, pleasant hostess, waiter came and took our order, we received fairly average meals that were unobjectionable if not much better than you can easily whip up at home...waiter never came by to ask if we wanted more bread (unlike the waiter the next table had...we had to ask for more bread) and waiter never asked if we wanted wine/beer/etc. Guess we looked like tee-totalers. Bill came, submitted credit card...5 minutes later waiter comes back, says it didnt go through try another...submitted 2nd card...another 5 minutes waiter says oh it isnt your card, our machine is broken, need to take bill upstairs to run through machine in office, will only take 5 minutes....a full 35 minutes later we finally get bill with hurried thanks for the wait...I would have expected a good percentage off the bill or a comp'ed dessert or two...but nothing. Well, that's the last time we go here...expect it doesnt matter to them though, enough tourists abound to take up the slack.
author: Tom B.

description: The food is delicious! To die for good! I highly recommend Pinocchio's. We had my parents 50th anniversary celebration there and all of my guests raved about the place! You have got to try it!
author: Anita c.

description: One of the waiters here is a dead ringer for Johnny Depp.  So there's a star right there.  This is always a good fallback option since it's open on Mondays (unlike a number of places in the area), and half of their outdoor seating is along a quieter street (Vallejo), so you don't have to sit amidst the Columbus foot traffic if you prefer quiet over people watching.  The food is good -- not quite as good as De Lucchi one block up, but definitely enough to bring us back reasonably often.
author: S J.

description: It was getting late on a Monday and we were hungry. I was sure we weren't going to find anyone serving food in North Beach and weren't having any luck until we walk by a pleasant hostess at Pinocchio inviting us in. Hooray! Being in the mood for basic Italian food we ordered chicken parm, angel hair pasta with red sauce and a caesar salad. No complaints about the food. It was all very good, but I felt like I needed to eat it asap because of the hovering server. Why would the hostess let us in late only to have the server make us feel like it was time for him to go home? What further confused me is that they let in 3 more parties after us, but they had a different server. Why didn't they give us the server who was going to stay late? Probably won't be back because when I think of Pinocchio's I think of rushed service, not the food.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: We went to this place last night....  It was great...  We wee greated warmly by the hostes...  Our server was very friendly and nice guy,,, He recemoded us some good choices...  Their Appitsers, and Main course were excellent..  Bruschetta was amazing and different then other restaruant.....  Pasta were good and so ws their Veil...  I would highly recemond this place, great to visit with family and friendly.....
author: Aman v.

description: One star ONLY because good food.  Last night a friend and I decided to go to North Beach for dinner.  Every place was very crowded but we had both heard good comments about the food. It was about 6:45 pm.  We requested a table inside and the hostess said that it would be about 10 minutes.  So we waited, and waited and after about 30 or 40 minutes I noticed that there were a lot of empty 2 tops.  When I pointed it out to the hostess she told me that the manager had told both hostesses not to seat any more tables because the kitchen was backed up.  If I hadn't asked we would never had known.  Finally, without any apology or complimentary anything for making us wait, we were seated.  The food and service was very good and fast. Our server was apologetic but seemed embarassed.  After our meal he sent the manager over to talk to us because he had told her that we were annoyed by the unexplained wait outside in the cold.  She was rather snotty and said that most restaurants do the same thing when there is a backup in the kitchen.  They simply don't let anyone in.  Well I have eaten in many restaurants, have had to wait, but have never not been seated because of kitchen backup.  Most places would seat you, explain what was going on and bring you a glass of wine and bread, or at least water.  Not this place.  Maybe they can fool the tourists with their attitude.  However, as good as the food was I wouldn't even think of recommending the restaurant or eating there again.  Oh, and a man, who we  were informed was the owner, in an Hawaiian shirt, just kept wandering around blasting little bits of song in everyone's ear.  Weird and EXTREMELY rude restaurant!!!!   Janet
author: Janet M.

description: I think the food is ok and the restaurant is pretty nice, the windows along one side of the restaurant really enhance the atmosphere.  I have eaten at this restaurant in the past (3 years ago), split a pizza at the bar with my husband and a couple drinks.  We loved it, so we took our parents there while they were visiting.  The biggest problem that I have with the place is that it wasn't very clean.  Two of the four side plates needed to be replaced once we sat down, mine had a one inch piece of cheese baked into it from the dishwasher and my husband's looked as though someone had eaten off of it already.  The next bad thing that happened was a string from a rag wound up in my husband's water glass... ick!  And to top it off, I had an upset stomach and diarrhea the following morning.  Hmmm...  I wouldn't have suspected the restaurant were at fault for this had we not experienced such filth while dining there.  I was pretty bummed by the experience since it really wasn't really a cheap meal.  I would stay away from this restaurant unfortunately... or stick with a pizza and a few cocktails.
author: L G.

description: i went with my family and friends. we were amazed by both the quality of and the price. the food was delicious and fresh. i had the gnocchi enzo, the sauce was rich and the pasta was fresh- a killer combination. my dad had some sort of meat tortellini in a rich creamy sauce simillar to mine, it too was great. the food was authentic, the service was OK, (my glass was empty and they only filled it up right as we were leaving) but the price was rather high. almost every item was over $20-22. to sum it all up, this place has great authentic italian food but at an outrageous price
author: Christopher D.

description: i love this place, and go to it everytime i am in the city! have recommended it to everyone i know, and have not heard any bad comments back!!!
author: CHAD JAYSON S.

description: i work inthis neighborhood and go here all the time. the food is really excellent. i think it is important not to order something you don't usually get. i feel like bad reviews are from people who order food that tastes exactly as you'd epect.
author: megan f.
